story:
Picture this:

You get the ball rolling on a huge project (second album) and you find out you're pregnant. Four months into this pregnancy, you travel to England to showcase and promote this project and the world shuts down shortly after. You lose your job(s), give birth in a pandemic and are unable to travel to finish this project so you send tracks to your producers, Stuart Cameron (The Heartbroken, Crash Test Dummies) and Peter Fusco (The Heartbroken, Matthew Good), that you've recorded in your bedroom between feedings and naps, all the while figuring out how to be a mother. The road to "Joan" has been a long and winding one. 

If you don't know already, my name is Alicia Toner and I'm a singer/songwriter living in Charlottetown, PE. Even though Prince Edward Island is my chosen home, I was born and raised in Fredericton, NB, lived in Toronto, ON for 10 years and have travelled all over this country, living in different cities as an actor/musician. 

Growing up in Fredericton I was surrounded by music from a young age. I started singing at 5 years old, playing violin at 7 and performing for people probably as soon as I could speak. I was a member of the New Brunswick Youth Orchestra for 4 years and was lucky enough to play Carnegie Hall with them. I started performing in musicals in high school which led me to study Musical Theatre at Sheridan College in Ontario and launched a 10 year career as an actor/musician. I’ve been in shows produced by Mirvish Productions, Soulpepper and the Charlottetown Festival among many others. In 2015, while performing in the Mirvish production of “Once”, I was introduced to Stuart Cameron (The Heartbroken, Crash Test Dummies) and made a sharp left turn in my career. I started recording songs I had written and released my first album, "I Learned The Hard Way”, produced by Stuart and Peter Fusco (The Heartbroken, Matthew Good). That album earned me a SOCAN Songwriter of the Year award, got some national recognition and some serious radio play, so here we are again. Same producers, same me, better songs. Album number 2.

"Joan" is something I'm incredibly proud of. I don't say that lightly. I am my toughest critic and to prove it to you I'll say this: looking back, I think my first album is scattered and in-cohesive. I didn't know who I was as a songwriter. I was finding my legs. This new album is grounded and represents a cohesive moment in time. It feels like an experience. I've never been so proud of anything I've done. I cannot wait to share it with you. 

The making of "Joan" was full of road blocks. These songs have been patient while I secured funding to get this project off the ground and recording started back in October 2019 before I knew if we'd be able to finish it. Stuart Cameron and Peter Fusco once again lent their incredible talents not solely as producers but as the two primary musicians on the album. Peter also engineered many of tracks as well as mixed them all. Dream House Studios, with Engineer Calvin Hartwick, is where we tracked drums (Jody Brumell) and some vocals. Once again, the incomparable Joey Landreth lent his stunning voice and masterful guitar playing to some tracks. This was all accomplished in October 2019 for part of the album. It was then my partner and I found out we were expecting a very different surprise.

The imminent arrival of my daughter, Zoe, put an unexpected twist on the arrival of this album. Not as much of a twist, however, as a global pandemic that left us out of work and unable to get back to Toronto to finish things up. Luckily, technology being what it is these days, "Joan" was finished with me in my bedroom tracking vocals and sending them to Toronto. A baby and an album were born.

The name "Joan" is a significant one. It's my middle name but many people close to me have used it as my first since I was born. It's a part of me that not everyone gets to see, much like these songs. Calling this album "Joan" was my way of self-titling what feels like my debut.  

'Joan' album cover art. Graphic Design by hastelow&co, photo by Colton Curtis.

SO!

Where do you come in? I'm nearly at the finish line with this brain-child of mine, I just need a bit of help getting there. If you decide to become a backer (thank you!), your help will enable me to manufacture physical vinyl and CDs and cover extra marketing costs to get the word out there that this album has arrived. 

I need about $5000 to get this album made and properly supported. Here's where your money will go:

-Manufacturing CDs & vinyl 

-MERCH - fun things for you to wear and promote the album!

-Sending 3rd single to radio (including delivery/tracking)

-PR for singles & album (press releases, interviews, articles, reviews etc.)

What's in it for you?? I'd never ask for your money without giving you something in return. Think of this as pre-ordering the album so I can make it for you. There is also a long list of perks to choose from if you feel like getting more than the physical copy. Ever wanted a t-shirt with my name on it? Now you can have one! A signed copy of "Joan" on vinyl with a love note from me to you? You got it! Feeling super generous and want a private livestream concert for you and your friends within your bubble? Look no more! There are many options and they all come with my ENDLESS thanks and gratitude. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're reading this and you're not in a place to pre-order the album, here's how you can help:

SPREAD THE WORD!

Share this campaign, tell a friend, tell a friend to tell a friend, tell a friend to share this campaign and tell one of their friends... you get the idea. Word of mouth, I believe, is still the best way to promote anything. If I hear it from a friend, I'm 10x more likely to do it. 

 

If you've made it this far, thank you. Your support truly does mean the world to me. If you decide to become a backer of this project I'll be keeping you up to date on all things "Joan". 

With all my heart,

Alicia

story:
Finishing "Our 2nd and Final Album" Strong!

Our former band L'elan Vital needs your help to finish our long awaited (maybe forgotten?) second and final album. 

L'elan Vital recorded our sophomore album in 2008 in Denver, Colorado. But Brandon (the hairy Energizer Bunny driving the band) moved to San Francisco for hippie business school in 2009 and, sadly, the album was left unfinished. Notable tracks on the album include: (1) a song recorded iteratively at every recording session over the five years of our bandhood (2) possibly our most angelic song (3) songs featured in the award winning movie Pelada and (4) a song that incorrectly predicted a blissful future society starting on Dec 21, 2012... oops.

In the ensuing years of hippie entrepreneuring, Brandon found occasional moments to edit the album and after seven years, it was ready for mixing and mastering. L'elan Vital violinist Sam Gathman volunteered to complete this final task. Nearing the closing moments of the mixing process, Sam made a life choice, quit his life-long music career and sold all his music gear. Without Sam's recording system, the nearly finished "Our 2nd and Final Album" was left uneditable by other recording engineers and the original unmixed album was again marooned on Brandon's computer...

Five years later, when the pandemic of 2020 hit and Brandon's DJ business came silently screeching to a halt, he realized it was the perfect time to finish editing the album. Dusting off his old ProTools skills, over the lonely months, Brandon exchanged Netflix binging for time editing the album. Having seen zero episodes of Stranger Things, finally, "Our 2nd and Final Album" is ready to be Mixed and Mastered!

What We Need

  • We need to raise $5000 including $3000 for the Mixing and Mastering and $2000 to press "Our 2nd and Final Album" to Vinyl! The more we raise, the better engineer we can afford and the better our final album will sound for you and your grandchildren to enjoy!

What You Get

  • $11 ::: Favorite playlists from L'elan Vital members
  • $22 ::: L'elan Vital's debut album "The Wink & The Gun" on CD or Digital
  • $33 ::: "Our 2nd and Final Album" exploding beautifully in your headphones or blasting in your Tesla/Hyundai /F150
  • $55 ::: L'elan Vital Discography - Every song we've ever made!
  • $66 ::: Musical Greeting Card - serenading whoever you like
  • $77 ::: "Our 2nd and Final Album" on Vinyl, Brand New, 13 years old...
  • $88 ::: L'elan Vital's debut album "The Wink & The Gun" pressed in an extremely limited Clear-Vinyl 2xLP album! (only 24 copies!)
  • $333 ::: New Custom & Personalized L'elan Vital music, written and recorded just for you!
    • Brandon will write & record four acoustic songs with four supporters. A song for someone you love, for your non-profit, your dog, or just for you - cause you’re worth it!
  • $777 ::: The classic 12-string guitar Brandon used to record all of L'elan Vital's music, signed. 
  • By helping fund our band's final act, you get your name printed in our “Thank You” liner notes, so your name will gloriously live on and on and on...

The Impact

Why would funding "Our 2nd and Final Album" be good for the world?

  • It just feels great to be excited about artistic creation instead of terrified or enraged watching the news.
  • Closing loops feels like finishing a good mystery book, or successfully fixing an Air Fryer that Cuisinart made nearly impossible to take apart... but you tore the sucker apart and despite suffering multiple wounds and spending more time than the cost of new Air Fryer, the damn thing works now damn it! 
  • Helping the underdog is just a sweet thing to do. Have you ever helped a crying five-year-old tie their shoes? You can think of us as that toddler. 

Risks & Challenges

If we don't raise enough money for a good engineer, we may have to just run the whole album through T-Pain Autotune...

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot afford to help us right now, no worries—we've been there. But you could still help us resurrect the vibe of the late 2000s music scene by sharing this album with humans or groups you know.

  • You could email, direct message or text 3 people that still love real, live rock music!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
This album contains 12 songs. From Roy Ayers and Jazz Octet to traditional Taiwanese songs and contemporary marimba quartet. I am on vibraphone and marimba with Richie Goods - Producer, Acoustic bass and electric bass, Shedrick Mitchell on piano and organ, Allan Mednard on drums, Ismel Wignall on percussion, Jeremy Pelt on trumpet, Quintin Zoto on Guitar, Yoonjin Park on Violin and Phoebe Tsai on Cello. 

此張專輯共有12首樂曲，你可以在裡面聽到從靈魂樂鼻祖Roy Ayers到中文老歌改編，爵士八重奏到木琴四重奏，各種不同聲響色彩。我在專輯中演奏鐵琴、木琴，我的製作人是Richie Goods ，他同時也是貝斯手；Shedrick Mitchell 為鋼琴、管風琴手；Allan Mednard 為鼓手；Ismel Wignall為打擊樂手；Jeremy Pelt 為小號手；Quintin Zoto為吉他手；Yoojin Park為小提琴手；Phoebe Tsai為大提琴手。

This is my debut album, it’s a completely self-produced project, I’m doing it without the support of a record label. It requires lots of energy to overcome obstacles and challenge myself to handle multi-tasks under limited budget, time and resources. I’m learning so much in this process. Also, the most wonderful thing about making my own record is that I get to talk to every all of you guys. If I have no communication and connection with you all, I wouldn’t be able to make music. So even if you can’t donate, that’s all good. You can just talk to me, send me messages. Or even better, share this project with your friends.

這是我的第一張專輯，此張專輯選擇獨立發行，不與唱片公司簽約，一個人獨立發行，除了要克服中間遇到的困難，還得在有限的時間、金錢、資源內創造出最好的音樂並且呈現出來。過程很痛苦，但我也學習到很多，最重要的是，獨立發行創造了一個跟大家連結的機會，如果音樂沒有了人與人之間的溝同、支持、分享、連結，那我覺得我也不用做音樂了，或著說我根本不可能有機會做音樂。所以！你再讀此篇文章時，發覺自己無法捐款，沒關係，幫我分享連結也很棒！或著想要訊息我，也歡迎！

I grew up and was raised in Taiwan.  I was a classical/contemporary percussionist. My college and grad school life in Taiwan was all about how to push my contemporary playing and how to interpret original composers’ materiel to the next level. I was in a world renowned percussion ensemble called “Ju Percussion Group” and we toured quite often in China, Singapore, Thailand and other Asian countries. The group collaborated with traditional artist in Asia including Peking Opera, dance. I was always fascinated by the two different art forms combined together. I applied these concepts to the tracks “The Path” and “Blossom in a Stormy Night” on this debut album. In 2015 I came to the States to study Jazz music. I was in a grad school program at University of the Arts in Philadelphia. By immersing myself in the Philly Jazz scene and learning the jazz language I started to feel the contrast between my culture and the art form Jazz. I feel that the music of the album is the result of the unique experience of merging two cultures, Taiwanese and American, which sometimes complements and sometimes contradicts each other.  There is courage, insanity and passion combined with Taiwanese lyricism and nostalgia. There is chaos and peace, questions and statements, powerful, delicate, and most of all, the in-depth search for the bigger meaning and truth.” Richie Goods is the producer for this record, he also arranged “Invitation”, “Blue in Green” and “The Path”.

我從小在台灣長大，一直以來都是演奏古典音樂以及當代打擊樂作品。我在大學和研究所期間，都在鑽研如何把原創者的作品詮釋得淋漓盡致，鞭策自己的演奏能力到極限！我在台灣期間曾為朱宗慶打擊樂團的團員，隨團我在台灣、亞洲各地巡迴演出。團裡演出的內容時常結合京劇鑼鼓、台灣本土元素的音樂以及舞蹈，這些都讓我體會到自身文化下音樂的能量。2015年我來到美國費城，費城為爵士樂重鎮，許多知名的爵士樂手都出於此地，我在當地爵士酒吧與費城本土樂手互相切磋，每天把自己浸淫在爵士樂最真的語彙之中。此張專輯《行》便是集結一路走來所學，體驗過美國與台灣文化之經驗，將此個人經歷譜寫成曲，例如專輯中主打創作曲《行》（The Path）我寫了四台木琴作為序奏，和聲上運用到五聲音階聲響，製造傳統歌謠的聲響色彩。在錄音室，我單獨演奏每個聲部，最後把四個軌道放在一起，變成木琴四重奏，加上大鼓以及鐵琴拉功技法來拓增聲響，使我一人演奏聽起來是整個打擊樂團，序奏拉開後，鋼琴、低音提琴、鼓的加入，讓原本五聲音階氛圍，再也不侷限古典音樂聲響，而是邁入多樂器間不斷溝通對話，碰撞出火花和藉由曲中即興片段展現當下的創造力。

Now, I need your help to complete the production for this album. I’ve recorded all the music so the funds I raise will be used for the mixing, mastering of the recording, the artwork, CD printing, cover song licensing. And I am also going to produce videos for this music. If I get extra money, it will be used for touring with my band. Here's just the most essential parts of what our price breakdown looks like:

為了完成這張專輯，我需要你的幫忙。我已經錄好全部的音樂，所以募資得到的錢，我會用在混音、專輯封面設計、專輯印製費、版權費、樂手費以及宣傳之影片。如果有餘款，則會直接用在支持我的樂團日後巡迴演出的費用上，在此我提供款項之用途及項目：  

  • Cover Song licensing（版權費）: $1,000
  • Studios & instrument rental（錄音室及樂器租借）: $3,100
  • Artwork and graphic motion（專輯封面設計費及音樂影像製作費）: $3,000
  • Videographer（攝影師費用）: 1,000
  • Mastering（混音）: $1,000
  • PR（宣傳費）: 2,100
  • CD printing（專輯印製費）: $1,500

It is also my pleasure to finally announce the track list for the album! You can expect to see:

曲目如下：

  • We Live in Brooklyn Baby （布魯克林之夢）
  • Invitation （邀請函）
  • Blind Faith（盲目信仰）
  • The Path Interlude 1（行一）
  • Blossom in a Stormy Night （雨夜花）
  • Blue in Green （綠中藍）
  • The Path Interlude 2 （行二）
  • The Imaginary Enemy （假想敵）
  • Tears in Love （愛中淚）
  • The Path Interlude 3 （行三）
  • The Path （行）
  • Mo’ Betta Blues （愛情至上）

I appreciate every bit that you all contribute to me very much. I am not just talking about funding, either. I understand that the world's current situation is hitting everyone hard right now, so if you still would like to help, the best thing you could do is to tell your friends about what I am doing! If you love good music, you can help me out massively by sharing this campaign with people you know. Thank you so much, everybody.

我非常感謝各位，在此我不想只談募資、錢等，我知道現在世界是個混亂、未知的階段。大家都辛苦了，但如果你還有餘力，願意參與，最好的方式是幫我分享給你的朋友、家人。如果你單純就愛好的音樂，就請幫我分享分享再分享。謝謝！

 

Mixing & Mastering by Dave Darlington

Video by Stephen Pyo

Photo by Tracy yang, Po Yao Shih
story_txt:
This album contains 12 songs. From Roy Ayers and Jazz Octet to traditional Taiwanese songs and contemporary marimba quartet. I am on vibraphone and marimba with Richie Goods - Producer, Acoustic bass and electric bass, Shedrick Mitchell on piano and organ, Allan Mednard on drums, Ismel Wignall on percussion, Jeremy Pelt on trumpet, Quintin Zoto on Guitar, Yoonjin Park on Violin and Phoebe Tsai on Cello. 此張專輯共有12首樂曲，你可以在裡面聽到從靈魂樂鼻祖Roy Ayers到中文老歌改編，爵士八重奏到木琴四重奏，各種不同聲響色彩。我在專輯中演奏鐵琴、木琴，我的製作人是Richie Goods ，他同時也是貝斯手；Shedrick Mitchell 為鋼琴、管風琴手；Allan Mednard 為鼓手；Ismel Wignall為打擊樂手；Jeremy Pelt 為小號手；Quintin Zoto為吉他手；Yoojin Park為小提琴手；Phoebe Tsai為大提琴手。This is my debut album, it’s a completely self-produced project, I’m doing it without the support of a record label. It requires lots of energy to overcome obstacles and challenge myself to handle multi-tasks under limited budget, time and resources. I’m learning so much in this process. Also, the most wonderful thing about making my own record is that I get to talk to every all of you guys. If I have no communication and connection with you all, I wouldn’t be able to make music. So even if you can’t donate, that’s all good. You can just talk to me, send me messages. Or even better, share this project with your friends.這是我的第一張專輯，此張專輯選擇獨立發行，不與唱片公司簽約，一個人獨立發行，除了要克服中間遇到的困難，還得在有限的時間、金錢、資源內創造出最好的音樂並且呈現出來。過程很痛苦，但我也學習到很多，最重要的是，獨立發行創造了一個跟大家連結的機會，如果音樂沒有了人與人之間的溝同、支持、分享、連結，那我覺得我也不用做音樂了，或著說我根本不可能有機會做音樂。所以！你再讀此篇文章時，發覺自己無法捐款，沒關係，幫我分享連結也很棒！或著想要訊息我，也歡迎！I grew up and was raised in Taiwan.  I was a classical/contemporary percussionist. My college and grad school life in Taiwan was all about how to push my contemporary playing and how to interpret original composers’ materiel to the next level. I was in a world renowned percussion ensemble called “Ju Percussion Group” and we toured quite often in China, Singapore, Thailand and other Asian countries. The group collaborated with traditional artist in Asia including Peking Opera, dance. I was always fascinated by the two different art forms combined together. I applied these concepts to the tracks “The Path” and “Blossom in a Stormy Night” on this debut album. In 2015 I came to the States to study Jazz music. I was in a grad school program at University of the Arts in Philadelphia. By immersing myself in the Philly Jazz scene and learning the jazz language I started to feel the contrast between my culture and the art form Jazz. I feel that the music of the album is the result of the unique experience of merging two cultures, Taiwanese and American, which sometimes complements and sometimes contradicts each other.  There is courage, insanity and passion combined with Taiwanese lyricism and nostalgia. There is chaos and peace, questions and statements, powerful, delicate, and most of all, the in-depth search for the bigger meaning and truth.” Richie Goods is the producer for this record, he also arranged “Invitation”, “Blue in Green” and “The Path”.我從小在台灣長大，一直以來都是演奏古典音樂以及當代打擊樂作品。我在大學和研究所期間，都在鑽研如何把原創者的作品詮釋得淋漓盡致，鞭策自己的演奏能力到極限！我在台灣期間曾為朱宗慶打擊樂團的團員，隨團我在台灣、亞洲各地巡迴演出。團裡演出的內容時常結合京劇鑼鼓、台灣本土元素的音樂以及舞蹈，這些都讓我體會到自身文化下音樂的能量。2015年我來到美國費城，費城為爵士樂重鎮，許多知名的爵士樂手都出於此地，我在當地爵士酒吧與費城本土樂手互相切磋，每天把自己浸淫在爵士樂最真的語彙之中。此張專輯《行》便是集結一路走來所學，體驗過美國與台灣文化之經驗，將此個人經歷譜寫成曲，例如專輯中主打創作曲《行》（The Path）我寫了四台木琴作為序奏，和聲上運用到五聲音階聲響，製造傳統歌謠的聲響色彩。在錄音室，我單獨演奏每個聲部，最後把四個軌道放在一起，變成木琴四重奏，加上大鼓以及鐵琴拉功技法來拓增聲響，使我一人演奏聽起來是整個打擊樂團，序奏拉開後，鋼琴、低音提琴、鼓的加入，讓原本五聲音階氛圍，再也不侷限古典音樂聲響，而是邁入多樂器間不斷溝通對話，碰撞出火花和藉由曲中即興片段展現當下的創造力。Now, I need your help to complete the production for this album. I’ve recorded all the music so the funds I raise will be used for the mixing, mastering of the recording, the artwork, CD printing, cover song licensing. And I am also going to produce videos for this music. If I get extra money, it will be used for touring with my band. Here's just the most essential parts of what our price breakdown looks like:為了完成這張專輯，我需要你的幫忙。我已經錄好全部的音樂，所以募資得到的錢，我會用在混音、專輯封面設計、專輯印製費、版權費、樂手費以及宣傳之影片。如果有餘款，則會直接用在支持我的樂團日後巡迴演出的費用上，在此我提供款項之用途及項目：  
Cover Song licensing（版權費）: $1,000
Studios & instrument rental（錄音室及樂器租借）: $3,100
Artwork and graphic motion（專輯封面設計費及音樂影像製作費）: $3,000
Videographer（攝影師費用）: 1,000
Mastering（混音）: $1,000
PR（宣傳費）: 2,100
CD printing（專輯印製費）: $1,500
It is also my pleasure to finally announce the track list for the album! You can expect to see:曲目如下：
We Live in Brooklyn Baby （布魯克林之夢）
Invitation （邀請函）
Blind Faith（盲目信仰）
The Path Interlude 1（行一）
Blossom in a Stormy Night （雨夜花）
Blue in Green （綠中藍）
The Path Interlude 2 （行二）
The Imaginary Enemy （假想敵）
Tears in Love （愛中淚）
The Path Interlude 3 （行三）
The Path （行）
Mo’ Betta Blues （愛情至上）
I appreciate every bit that you all contribute to me very much. I am not just talking about funding, either. I understand that the world's current situation is hitting everyone hard right now, so if you still would like to help, the best thing you could do is to tell your friends about what I am doing! If you love good music, you can help me out massively by sharing this campaign with people you know. Thank you so much, everybody.我非常感謝各位，在此我不想只談募資、錢等，我知道現在世界是個混亂、未知的階段。大家都辛苦了，但如果你還有餘力，願意參與，最好的方式是幫我分享給你的朋友、家人。如果你單純就愛好的音樂，就請幫我分享分享再分享。謝謝！ Mixing & Mastering by Dave DarlingtonVideo by Stephen PyoPhoto by Tracy yang, Po Yao Shih

story:
Hello! My name is Grace and I am a violist, creator, and educator.

I have been studying at The Curtis Institute of Music in Philadelphia, PA for the past three years and was previously at The Juilliard School, McGill University. 

Music has always been a huge part of my life. My mom always had music playing in the background everywhere around the house when I was growing up. I started playing the violin at the age of four and piano at the age of six. Music became the way I began and ended my day. It helped me clear my head, process emotions, and connect with myself. 

Project Storytelling is an 8-week program via Zoom for 2nd graders that combines music and literacy education.

 I am so grateful for all of the opportunities that I've had in my life that I want to create similar opportunities for the next generation of leaders and global citizens. 

Learning for students has been extremely difficult due to the pandemic, where many students may have found themselves feeling disconnected and falling behind in their work. So that is when I asked myself, 

"How can music encourage a love of learning and reading?"

This program was created around this question of fostering creativity, love, and curiosity for music and literacy education. 

With the help of six guest artists, we will break down the basic story elements (character, plot, setting, and conflict/resolution) in both books and music. The students will write their own short story and composition that goes along with their story. There will be a final concert at the end of the program where the students will be able to share their stories and compositions with friends and family. 

We have already raised $1200.00 of our $2k goal. That's 60%!! We only need another $800.00 to make Project Storytelling a success.

All of the funds will go to paying our amazing lineup of artists, class materials, books for the students, teaching materials that will help enhance the Zoom classroom experience! 

There are 4 donation perks! 

This is my first time organizing a project and it is exciting but also very nerve-wracking as well! I have learned a lot from the process already and I am excited to learn more as the project comes more to life. Performing and presenting for young students has always been fun and uplifting as I always find myself coming out of those experiences inspired by the innate creativity and knowledge all of these students have within them. 

I would like to thank Joseph Hart and the Symphony in C organization that has partnered with me for this project. 

It would also mean a lot to me if you could share my fundraiser link on social media. The more exposure I get, the faster I will reach my fundraising goal! 

Thank you so much! 

Grace

story:
Introduction

In the past 2 years I have been releasing a song at a time in a "digital single" format.  It has been a very fun project becoming a solo-artist after many years of playing in various bands regionally.  After growing success from the release of these songs I have realized that I have a strong desire to release a concise, well-recorded album that represents my best unreleased songwriting over the past 20 years. 

What I need and what you will receive

Over the last couple months I have been in deep discussions with my friend and Vancouver based musician/producer JP Maurice about recording an EP.  After some deep digging into old demos, song ideas, and rough song sketches, I've discovered that I have more than enough to release an LP (9+ songs).  

That being said, this fundraising success will determine how many songs I am able to produce.  Roughly speaking a working class frugal recording can be achieved at about $1000 per song, mixed.  My initial plan was to record the best 3-4 songs and release as an EP but I feel that a longer and more expansive recording will be more impactful on my music career.  

In return for asking for help to achieve my goal I will be offering you a number of packages to suit every budget. Every single penny counts and is appreciated, even a small $15 donation.  Take a look at each perk for more details on my offerings.  I appreciate your consideration in joining me on this project. 

The Impact

Upon completion of my recording I plan on performing throughout the region.  I cannot wait to meet you in person and shake your hand and cannot wait thank you for your help personally.  I have budgeted for publicity & radio promotion within my goal and hope that this recording reaches the widest national audience in my career and that you will join me in the successes that will follow.  

Upon release of the album I will be holding regional launch parties where I will perform the songs live.  Something that is really close to my heart and I feel is important in this pitch is a charity element.  Long term affordable lodgings at the Easter Seals house here in Vancouver is so important to many people who are being treated themselves or are supporting a loved one but live outside of the Lower Mainland of BC.  Many are young families with children being treated for cancer or other severe and life-threatening illness.  Partial proceeds of the launch of my album will go to this amazing charity.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking the time to read this pitch.  If you are unable to donate I would appreciate a share on Facebook, Twitter, or email.  I would love to send you a copy of my newest song "Brian Jones (the Death of the Rolling Stones)" by email for taking the time to help spread the word!

story:
Last year I was offered the opportunity to join The B Movie Monsters as guitarist for their upcoming tour, in support of The Other. Being a huge fan and active participant of this music genre, I jumped at the chance. My guitar rig is dialed in, I've acquired a proper mini bus to move us from one venue to the next, and have sorted out transporting and back-lining The Other - saving everyone some hassle and money.

Once we finish the last date in Las Vegas, on March 16th, the members of my own band, HadesMachine, will be joining me for the return route, playing some shows and seeing some sights - our first long distance outing as a group. The final piece of preparation is making sure we've adequate funds for fuel and accommodations.

We're not looking for hand outs - we are strong supporters of DIY efforts, and produce our own merchandise as much as possible. To help pitch in and make this tour happen, I'm contributing my own merchandise, including our brand new HadesMachine "Curse of the Mummy" shirt!  Between now and February 20th, these shirts will be hot off the press, created by us, for you. Every sale puts a few more gallons in the tank, and gets us closer to the next show.

- Jake Hades, 1/23/16

story:
STARBREAKERS - The Ultimate Showcase is a multi-purpose live  concert showcase with performances of emerging  Hip Hop, R&B and Pop artists, designed to break their music worldwide.  

  • Artists selected will be based on their music quality for radio airplay, being performance ready in concert plus their taken steps of self-promotion to gain mainstream exposure and acceptance.  Complete funding will incubate a level playing field for promotion across multiple platforms and distribution systems.
  • This concept was envisioned as there is a pool of undiscovered talent the world has yet to see.  Tight listed stations and formats have prevented the public and some deejays the joy of discovering new music or seeing indie artists live unless promoted through a major label or corporate media.
  • Primed by the overwhelming hunger for music diversity, substantiates a movement to circumvent the traditional road to stardom.  The public has voiced their displeasure of hearing the same songs over-and-over and seeing the same 10 artists consistently on TV, the news, in the tabloids and award shows.
  • The success of shows from The Apollo, Starsearch, American Idol, America's Got Talent and The Voice is proof positive that some of the best talents are honed from untapped reservoirs.  The public also seems more energetic to have input in the selection process versus the predictable choices they are given.

The Program

  • The entirety of this platform is a digital convergence of TV, radio, film and streaming design captured from live performances.  
  • Expenditures will be for performance venues, commercial advertisements, technical equipment (on-location cameras, editing), programming (TV, radio, podcasts, social media maintenance), sound and crew.  This will also contain back-up expenses for contingent or unexpected occurrences.  Full funding will allow programming as close as to an equal playing field on any major media.
  • In the event the financial goal is not fully impacted, each area will be carried out in increments one-by-one.  Visibility of these artists and their music will inevitably reach a larger audience with this platform.

The Impact

  • As noted above: full finding allows all who want to participate in the recording and entertainment field to do so from all over the world.  The discovery of this new music and artists will be distributed out to the world on our global media platforms.  In differentiation to other like programs, STARBREAKERS' artists will not just be recognized as gifted artists.  Our various programs will have a ripple effect as their performances and music will be aired on radio/TV and on-demand programs.  Their music will be distributed globally and they will be marketed to promoters and venues for parties and events.  These shows will accommodate them unprecedented celebrity usually only available through major labels. The anticipated success of these artists will provide the building blocks of businesses revolved around recorded music and open same business opportunities for those who are not front-line entertainers. 
  • Previously stated, this is a new experience in entertainment.  Tapped from the bottom up, the cream will rise to the top and you will be the cause and the beneficiary of it all.  
  • This showcase not only impacts the artists involved, but will give an unprecedented opportunity to the many start-up radio stations, TV programs, events born as a spinoff out of this campaign plus a new rank of celebrity personalities and hosts.  These will be listed below.

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges are extremely low for this type of campaign. Most of the crew who will be working with us have put together their entertainment operations mostly with their own out-of-pocket funding and have not been provided the opportunity or outlet to work collectively as a future business model due to corporate and/or traditional business models.  This format eliminates most of these issues and the funding erases the bulk of technical expenses.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We truly understand that some cannot for various reasons cannot contribute, but that doesn't mean that you can't help.  Please spread the word (every click sends a message) and use Indiegogo share tools.  
  • Below are listed all the ways you may also help.

Listed below are links and sites of our team.  Tune in, listen, view and spread the word for others to check out the upward movement of this program.

www.America2Broadcasting.com  * Our main outlet * needs update technical expenses

http://mbodymentradio.com

http://iconosquare.com/yowhatsgood_ga

https://www.reverbnation.com/mzchevy
https://www.reverbnation.com/lyvationentertainment
Support with a $.99 cent download - our first compilation
STARBREAKERS Presents - ATL The Corner of Rhythm & Bling
www.cdbaby.com/cd/starbreakers

Links I Am a Southern Boy (I Am a S.B) - Single by Mr. Flamboyant on iTunes

story:
I'm asking for help in money raising for recording of my new album.

Sadly I need an additional help with purchase of a new computer to replace the broken one ( last couple of weeks was a disaster because my old PC completely collapsed ) and I can't complete even a remixes and some mastering works that I promised to produce to other musicians . 

Otherwise - If I'm not going to make a goal I have no choice to leave the music, mixing and mastering production because of the lack of funds and equipment.

I don't have any serious risks or challenges. Demo material for upcoming album is ready.

story:
Hey everybody!  

I've finally decided to record a little acoustic EP after a while of constantly being asked if I have any music out there, but never have anything of quality to give out.  I'm not desperate for money,  this is more just along the lines of seeing everybody that is willing to support me in the making of my first ever professionally-recorded album.  Everybody that donates and supports me will get a copy sent to them, no matter the amount donated.

Thank you guys so much, God bless--

Christopher Hughes.

story:
Short Summary

Dome of Visions is a temporary place in Copenaghen, Denmark.

I'm a filmmaker and photographer.

I love music.

I support independent art, music, films.

I love traveling and discovering unconventional places to bring independent cultural efforts. I think it's the best way to make some abandoned places and areas in our cities to be alive again: bringing music, arts, and to make people aware about that.

In my hometown Rome, I supported the project called Sottoilviadotto, as a way to regenerate an urban abandoned area. www.sottoilviadotto.wordpress.com 

Since the minute I crashed into Dome of Visions while biking through the channels of Copenaghen I fell in love with this place and I thought "I must create an event for some independent italian music here".

When I came back home in Italy I contacted the guys from Dome Of Visions and we started wondering what if I would make a bigger event.

So I started to make this real.

Now we need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

The team from The Italian Spring is 5 people that need to cover expenses for travel to Copenaghen and staying in the city for 3 days.

Our perks is available both in Italy and in Copenaghen.

You can download music from DAP and Livia, otherwise ask them to play at your place, otherwise you can come to visit Rome for two days.

Check all details about our perks.

story:
I am Loreto González Lorca; Loreto Lorca.

Soy Loreto González Lorca; Loreto Lorca.

I was born in Santiago, Chile at the feet of the Andes mountains and since I was a child I started the search for  the Spirit.

Nací en Santiago de Chile a los pies de la cordillera de los Andes y desde pequeña comencé la búsqueda de lo que nunca se va: el espíritu.

I always knew that my misión was to give  music and songs to the world, 

I became a singer songwriter and voice teacher. I have  created the Voice Workshop at the Rock Schools and taught thousands of students all along Chile.

Siempre supe que mi misión en el mundo era entregar mis canciones y mi música, por eso me convertí en cantautora y maestra de canto, creando el taller de voz en las Escuelas de Rock y enseñando a miles de alumnos en Chile .

I like to collaborate with people, and I have created solidarity campaigns  in our numerous earthquakes. My favorite was: Walking Together "Caminando Juntos", where we sent new shoes to children and the elderly most affected by my land´s earthquake in 2010.

Creo en la colaboración entre personas, por eso he realizado y participado en campañas para ayudar  en los tantos terremotos que han remecido mi tierra, como por ejemplo Caminando Juntos, donde enviamos zapatos y calcetines nuevos a niños y ancianos afectados por el sismo del 27 de febrero de 2010.

I am a singer & songwriter since I was 13, I now  have hundreds of  songs. 

I invite you to listen to some of them in my Soundcloud.

Compongo desde los 13 años y cuento con más de 100 canciones.

Puedes escuchar algunas de éstas en mi Soundcloud



Quotes

"In this exquisite music Taj Loreto sings the epic story of her dramatic land, Chile, while also telling us of the journey of the Soul.  Her music heals our Earth and returns magic to the heart of humanity!” 

 En ésta deliciosa música Taj Loreto canta la historia épica de su dramática tierra, Chile, mientras tanto nos cuenta también del viaje del alma. Su música sana la Tierra y devuelve la magia al corazón de la humanidad” Sharifa Oppenheimer www.ourheavenonearth.net

Each song on this album is an exquisitely crafted gem. Loreto Lorca is a master melodist and storyteller." 

“Cada canción de este álbum es una joya exquisitamente tallada Loreto Lorca es una maestra melódica y una “cuentacuentos.””Bisan Toronwww.bisantoron.com

“For her lyrical proposal, Loreto tells us a story that placesher, because of  her message, as a citizen of the world "Musician & journalist Andrés Lecaros. http://www.andreslecaros.cl/ 

“Para su propuesta lírica, Loreto expone un estilo de narración, que la sitúa, en base a su mensaje, como una ciudadana del mundo”. Músico y periodista Andrés Lecaros

“Loreto creates a unique  jewel, crafted by hand , inspired by mystical themes   and the longings of the heart”

“Loreto crea una joyería única, hecha a mano, inspirada  por el místicismo y la añoranza del corazón.”Antonio Calise. Literature profesor.

When I was 17, I started my travels in Chile and then to North America & South America, to Brasil, Argentina, Perú, Bolivia, the United States. In each place I  emerged  in its music & culture, thus, my music is from everywhere. 

My songs talk  about reconciliation, my city, the awakening of humanity, my desire to unify the american heart, about the elements of nature, about love in its many forms.

Comencé a viajar a los 17 años por Chile y luego recorrí Norteamérica y Sudamérica, conociendo Brasil, Argentina, Perú, Bolivia, Estados Unidos, y en cada lugar me impregné de su música y cultura, por eso mis canciones son del mundo, es decir World Music.

Mis canciones hablan de reconciliación, de mi ciudad, del despertar de la humanidad, de mi anhelo de unir el corazón americano, de los elementos de la naturaleza y del amor en sus tantas formas.

These last years I realize I was doing many things, but no what I most love and what my mission in life was: my music. So I decided to do it. I started the pre production of a CD with 12 of my songs, and here began the task of creating a team to do it.

Two years ago we started the pre production of VIENTO AZUL; Blue Wind, with an extraordinary team of chilean artists, musical arranger, 5 young and tremendous musicians, designer, film maker, sound engineers etc. One of these artists is the chilean painter René Olivares  artist  of Los Jaivas covers (chilean Grateful Dead) .

Estos últimos años me di cuenta que estaba haciendo muchas cosas pero no lo que más amo y aquello que es mi misión en la vida hacer: mi música. Entonces me propuse hacer un disco con 12 de mis canciones y así es como comenzó la tarea de formar un equipo para realizarlo.

Hace 2 años iniciamos la producción de VIENTO AZUL,con un equipo extraordinario de artistas chilenos, arreglador, músicos, director audiovisual y muchos más. Uno de estos artistas es el pintor chileno René Olivares, realizador de las portadas de los discos de Los Jaivas, quien se encargó de hacer también el arte de este disco.

I sing because it is  vital  for me and I want to share my songs with the world…

I invite you to be part of the creation of Viento Azul, debut álbum of twelve original songs.

Canto porque es una necesidad vital para mí y quiero compartirlo con el mundo.

Te invito a ser parte de mi obra VIENTO AZUL, álbum debut de 12 canciones originales.

In the creation of this CD, this wonderful group of musicians are my companions:

En la realización de esta obra, me acompañan excelentes músicos:

  • Raimundo Santander: electric and electric acoustic guitar.
  • Juan Caballero: electric bass and electric acoustic bass.
  • Nicolás Ríos: drums.
  • Francisco Campos: latin american and world percussions: udu, darkuba. 
  • Javier Cornejo Vélez: arrangment, musical production, keyboards, piano, violin.
  • Emma Navarro: vocals.
  • Italo Pedrotti: charango
  • Special participation of Joe Vasconcellos. 

  • If we get US $15.000 we finance the pre production and recording of the CD.
  • If we get US $ 20.000 we finance the physical CD plus the launch concert.
  • If we get US $25.000 we finance all the above plus promotion & 3 free concerts.
  • Si recaudamos US $15.000  financiamos pre producción y grabación del disco.
  • Si recaudamos US $20.000 financiamos disco físico y concierto de lanzamiento.
  • Si recaudamos US $25.000 financiamos lo anterior mas difusión y 3 conciertos gratuitos.

I have amazing perks, for your support in this project: download of CD and other songs, the physical album, exclusive fine jewelry in silver & semiprecious stones that I have designed and that are chilean hand made and a  lot more!!!

¡Tengo increíbles recompensas para ti, por tu apoyo en este proyecto: descargas del disco, álbum en CD, joyas finas en plata y piedras semipreciosas hechas por mí y mucho más!

For me is very important this album because represents the dream of my life which is to offer my songs to the world and contribute to create one more beautiful, more harmonious and more loving.

Para mí es muy importante este disco porque representa realizar el sueño de mi vida que es entregar mis canciones al mundo y contribuir a crear uno más bello, armonioso y amable.

RIESGOS Y DESAFÍOS

In my life I have had big challenges, holding them with surrender and enthusiasm. The first and foremost is to become a Singer. Then, to  insert my contribution into socialwork, to become teacher at the Rock Schools, create campaigns for the tsunamis and earthquake victims with  incredible results, support and collaboration. 

I have also successfully produced 9 Sufi caravans in Chile for our inner & outer well being.

The punctual risk of this campaign is not reaching our goal, but I can assure you that you will receive your perk, because this is a work in progress, it already started and I will send you the reclaimed CDs. Its my honor all laid out for you and.... the jewelry is being worked on now...

Durante mi vida he tenido grandes desafíos, asumiendo estos con entusiasmo y entrega. El primero: formarme como cantante. Luego, en el área social, ser maestra de canto en las Escuelas de Rock y crear  campañas en ayuda a los afectados por el terremoto 27F; logrando increíbles resultados de ayuda y colaboración. He realizado también 9 caravanas Sufis a Chile con gran éxito en el mundo interno y externo.

El riesgo puntual de esta campaña es no alcanzar la meta, pero aún así, puedo asegurarte que recibirás tu beneficio, pues el proceso ya comenzó y lograré enviar los discos reclamados, es mi compromiso ¡Las joyas ya están en proceso!

OTHER WAYS TO CONTRIBUTE

OTRAS FORMAS DE AYUDAR

You can also help sharing this project with your friends, in your social networks and  spreading the word. 

This is very valuable for us!!!

Thank you from the depths of my soul!!!

Agradezco si también colaboras compartiendo este proyecto con tus amigos en tus redes sociales y corriendo la voz. ¡Esto es muy valioso para nosotros!

story:
Singing My Story...And Yours!

Dear Beautiful Souls,

Ever since I was a little girl, singing and creating music has made me feel alive.  I feel playful and joyful and a part bigger than myself comes forward. 

It is my soul's calling and what makes my heart sing! 

We've all come up against struggles and tough times in life that seem impossible to overcome.  I too have been there, but I've also experienced great love and the beauty in life that has kept my heart open. This is the part I want to share with you!

I want to serve in a bigger way and you're going to keep me accountable to my soul's calling.  Take these next steps with me and be a part of my album!  

With you as my community, my co-creators, my band of angels, all things are possible!


Join The Creation and Pre-Order Today!

To be able to share this music with the world out there, to be heard, to inspire, to make a difference somehow and stay true to my soul’s calling - some serious financial support is needed. Here is how Indiegogo works...

In a way, you are my record label and can share in the manifestation of this sweet dream simply by pre-ordering my album.

Check out the amazing perks I have made exclusively for you and pre-order today!  I’ve put my heart and soul into these perks and I know you will LOVE them!

Without a record label behind you, making the album is not an easy mission, nor is it cheap.  (There is a breakdown of the budget further down). The amount raised will cover the cost of:

  • Co-producer and Pre-production
  • Recording, Musicians, Mixing, Mastering
  • Artwork - Album Design 
  • CD Manufacturing and Distribution
  • Basic PR and Marketing
  • Credit Card and IndieGogo fees
  • Creating and Posting Your Perks
  • Professional Video Clip for IndieGogo

I’ve already recorded the single, "Been a Long Time", made an amazing video and recorded 3 other songs for the album.  To complete the album I need to record 6 more songs to make a total of 10 tracks.  I have even more songs that I’m dying to include!  Any additional funds I raise will be used to record more songs and other exciting things...Read about my Stretch Goals below!

Contribute today and make this vision come to life!

Thank you from the bottom of my heart!


With all my love & gratitude always,

Christine


My Co-Producer: Mick Taras

What do you get when you combine a man from Italy, a guitar and a love of bluegrass and Americana music?  Mick Taras!  Mick and I met while I was recording the single “Been a Long Time”.  We hit it off and I knew I had found a musical kindred spirit in my dream producer.  Recently Mick had a dream that we were working together and making music!  Seems crazy, but I believe Spirit was leading us both!  Read Mick’s resume here, he played on Neil Young’s latest release to give you an idea of his amazing talent!

The songs for the album are written and I continue to dream up more songs every day!  We have a wealth of songs to choose from and Mick and I are having so much fun doing arrangements and pre-production of songs and will be ready to go into the studio as soon as the campaign funds! 


Album Budget Breakdown

  • Co-producer and Pre-production, Recording, Musicians, Mixing: $10,200
  • Mastering: $1900
  • Artwork - Album Design: $1000 
  • CD Manufacturing and Distribution: $1900
  • Basic PR and Marketing: $3000
  • Credit Card and IndieGogo fees: $1900
  • Creating and Posting Your Perks: $1700
  • Professional Video Clip for IndieGogo: $3400


Stretch Goals

My goal is to raise $25,000 in 30 days to make this album!

But...the dream in my heart is even bigger! 

  • $25,000 – The Album Gets Made And Released.

  • $30,000 – Record 2 More Songs And Hire Special Guest Musicians!

  • $35,000 – A Promo Video In The Studio.  (Behind the scenes and the making of the album).

  • $45,000 - A Music Video Of The New Single, “Honey For My Soul”.

  • $50,000-$60,000 - A dream come true!  The ULTIMATE VISION for the project is hiring Ry Cooder to work with Mick and Me!  Ry is our musical soul mate and both Mick and I are completely enamored with his music!


Other Ways You Can Help

I can't do this without you. Share the campaign with your friends via Facebook, email or the old school 'word of mouth'.  Any noise you can make to let others know is a beautiful sound!

  • Direct people to my Indiegogo page.
  • Share the campaign video on your FACEBOOK page.
  • Email your friends and family around the world (this system works the best).
  • Tell music magazines/websites/blogs/other relevant pros about my project.
  • Tell your friends directly (old school style.... offline). 

Be a part of making music history by becoming a team member (you will have my eternal love & gratitude, plus an invite to an exclusive private farm to table soiree worth $200!).   Contact me if you would like to become an official team member.


Risks and Challenges

Regardless of the amount of funds raised I am committed to sending you all the perks. I appreciate your trust and good spirit in this matter. If I don't reach my goal I will still make the album somehow, but will have to compromise on things like artwork, publicity and number of songs recorded.  Contact me with any questions about the music, the perks or anything else! 

With all my love & gratitude always,

Christine


Bio: Christine Rosander

“From the first fiery note to the last whispery phrase, Christine Rosander’s voice grabs hold and doesn’t let go, stirring up yearning and desire long after a song has ended.”

Vocalist Christine Rosander has the kind of voice that makes you want to laugh, cry and even shout a “Hallelujah!” or two. Her sultry mix of gospel — honed by a childhood of singing in church choir — country, folk, and jazz, warms the spirit with a captivating, earthy power.

The soundtrack to Christine Rosander’s life started before she was born, her mother a piano teacher and singer, pregnant with her when she was a voice major in college. Christine grew up in northern California near Sacramento, the beginning of the Sierra Nevada Mountains in the distance, her family’s church, Elk Grove First Baptist, where Christine went to Wednesday night prayer meetings, Sunday morning and evening services, her father a driving force in attendance. It was there she learned, getting the congregation ready to hear the sermon by singing to the top of the church rafters, that music healed, music made hurting souls well. She had found the power of music.

Years later, when she was introduced to jazz, she remembered back to a Sunday night church service and Mr. Stan Hagstrom singing, “There is a Balm in Gilead,” which inspired Christine to do a jazz version on her first album, “Smooth Ride,” earning an “Independent Female Vocalist of the Year” nomination from the Los Angeles Music Awards.


Christine’s memories of luck and finding a person that inspires you came from meeting Mrs. Perla Warren, a much-loved Filipino concert pianist and teacher who, because of her brilliance, her passion for jazz and for life, changed Christine’s life forever. She loved the improvisation and styling in jazz, loved that she could take a song and make it her own, tell her story through her own truths and intuitions, and become the Artist she wanted to be.

Yet truths, sometimes, are difficult to tell, many of their effects long lasting and painful. Words like betrayal or violence, words like doubt. But where do songs come from, where does art come from? From sadness and loss and often from the worst times in our lives, from fear and broken promises---soul damage. But also from inspiration and transformation, she told herself, from singing to the rafters and moving on.

Christine Rosander’s latest single, “Been a Long Time” celebrates her grandfather Ray Rosander and the need we all have to connect with each other. “I was thinking about who anchors us to family, to love and who connects us to the earth. For me that person was my Grandpa Ray. He was a simple man, a farmer, but he taught so much about life by his example. He had a friendly, easy-going way and a deep spiritual love of life. He wasn’t tied to material things. Connecting with his memory has been restorative.

“I’ve realized that everything good about my life, everything important to me, has nothing anymore to do with painful memories or experiences. I am whole and wonderful and loved without them. I have been transformed in many ways. I believe in myself and write songs. I regain my self-worth. I remember who I am and all I have to offer the world. I remember my parents and grandparents, my childhood and the legacies left me, remember my roots and family, special and wonderful. I remember the artists I listened to and loved and was guided by, as I hope to guide others. This is where I come from, this is my hope, my commitment, my authentic self.”

Christine earned a bachelor’s degree in Vocal Performance and Commercial Composing and Arranging from Cal State Long Beach and later became the first vocalist to earn a master’s degree from USC in Jazz Studies. Currently she lives in Los Angeles working as a professional singer, musician, teacher and songwriter and is busy doing an IndieGogo campaign to make her latest album, "Been a Long Time".

“Been a Long Time” is my prayer for listeners. I hope they experience the healing power of music and are reminded of what is really important in life — the people we love and how we can make a difference in the world. Producing the music video for "Been a Long Time" brought the song to life in an even more powerful way. We used old film clips of my grandfather interwoven with those of my dad. The story, location and music came together effortlessly. I truly felt Spirit at work.”
story_txt:
Singing My Story...And Yours!
Dear Beautiful Souls,
Ever since I was a little girl, singing and creating music has made me feel alive.  I feel playful and joyful and a part bigger than myself comes forward. It is my soul's calling and what makes my heart sing! 
We've all come up against struggles and tough times in life that seem impossible to overcome.  I too have been there, but I've also experienced great love and the beauty in life that has kept my heart open. This is the part I want to share with you!
I want to serve in a bigger way and you're going to keep me accountable to my soul's calling.  Take these next steps with me and be a part of my album!  With you as my community, my co-creators, my band of angels, all things are possible!Join The Creation and Pre-Order Today!
To be able to share this music with the world out there, to be heard, to inspire, to make a difference somehow and stay true to my soul’s calling - some serious financial support is needed. Here is how Indiegogo works...
In a way, you are my record label and can share in the manifestation of this sweet dream simply by pre-ordering my album. Check out the amazing perks I have made exclusively for you and pre-order today!  I’ve put my heart and soul into these perks and I know you will LOVE them! Without a record label behind you, making the album is not an easy mission, nor is it cheap.  (There is a breakdown of the budget further down). The amount raised will cover the cost of:

Co-producer and Pre-production


Recording, Musicians, Mixing, Mastering


Artwork - Album Design 


CD Manufacturing and Distribution


Basic PR and Marketing


Credit Card and IndieGogo fees


Creating and Posting Your Perks


Professional Video Clip for IndieGogo


I’ve already recorded the single, "Been a Long Time", made an amazing video and recorded 3 other songs for the album.  To complete the album I need to record 6 more songs to make a total of 10 tracks.  I have even more songs that I’m dying to include!  Any additional funds I raise will be used to record more songs and other exciting things...Read about my Stretch Goals below!


Contribute today and make this vision come to life!Thank you from the bottom of my heart!With all my love & gratitude always,
Christine
My Co-Producer: Mick Taras
What do you get when you combine a man from Italy, a guitar and a love of bluegrass and Americana music?  Mick Taras!  Mick and I met while I was recording the single “Been a Long Time”.  We hit it off and I knew I had found a musical kindred spirit in my dream producer.  Recently Mick had a dream that we were working together and making music!  Seems crazy, but I believe Spirit was leading us both!  Read Mick’s resume here, he played on Neil Young’s latest release to give you an idea of his amazing talent!
The songs for the album are written and I continue to dream up more songs every day!  We have a wealth of songs to choose from and Mick and I are having so much fun doing arrangements and pre-production of songs and will be ready to go into the studio as soon as the campaign funds! 


Album Budget Breakdown


Co-producer and Pre-production, Recording, Musicians, Mixing: $10,200


Mastering: $1900


Artwork - Album Design: $1000 


CD Manufacturing and Distribution: $1900


Basic PR and Marketing: $3000


Credit Card and IndieGogo fees: $1900


Creating and Posting Your Perks: $1700


Professional Video Clip for IndieGogo: $3400



Stretch Goals
My goal is to raise $25,000 in 30 days to make this album! But...the dream in my heart is even bigger!  

$25,000 – The Album Gets Made And Released.

$30,000 – Record 2 More Songs And Hire Special Guest Musicians!

$35,000 – A Promo Video In The Studio.  (Behind the scenes and the making of the album).


$45,000 - A Music Video Of The New Single, “Honey For My Soul”.



$50,000-$60,000 - A dream come true!  The ULTIMATE VISION for the project is hiring Ry Cooder to work with Mick and Me!  Ry is our musical soul mate and both Mick and I are completely enamored with his music! 


Other Ways You Can Help

I can't do this without you. Share the campaign with your friends via Facebook, email or the old school 'word of mouth'.  Any noise you can make to let others know is a beautiful sound!  

Direct people to my Indiegogo page.
Share the campaign video on your FACEBOOK page.
Email your friends and family around the world (this system works the best).
Tell music magazines/websites/blogs/other relevant pros about my project.
Tell your friends directly (old school style.... offline). 


Be a part of making music history by becoming a team member (you will have my eternal love & gratitude, plus an invite to an exclusive private farm to table soiree worth $200!).   Contact me if you would like to become an official team member.Risks and Challenges 

Regardless of the amount of funds raised I am committed to sending you all the perks. I appreciate your trust and good spirit in this matter. If I don't reach my goal I will still make the album somehow, but will have to compromise on things like artwork, publicity and number of songs recorded.  Contact me with any questions about the music, the perks or anything else!  With all my love & gratitude always,Christine 

Bio: Christine Rosander




“From
the first fiery note to the last whispery phrase, Christine Rosander’s voice
grabs hold and doesn’t let go, stirring up yearning and desire long after a
song has ended.” Vocalist Christine Rosander has the kind of
voice that makes you want to laugh, cry and even shout a “Hallelujah!” or two.
Her sultry mix of gospel — honed by a childhood of singing in church choir —
country, folk, and jazz, warms the spirit with a captivating, earthy power.
The soundtrack to Christine Rosander’s life started before she was born, her mother a piano teacher and singer, pregnant with her when she was a voice major in college. Christine grew up in northern California near Sacramento, the beginning of the Sierra Nevada Mountains in the distance, her family’s church, Elk Grove First Baptist, where Christine went to Wednesday night prayer meetings, Sunday morning and evening services, her father a driving force in attendance. It was there she learned, getting the congregation ready to hear the sermon by singing to the top of the church rafters, that music healed, music made hurting souls well. She had found the power of music.Years later, when she was introduced to jazz, she remembered back to a Sunday night church service and Mr. Stan Hagstrom singing, “There is a Balm in Gilead,” which inspired Christine to do a jazz version on her first album, “Smooth Ride,” earning an “Independent Female Vocalist of the Year” nomination from the Los Angeles Music Awards.Christine’s memories of luck and finding a person that inspires you came from meeting Mrs. Perla Warren, a much-loved Filipino concert pianist and teacher who, because of her brilliance, her passion for jazz and for life, changed Christine’s life forever. She loved the improvisation and styling in jazz, loved that she could take a song and make it her own, tell her story through her own truths and intuitions, and become the Artist she wanted to be.Yet truths, sometimes, are difficult to tell, many of their effects long lasting and painful. Words like betrayal or violence, words like doubt. But where do songs come from, where does art come from? From sadness and loss and often from the worst times in our lives, from fear and broken promises---soul damage. But also from inspiration and transformation, she told herself, from singing to the rafters and moving on.
Christine Rosander’s latest single, “Been a Long Time” celebrates her grandfather Ray Rosander and the need we all have to connect with each other. “I was thinking about who anchors us to family, to love and who connects us to the earth. For me that person was my Grandpa Ray. He was a simple man, a farmer, but he taught so much about life by his example. He had a friendly, easy-going way and a deep spiritual love of life. He wasn’t tied to material things. Connecting with his memory has been restorative.
“I’ve realized that everything good about my life, everything important to me, has nothing anymore to do with painful memories or experiences. I am whole and wonderful and loved without them. I have been transformed in many ways. I believe in myself and write songs. I regain my self-worth. I remember who I am and all I have to offer the world. I remember my parents and grandparents, my childhood and the legacies left me, remember my roots and family, special and wonderful. I remember the artists I listened to and loved and was guided by, as I hope to guide others. This is where I come from, this is my hope, my commitment, my authentic self.” 
Christine earned a bachelor’s degree in Vocal Performance and Commercial Composing and Arranging from Cal State Long Beach and later became the first vocalist to earn a master’s degree from USC in Jazz Studies. Currently she lives in Los Angeles working as a professional singer, musician, teacher and songwriter and is busy doing an IndieGogo campaign to make her latest album, "Been a Long Time".
“Been a Long Time” is my prayer for listeners. I hope they experience the healing power of music and are reminded of what is really important in life — the people we love and how we can make a difference in the world. Producing the music video for "Been a Long Time" brought the song to life in an even more powerful way. We used old film clips of my grandfather interwoven with those of my dad. The story, location and music came together effortlessly. I truly felt Spirit at work.”

story:
Hello friends!

I made this Indiegogo account in an attempt to raise money toward new musical equipment, with which I plan to provide soothing sounds for your ear-holes. I truly appreciate all of the love and support you have given me, and I am planning on working very hard to make you all as happy as I can manage. The first step to making quality music... is obtaining quality equipment. The problem is, my bank account is at a stable and consistent $0 after handling all of life's many expenses, which poses a problem when shopping for expensive recording equipment. I have a few pieces in mind, the foremost being a Kawai MP7, a workstation synthesizer/keyboard with nearly unlimited musical capabilities. I used to have a similar model, but I ended up selling it in order to get Tony the money he needed to make his way back to New Mexico. It was the right decision, he was a friend in need and I am willing to do anything to help a friend. 

The evil company I am signed with on YouTube makes very large amounts of money off of my content and sends me a check for around $15 every month, give or take a few dollars. They take advantage of me, and are legally allowed to do so because of the stipulations within the contract I signed when I was 14 years old. So, yeah... I have enough to live day-by-day, but not nearly enough to prosper creatively as I aspire to do.

With all of that said, I could really use some help! And with your help, I will be able to produce higher quality content than I ever have before, and even (some day) produce a full length album for you to (hopefully) enjoy!

I do not want to ask for a lot. I would feel bad if you gave me a lot. Very bad. I hate being a beggar, but it seems necessary at this point, as I want to make you all as happy as I possibly can.

A quick promise: 100%, and not a penny less, of the money raised with help of this Indiegogo account will go into musical and recording equipment with which I will be using to entertain you wonderful people, whether you choose to donate or not. I plan on being very transparent regarding earnings and purchases, because you deserve that courtesy.

Anyway, thank you for reading! I appreciate you all very much, and I look forward to making more (hopefully high quality) music for you!

story:
21st Annual Clarissa Street Reunion


The Clarissa Street Reunion Committee invites you to join our annual reunion “Celebrating 21 Years”. To be held on August 20th on Clarissa Street, we will pay tribute to the people in places comprising our rich history.


We invite people from neighborhoods throughout Greater Rochester to join us on August 20th to celebrate neighborhood and community.


What We Need & What You Get

What we are looking for is $50,000 to establish a “Vision Fund.” This “Vision Fund” will enable the reunion committee to fund the development of concept proposals aligned to Cornhill Neighbors Association and the Western New York Landmark Society vision for Clarissa Street. The “Vision Fund” will provide funds to develop the concept proposals for:

1. The Pythodd Club Amphitheater

2. Historical Murals

3. Historical Banners

4. Historic Signs and Plaques


The Impact 

Neighborhoods and stakeholders and controllers of land use will be engaged throughout the development to create a permanent marker for this historic community. 

Potential contributors can encourage others to share in this project to promote significance of "Historical Community" throughout the country.

story:
The Affinity Quintet’s journey began this past year at the Eastman School of Music, as its members found themselves regularly collaborating on recitals and recording projects. Jakob Ebers (bass), Stephen Morris (drums), Jonathan Fagan (piano), Orlando Madrid (saxophone), and Nathan Kay (trumpet) quickly discovered that they shared a soulful yet adventurous sense of style. As they have continued to play together, the musical and personal affinity between these young artists has rapidly deepened and evolved. The members have began to compose for the group, making a debut album of original music a realistic objective.

“First Impressions” will be their first full-length album, representing the culmination of many years of musical study. The members eagerly await the opportunity to record their new compositions in the studio, but even the best-laid plans require some financial support at first. That is where you, our generous donors, come into play.

This campaign will help “First Impressions” succeed in its physical and digital forms. Your funding will help make sure that the music is professionally mixed, mastered, edited, and published. It will help “Affinity” to promote their new work to audiences across the globe, sharing their mutual creative spirit with music enthusiasts everywhere. All of the members realize that successful albums include tasteful cover art, liner notes, and labels, all of which cost some money. Post-production and marketing costs are substantial as well, but the group feels fortunate to have the support of numerous mentors, friends, and family. If you are interested in helping “Affinity,” please consider making a contribution of $5, 10, 20, 100, or more if the spirit moves you. In addition to a copy of the album, the group will send some special gifts to its most significant supporters. Every dollar will help turn this vision into a reality.

Please feel free to share this link, promoting our website as well as this indiegogo website. Thank you again for your contribution, no matter how big or small. May we make a beautiful First Impression on you all!

story:
So, who's the guy with the guitar?

My name is Tom Ciorciari and for the past nine years I've been writing and recording under the nom du rock, Deerheart. I was part of both NYC's Paisley Underground and Boston's Garage Punk scenes in the 80's, and did the singer-songwriter thing in the 90's, all the while accumulating a strong backlog of material that would eventually find an outlet when I started releasing albums as Deerheart in 2007. Since then there have been seven Deerheart releases, and a steadily-growing audience via radio play, social media and solo performances in and around New York area.

Over the past nine months I've been hard at it, recording a new album, and putting a rock solid band together to get it out to the public. And that's where this campaign comes in...

What's he need & what's it for? And who's Elsie?

Deerheart has always been a DIY project. It's always just been me writing, recording and performing everything; producing, mixing, you get the idea. But these 12 new songs are very possibly the best I've written; songs of love, songs of desperation and, ultimately, songs of triumph. Songs that reverberate, that get to the heart of the matter, as someone once said. Songs that I believe in. Songs "Fer Elsie...", as the title has it. And with a new band ready to take these songs to a larger audience it's time to bring things up to the next level and have this album professionally mixed and mastered. For $2800 we can do that and get the album out to you, and continue to grow our audience.

Other ways you can help!

I know that not everyone has the ability to contribute financially, but there are other ways you can contribute...

  • Share this campaign with everyone you know and keep sharing!

  • Know a booking agent at a music venue?

  • Have a friend who prints band t-shirts or makes merch?

  • Got a cousin who runs a music label and wants to send us all over the world? Jk… but seriously, do you?

  • Have a better ideas than these? Great! Email me.
