story:
Music The Universal Language of the Soul:

Hello, my name is Julio L. Matta. I'm a Native New Yorker from the South Bronx, of Hispanic Origin. A songwriter, composer, percussionist, keyboardist, producer of Pop, Latin Pop, R&B, Jazz Fusion, Afro-Cuban, Adult Contemporary, Love Ballads, Pop/Country, Instrumental, Urban/R&B, World, and Soft Rock music.  I would greatly appreciate your support and donations to help me reach my funding goals to make this dream come true.  Not only will your donation help me complete my debut Album and put us closer to producing our music video, you will be joining me in advocating the importance of Immigration Reform to help bring out those living in the shadows who deserve a chance at achieving the American Dream.  As a musician I've been blessed with over 25 years of extensive experience performing with many well-known artists throughout the United States, Puerto Rico, and Europe.  Artist such as:  Jon Akkerman; Marilyn McCoo & Billy Davis Jr.; Klaus Dordinger; Donna Summers, Gato Barbieri; Lou Rawls; Willie Colon, Justo Betancourt; and many others.  I began my musical endeavors at the young age of 14 in New York City.  At the age of 18, I was drafted and served in the United States Army and after 12 years of service, I decided to return to college acquiring several Degrees, which includes an MBA.  During this same time period, I also worked as a Civil Rights Practitioner for the Federal Government in several Federal agencies.  As a Public Servant, I held the positions of Director of Civil Rights for the U. S. Marine Corps at the Pentagon, Director of Civil Rights, for the United States Merit Systems Protection Board, which was the old Civil Service Commission, Senior Enforcement Investigator for both the United States Equal Employment Opportunity Commission and Wage and Hour Division of the U. S. Department of Labor, and ended my Federal Civil Service career at the US Department of Labor as the Deputy Chief of Enforcement for Civil Rights in Washington, DC.  

The diversity of music that I have learned and performed, nurtured by people with a vast cultural history; are all joined by a universal language, which is music.    This experience coupled with the responsibility of protecting the Civil and Labor Rights of thousands of individuals throughout the United States; has enrich my soul by serving and protecting my fellow American brothers and sisters of all races, sex, age, religion, sexual preferences, disabilities, color and nationalities.  My journey has been serving and protecting the children of generations of Exiles and Immigrants; seeds conceived in America but its roots touching the world hungry with hope for prosperity, and freedom.

The Drive and Vision:

I love people, period.   Yes, we will all go through life meeting up with some who just don't get it.  But that is your choice to accept or protest, and I protested by getting into the trenches overseas, and here right at home.  I love people because the majority of those individuals that have touch my life musically or otherwise; no matter what nationality or cultural difference we had as individuals, were intelligent, decent, hardworking people all looking for the same thing; to better themselves as an individuals and insure the safety, and prosperity for their families.   As a Musician, Disabled Veteran, Public Servant, and Cancer Survivor, as I am sure hundreds have asked; {why and how have we encourage divisiveness?}  It tears at the very essence of my soul.  

The Drive:

Understanding a little bit about who I am, in someway or another, musically or publicly, people have and continue to be the center of my journey through life.   My drive; as a man, a veteran, public servant; Hispanic; and yes American born; we are slowly walking away from who we are, what we stand for, most importantly; what so many of our children through generations of Exile, and Immigrants have died to ensure the beacon of hope, prosperity and freedom never dies.  We must never allow that sacred promise be broken to any decent man, woman or child who seeks the protection of our Sentinel; Our Guardian of Freedom, Our Mother Of Exiles.    Although, this is my first album, and musical project I have many stories to tell.  Stories based on the diverse life I have lived among so many cultures; difficulties, desires, and hopes that makes us all the same.  We The Children were promised; in writing to bear witness, and in blood defending to secure an establishment of Justice, domestic tranquility, defend and promote the general Welfare, and insure the Children's security of liberty for themselves, and their Posterity.  Posterity; this is where we are missing the point in my opinion, the promise does not end with us, it is secured bearing witness and blood for all future generations to come, and live as one people; " E PLURIBUS UNUM" "OUT OF MANY, ONE"   We should never adapt a political posture where people are held back from hope and prosperity because of their religion, race or color of their skin.  History has shown us that unity is the survival and strength of any great team, organization and yes a progressive and great country.  

Vision: 

I need your help to continue to communicate the best way I know about what I have seen and experienced.  I need your support to bring to life a dream over 25 years in the making, an Album diverse in genres, rich in stories of love, sadness, triumph, and the life of many.   I ask for your support and participation in this two-stage project called "Mother Of Exiles".  

The Mother of Exiles Project is a Two Stage Project.  Stage one is to seek your support to complete our first debut Album.  Musically, is non-genre specific, stemming from Love Ballads, Pop/Rock, Latin Fusion, R&B, World, and our title song Mother Of Exiles.  The title song "Mother of Exiles," talks about how immigration starts in the U.S. though Ellis Island, and the significance of the Statute of Liberty to us and for the world.  The song tells a compelling and gripping story on how Exiles and Immigrants have built and fought for this country and are still fighting to this day, and how politics has taken such a terrible turn on this important issue.  To achieve the first stage of the project we need your support to raise $8,500.00. The first stage is to complete the Album.  Some of the songs for the Album are recorded, but as an independent musician, with no budget; needed marketing has been difficult, and for this reason they will become part of the Mother Of Exiles Album project.  There are four additional songs, one being the title song "Mother Of Exiles."  

As mentioned the title song Mother of Exiles has been recorded and we are looking to build a Fan Base of core supporters; interested parties; musicians, celebrities, corporate sponsors to help us Market the Single, participate with us to raise awareness on the importance of immigration and how it has, and will continue to strengthen our country, as well as your generous support to help us raise the needed capital to complete the Album.    The Single, Mother of Exiles is up-tempo, and presents a real political issue that effects us all through music in a positive way, without negativity or encouraging divisiveness making the song, and production inclusive for all.  It's the song about us and the many generations before us!    It's the song of the children of America past and present "our posterity" of generations that have safeguarded this country so it may never ceases to be the country of hope, prosperity, freedom and peace for all. 

 Without your generous financial support, and getting involved with us "The Julio Matta Project" joining and expanding a global Fan Club, and expanding our voices, the dream of completing the Mother Of Exiles Album would be difficult.  We would miss an opportunity "as one people" through beautiful music; and future Freedom and Unity Concerts, wherever allowed; to come together and speak out on this serious issues of Immigration happening right here right now.  We need your financial support, and help to build our Fan Base to get involved with us and help us advocate throughout the United States, and around the world; that America will forever stand as the land where the poor, those forced by tyranny to flee their lands yearning to breathe free, seeking hope, prosperity and peace; will always see our Sentinel's light guiding her children to the shores of freedom.  

Your contribution and participation is the lifeline to my project and dream.  What we need:

Your support to help us raise our initial $8,500.00 will allow us to:

  1. Establish worldwide distribution for sells of our Single: Mother Of Exiles;
  2. Completing the musical scoring for the four new song left to record, and expansion of the musical scores for the music video production in Stage II of our project, 
  3. Studio time is expensive and we need to complete our recording not only in a great studio, but also have great engineering,
  4. Many of the songs will be recorded with live Strings, and Horn Sections, as well as professional singers will also help us complete the production,
  5. Marketing and Promotion
  6. Artwork and Design
  7. Videographer so we can continue to document the progress of the project and keep everyone up to date.  You will see the project as it comes together because of your generous donations through our website, YouTube, and social media, 
  8. We will have musical guest to expand our live recording capabilities and future performances, 
  9. Mixing and mastering, which is expensive but essential to the finish product. 

Will your generous financial support help us distribute the Single worldwide so others can participate financially and support our campaign to complete the Mother Of Exiles Album and move on to Stage II?

Ariella Records is among one of the fastest growing companies with offices in Canada, California, Zurich, and Switzerland.  Distribution, Marketing and Artist development is just some of the services this Artist- friendly company owed by Jason and Mandi Lafauci have helped scores of new artist get their music heard around the world.   Without your generous donations we would not have the funds to pay for the above-mentioned necessities to complete our first stage and produce a stunning professional, great sounding Album, as we market our new Single "Mother Of Exiles."  You can hear our new Single at:  

https://www.reverbnation.com/q/6m0lb4

Your support will not only help us market the single and complete the Album, your support is key to help us reach our initial financial goal of $8,500.00, while we prepare ourselves for the second stage, which is the production of the Mother Of Exiles music video.  Stage two will be a separate campaign, but in advance, we would greatly appreciate for those who may be in a position to provide generous contributions to help us move that much close to hiring the production team needed to finalize the script that will tell this story, and to complete the production of the music video which will bring the Mother of Exiles to life for all to participate and enjoy.  It is our story!!      

The Impact

I've worked in recording studios on projects in the past.  On those occasions, the project was always defined by the budget, which is almost always costly.  Now, I've been given this incredibly, spiritual enriched opportunity to share, and continue advocating for those who can not advocate for themselves through music; but I cannot ask the musicians and engineers involved to commit their reputations and careers without making it the best it can be.  And that costs big bucks! 

The project will also give musicians, songwriters, singers, producers, scriptwriters; video/film production companies; known artist; celebrities; corporations, TV and Radio Hosts, Fans, and generous donors the opportunity to get involved and help us reach our goals and bring the issue of Immigration to the forefront.   Additionally, with your support we can continue to grow our worldwide Fan Base, which is key to our success.   One of the goals of this campaign is to reach like-minded people for collaboration, raise money in exchange for early access; rewards, and Perks you can used daily or exhibit proudly for participating in this musical movement.  We also want to spread the word through your participation on a global scale because the issue of "Immigration" is important and global.  The more people we can get involved in this campaign to support us by purchasing our “Mother Of Exiles" Single, which will help us raise the capital for the second part of our musical journey (the production of our Mother Of Exiles music video), your support to complete the Album will enhance our chances of succeeding in reaching people everywhere, and anywhere around the world so they can also participate in this social and musical movement, and financially help us reach our goals. 

Our campaign will give you the basics on our efforts through videos and electronic correspondence showing or indicating the different stages of the project’s progression.  Beyond that we encourage you to ask us questions, donate and get involved.  We developed the "Mother of Exiles" to have the benefit of talking about this important issue of immigration through music, so get involved, let us tell your story, and enjoy making history!  We believe we are really onto an easier way to face political and social issues with the grace and ease of music. 

THIS IS HAPPENING!!!  With the help of Ariella Records, we envision the distribution and sells of our Single "Mother Of Exiles” to being in June 2016. The distribution and sales of our Single coupled with your generous donations will provide us with the financial support we need to continue working on the Album's completion.   We will begin recording the rest of the Album, as well as mixing and mastering starting on or about end of June 2016 through November 2016 with musicians from Arlington, VA, Maryland, Florida, California, and Puerto Rico.  Here again, your generous financial support will allow us to bring these A list musicians to our Studio in VA, or travel to the needed locations to meet up with our A list musicians and guest artist that are not residents of Maryland.    As stated, we plan to expand the scoring of our recorded songs, expand the musical scoring for the music video Mother Of Exiles, with several fantastic arrangers, some of which are donating their time.  But writing out all the charts, as well as hiring top session players, securing a top studio and engineer, and all the mixing and mastering for a project of this quality is an extremely expensive undertaking.  Still, it's one that I believe so many will be touched by the message of the song, for which I cordially ask for your support, participation and donations.  

Join Us and help us bring Mother of Exiles to a reality:

1) We ask you to support us by buying our Single to keep the message alive and the project moving forward, 2) Have you ever thought about using music to express yourself, 3) Do you want to be part of a music revolution that is bigger than anything you have ever been part of, 4) Are you interested in facing issues that have stood the test of time through beautiful music, 5) Are you a professional musician, singer, videographer, scriptwriter, music producer, film/video producer, corporation, celebrity or TV/Radio Host who believes in getting involved in social issues, 6) Is music the voice you love to express and share with individuals like myself on important issues such as immigration.  If so, we ask you to become part of our Core Support Team, get involved, buy our Single and/or donate and participate and support us.  Your donations will be greatly appreciated and used to complete this first stage of this project.  If you could afford a little bit more, my dream of making the Mother Of Exiles music video a reality becomes a bit more closer and again for that I sincerely appreciate your involvement.

Other Ways You Can Help

 If you find yourself unable to donate, you can still be a huge part of the campaign by getting the word out! 

A few things you could do to help us out beyond donating:

·  Sharing this campaign on any and all social media outlets that you may use!

·  These include, but are not limited to, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.

·  Sharing this campaign via word of mouth!

·  If you love Personal contact, do not be afraid to tell your Grandparents, your Aunt, your brother;   Your second cousin, Billy-Bob-Joe from downs the street, or old man Jenkins from up the block! 

Additional Help to get us the exposure we need to bring out this dynamic Album and future music video:

·  Call your Senator, your Congressmen, organizations that support social issues like Immigration Reform, your favorite Artist, Actor, Oprah, Ellen, Jimmy Fallen, Rachel Maddow, anyone who has influence to expose social issues,  who loves people and believe in justice to get involved and donate so we can push the Single and have the adequate financial support to participate in live concerts of freedom and unity, with A list musicians on immigration and social issues, which is costly to move such a production;

Any level of support is appreciated as we try to get this project funded! Email, text, call, or even use mores code to get the word out, literally any sort of exposure will help us make this campaign a success!

·  Get individuals from overseas that you know or are related to; to participate and get involved; donate and take the Mother Of Exiles live performance overseas, which is also a costly venture, but so important because our brothers and sisters from overseas are part of the generations of Exiles and Immigrants that have helped our country become the beacon of hope and freedom.   

Finally, if you find yourself on this campaign page often, be sure to use the built-in Indiegogo.com share tools to share the campaign on any and all platforms!  Once again, we would like to thank you for checking out our Indiegogo campaign page.  If you have any more questions or would like to contact me for general inquires, email me at:  oshun1productions@gmail.com or you can visit our contact page at www.thejuliomattaproject.com or www.facebook.com/theJulioMattaProject/, or YouTube at: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X-JHHHPiet0

If you want to get involved and donate, participate, be an advocate for this important project and its message, email, leave a comment, post your interest and leave information where we can contact you or your organization, and together lets make "Mother Of Exiles" a success in 2016.  I feel in my heart that this is not only an exciting project to get involved in, it's about the true spirit of our country built and defended by the children of generations of Exiles and Immigrants... it is our story.
story_txt:
Music The Universal Language of the Soul:
Hello, my name is Julio L. Matta. I'm
a Native New Yorker from the South Bronx, of Hispanic Origin. A
songwriter, composer, percussionist, keyboardist, producer of Pop, Latin Pop,
R&B, Jazz Fusion, Afro-Cuban, Adult Contemporary, Love Ballads,
Pop/Country, Instrumental, Urban/R&B, World, and Soft Rock music.  I would greatly appreciate your support and donations to help me reach my funding goals to make this dream come true.  Not only will your donation help me complete my debut Album and put us closer to producing our music video, you will be joining me in advocating the importance of Immigration Reform to help bring out those living in the shadows who deserve a chance at achieving the American Dream.  As
a musician I've been blessed with over 25 years of extensive experience
performing with many well-known artists throughout the United States, Puerto
Rico, and Europe.  Artist such as: 
Jon Akkerman; Marilyn McCoo & Billy Davis Jr.; Klaus Dordinger; Donna
Summers, Gato Barbieri; Lou Rawls; Willie Colon, Justo Betancourt; and
many others.  I began my musical endeavors at the young age of 14 in New
York City.  At the age of 18, I was drafted and served in the United
States Army and after 12 years of service, I decided to return to college
acquiring several Degrees, which includes an MBA.  During this same time
period, I also worked as a Civil Rights Practitioner for the Federal Government
in several Federal agencies.  As a Public Servant, I held the positions of
Director of Civil Rights for the U. S. Marine Corps at the Pentagon, Director
of Civil Rights, for the United States Merit Systems Protection Board, which
was the old Civil Service Commission, Senior Enforcement Investigator for both
the United States Equal Employment Opportunity Commission and Wage and Hour
Division of the U. S. Department of Labor, and ended my Federal Civil Service
career at the US Department of Labor as the Deputy Chief of Enforcement
for Civil Rights in Washington, DC.  
The diversity of music that I have learned
and performed, nurtured by people with a vast cultural history; are all
joined by a universal language, which is music.    This experience
coupled with the responsibility of protecting the Civil and
Labor Rights of thousands of individuals throughout the United States; has
enrich my soul by serving and protecting my fellow American brothers and
sisters of all races, sex, age, religion, sexual preferences, disabilities,
color and nationalities.  My journey has been serving and protecting the
children of generations of Exiles and Immigrants; seeds conceived in
America but its roots touching the world hungry with hope for prosperity,
and freedom.
The Drive and Vision:
I love people, period.   Yes, we will
all go through life meeting up with some who just don't get it.  But that
is your choice to accept or protest, and I protested by getting into the
trenches overseas, and here right at home.  I love people because the
majority of those individuals that have touch my life musically or otherwise;
no matter what nationality or cultural difference we had as individuals, were
intelligent, decent, hardworking people all looking for the same thing; to
better themselves as an individuals and insure the safety, and prosperity for
their families.   As a Musician, Disabled Veteran, Public Servant, and
Cancer Survivor, as I am sure hundreds have asked; {why and how have we
encourage divisiveness?}  It tears at the very essence of my soul.  
The Drive:
Understanding a little bit about who I am, in
someway or another, musically or publicly, people have and continue to be the center of my
journey through life.   My drive; as a man, a veteran, public servant;
Hispanic; and yes American born; we are slowly walking away from who we are,
what we stand for, most importantly; what so many of our children through
generations of Exile, and Immigrants have died to ensure the beacon of hope,
prosperity and freedom never dies.  We must never allow that sacred
promise be broken to any decent man, woman or child who seeks the protection of
our Sentinel; Our Guardian of Freedom, Our Mother Of Exiles.  
 Although, this is my first album, and musical project I have many stories
to tell.  Stories based on the diverse life I have lived among so many
cultures; difficulties, desires, and hopes that makes us all the same.  We
The Children were promised; in writing to bear witness, and in blood defending
to secure an establishment of Justice, domestic tranquility, defend and promote
the general Welfare, and insure the Children's security of liberty for
themselves, and their Posterity.  Posterity; this is where we are missing
the point in my opinion, the promise does not end with us, it is secured
bearing witness and blood for all future generations to come, and live as one
people; " E PLURIBUS UNUM" "OUT OF MANY, ONE"   We should never adapt a political posture where people are held back from hope and prosperity because of their religion, race or color of their skin.  History has shown us that unity is the survival and strength of any great team, organization and yes a progressive and great country.

the best way I know about what I have seen and experienced.  I need your

story:
HI! 

So, I've been working on this album for close to three years and its finally ready to be released. In 2012, I started hosting a weekly songwriting workshop with friends in Monterey, California. Every week, I gave the class a song-prompt and we would come back the next week and share what we made. After a summer of writing and editing songs, I had a new portfolio with the best material I had ever written. I chose 11 of my favorite pieces to tell the story of Letters.

I've had the pleasure of working with an all-star team of musicians: my producer Bennett Jackson, my engineer and co-producer Jesse DeCarlo, the wizardly Jake Sherman, Viola-champ Elizabeth Hanako Cho, Vocalist-extraordinaire Veronika Morscher, super-talent Maddie Rice, Bass-great Nat Shuirman, Jazz-grass maestro John Eun, and guitar-Santa Ryan Scott. I picked up quite a few instruments myself as well!

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to allocate $500 towards mixing fees to cover the last round of mix revisions, $500 towards mastering, and $1000 for promotion (radio campaign, facebook ads, blog outreach, paid services) 

Other Ways You Can Help

Strapped for cash? I totally get it. Sharing this post with friends or on Facebook would also be totally neat if you can!
story_txt:
HI!  So, I've been working on this album for close to three years and its finally ready to be released. In 2012, I started hosting a weekly songwriting workshop with friends in Monterey, California. Every week, I gave the class a song-prompt and we would come back the next week and share what we made. After a summer of writing and editing songs, I had a new portfolio with the best material I had ever written. I chose 11 of my favorite pieces to tell the story of Letters.
I've had the pleasure of working with an all-star team of musicians: my producer Bennett Jackson, my engineer and co-producer Jesse DeCarlo, the wizardly Jake Sherman, Viola-champ Elizabeth Hanako Cho, Vocalist-extraordinaire Veronika Morscher, super-talent Maddie Rice, Bass-great Nat Shuirman, Jazz-grass maestro John Eun, and guitar-Santa Ryan Scott. I picked up quite a few instruments myself as well!   What We Need & What You Get My goal is to allocate $500 towards mixing fees to cover the last round of mix revisions, $500 towards mastering, and $1000 for promotion (radio campaign, facebook ads, blog outreach, paid services) 
    Other Ways You Can Help
Strapped for cash? I totally get it. Sharing this post with friends or on Facebook would also be totally neat if you can!

story:
We Are GR!

Stack Rapids is a Hip Hop mixtape we've been curating for the past year. It consists of an hour and 20 minutes (20 tracks) jam packed with some of the best Hip Hoppers our city of Grand Rapids has to offer. It's versatile, diverse, and most importantly REALLY fricking good! We plan to release the project on June 16th, #LoveGR Day for FREE download off various media outlets, but with all this worked compiled, all the collaborations, and the #WeAreGR message circling the project, that just doesn't seem like a big enough splash..

With your contribution we are looking to raise $3,500 to purchase 5,000 physical CD's. With those CD's, we will flood the Grand Rapids metropolitan area, shinning light and deserved recognition for all 30+ Rapidians on the project. Each artist will get 50 CD's of their own to share with their individually unique fan base, give away free at shows, or anyway they can think to capitalize on the opportunity. We will also collaborate with local businesses by setting up "pick up" locations for the free CD's. These locations will not only serve as outlets for distributing this project, but will also drive more potential customers into the local business markets, helping create and push this #LocalSupportsLocal movement. 

Stack Rapids (The Mixtape)

1. Stack Rapids (Intro) (ft. Fable The Poet
2. GR Drive (ft. Steven Malcolm)
3. Green Clouds (ft. Conway & WuZee)
4. T.ender L.oving C.heater (ft. K Veen)
5. Rap In The Rap (ft. J Rob & Lady Ace Boogie)
6. Nxggas Be Chillin' (ft. Nych G & Jus Flyy)
7. Why Lie? (ft. Nate Paulson & Razz Na$-T)
8. Nothin' New (ft. Garitt Riley)
9. See Me (ft. Tonio Trice, Big-E, & Cheeks)
10. Downtown (ft. Venson Dix)
11. Side Bxtch (ft. Nych G)
12. Dabtodat (ft. Boo Bee Murrz)
13. Hydro (ft. Jay Chill & Rosewood2055)
14. Bands In The Club (ft. Unkey Fonz)
15. Puff Daddy Remix (ft. E-Will, Aramis, Kenny Matze, & Nych G)
16. Count On You (ft. Jous 82 & Rick Chyme)
17. Do It Right (ft. Scott Erickson)
18. It's Time (ft. Rugga)
19. Next (ft. Chan The Man)
20. **BONUS TRACK**



What We Need & What You Get

Most independent music fundraisers ask for funding to do a whole arrange of things from instrumental purchasing, studio time, filming, you name it.. NOT us! We've done all the hard work already, even a lot of the expensive work. The only thing we are looking to help fund, is the distribution of this project. With all the hard work circling this mixtape, it would be a shame to not see it get the recognition it deserves and have it fall on only a few deaf ears.

We are looking to raise $3,500 to go directly into the production of 5,000 CD's that we will in turn give out for FREE.99! The goal is to demand respect for the hip hop community and help enlighten the culture we've been forming for years here in GR.

The perks of donating are pretty awesome, or we think so at least. Anything helps and we're extremely grateful for any size of investment. We're "starving artists" for goodness sake, we'll cherish and savor any type of generosity.

Other Ways You Can Help

If we had money to spend on distributing the music, we definitely would, so we understand if you're in our boat too! That's perfectly fine, we'd still appreciate your support all the same. You can still help us by sharing our campaign and video with anyone who may enjoy it too!


Thank you, can't wait to share all this amazing music with you.

Sincerely,

Ajax Stacks

story:
Publicity And Promotions

 There is something for everybody and this is for you. Welcome to the Strange Jazz Universe. I’m Ron Bruner Sr. drummer and founder. We are a Jam Band with Jazz, Funk & Electro tendencies. 

I'm a native of Compton California. Married to Pam Bruner 35yrs. With 3 sons, Ronald Jr, Stephen "Thundercat", Jameel "Kintaro". 

My Billboard Magazine interview http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6875266/three-grammy-nominated-sons. 

I've been a participant in the L A Music scene for many years. From the late 70's to the present. And I've played and or recorded with many artists including The West Coast Git Down, J*Davey, The Temptations, Diana Ross, The Supremes, Howard Hewitt, Gary Bartz, Chameleon (E/A Artist), Jody Watley, Ain’t Misbehavin’ (Broadway), Disney, Randy Crawford, and Gladys Knight to name a few.

After spending so much time working for artists and supporting their visions I began to develop my own and I started a band (in '85) called Cephas which gave me an outlet to write and express my own ideas. 

Later in '96, having been a Miles Davis fan for many years I started a tribute band dedicated to his 70's electric music which I did for about 8 years. One evening while sitting around the dinner table with my family, I queried them by asking what did they think this new band should be called. It was my son Stephen (Thundercat), being inspired by a TV show that was out at the time called "Strange Universe", spoke up and said "Dad you should call your band "Strange Jazz Universe"! And as you can see it stuck. 

In 2005 I finally recorded and released our first original music project “Live In Leimert Park” featuring Pam Bruner, Louis Taylor, John Beasley, Thundercat and Phillip Charles. 

In 2008 we released the CD “Mission ll (Too Possible)” with Rick Z., Kamasi Washington, Thundercat, John Beasley, and Brandon Coleman. Both of these are on CD Baby.

 In 2013 we partnered with the Tokyo-based indie label The L A Sound for the release of our 3rd project “New Space Age Materials” with Kamasi Washington, Edmund Velasco, Thundercat, Stanley Clarke, Del Atkins, Fidel Winzey, Jameel “Kintaro” Bruner, Ariana Charlene, Brandon Coleman, Cameron Graves, Bryan Evans, Jinshi Ozaki, John Z., Phillip Charles and Rick Z.

As you can see, my being a bandleader with a vision has been in motion for quite some time. And as a music fan I am very elated and excited when my favorite artists share their musical thoughts with me. So likewise as an artist we endeavor to do the same for you, our fans.

 We are in the home stretch of completing our 4th recording with the release date targeted for late July. On this project are some of my favorites. N’dambi, Tyra Juliette, Melaina Williams, Louis Taylor, Edmund Velasco, Thundercat, Del Atkins, Teja Veal (she’s from Atlanta), Jameel “Kintaro” Bruner, Bryan Evans, Rick Z., Brandon Coleman, more to be announced. Our musical universe just keeps expanding. 

With this project we are crossing a new threshold and will reach farther than we have before but we need your assistance. Marketing, Publicity and Promotion are the reason we're reaching out. These tools are available but are costly. One firm with whom we think would be a wonderful fit for our ensemble quoted me $6,000 for a 3 month package.

In addition to Studio Time for Completion, Mastering, Album Art, Vinyl and CD production, Video Production, ‘Publicity and Promotions’ has a price tag. And your contributions of any size will help

 After the release of our 4th Album, we are going to thank our Japanese fans by traveling there for a series of performances, and we are going to cap off the trip with an interview in Drummer Magazine Japan. 

As we all know this "new" business of music is ever evolving and ever so quickly. Channels are still available with everything needed to succeed but it costs a lot of money. Please do give any amount that like but those of you that can, take advantage of our Perks. Every bit goes toward our goal. Thank you in advance for your support.

Peace

story:
My story 

It all has started when I was 3 years old and my mum placed me on the kitchen table to perform for our family guests. Since then, I was coming back on that table, singing some made up songs and loving all the attention I would receive :D 

Eventually, I was too big for the table and my mum decided to get music lessons for me. I started piano and guitar lessons when I was 8, and I bought my first keyboard from the 1st communion's money! Since then, I would escape into my room,practising the songs I would learn at piano lessons plus making up my own melodies. I remember my older brother Michael, coming in at night to my room and playing on that keyboard together, trying to reconstruct the songs heard on the radio, while parents were asleep, unable to tell us off for staying up that late.  When I was 6, I've joined the band "Promyczki" associated with church, and for the next 10 years I would travel and  perform with them in hundreds of places around Europe (that was amaaaazing time!!!) When I was 15, I was too big (again) for the band, but grown up enough to join Music school in Vocal Class. I then believed I will become an Opera diva, and so did my mum.



Unfortunately, my mum's dream didn't come true, her daughter decided to be rebel and play her own music. When I was 19, I came to London, loving the idea of a big world with plenty of possibilities and potential. But it wasn't that easy! What a surprise! I didn't know where and how to start, I would create more songs but keep them to myself, not knowing how to promote myself, who to tell, who to ask. I had to work full time to pay my living, years were passing by and I was stuck with my head full of dreams, knowing, believing, hoping, that one day...One day!! THIS DAY IS TODAY!!! Today, my friends, I know where I want to go, and how to get there, it took me 9 years but that only makes it more special. I'm more experienced, more ready, more focused on success. With your help, I know I will not let you down and I will make most of it!

What's so expensive??!!

I have invested countless amount of time on working on my demos, and obviously, regardless of how tiring or frustrating at times it was, with extreme pleasure. With less pleasure though, I also had to invest money in professional equipment, that is: New Laptop good enough to run the recording software, Logics software, electric piano (Roland), microphone; (AKG C214), sound card/interface (Apogee One), Kalimba, stationary as chair, cables, stands, memory discs etc. I also covered promotion expenses (photoshoots, video, leaflets, accessories, website, business cards etc) 

In total I have spent around £3500 in order to get to the point where I am now. 

I am ready to record and get the songs out to the world, however I'm missing £1500

to finalise the project. 

 Here is a chart where you can have a look at what you are contributing to:


Risks & Challenges

If I don't reach my goal, I will still record the EP, it will however delay the process until I will be able to fund the rest myself. I've planned the release of the EP for June this year, and that would be so amazing to have it done by summer; it would allow me to start life shows while is still warm and sunny. I'm also planning to visit my home town after 1.5 year, and I  SO wish to hand in my first CD to my mum, I want to thank her for all the time and money she invested in me, for believing in me no matter what (Love you mum, hope someone will translate it to you :))

mum & I :)


The Impact

great news is that I can also offer you something in exchange for your generosity! For each amount you will contribute, there is a perk for you to get!

I hope you will find something for yourself! :)

Check out the list on the main page!!!

If, by miracle, I would raise more then expected, I would be able to record the full length album (13 songs) rather then just an EP (6 songs) and with best musicians I could possibly hire!!!


Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you might not be able to contribute, but if you wish to help, you still can! 

You can get the word out and make some noise about my campaign, share it with 

people who you think could and would like to contribute!


Peace, love & rockandroll my friends, let's do it!!!!!


Any questions, do not hesitate to contact me on:

www.facebook.com/marlabellmusic or marlabellmusic@gmail.com

story:
Greetings and thanks for checking out my project!

After recording a bunch of new music over the past 6-8 months, with production from a few producers from all over the world, I've begun the process of something that I've been looking forward to doing: Making a professional music video! Even better, I'm lucky enough to be working with a VERY talented video production team out of New York City to make not just one, but TWO new music videos! 

I've worked hard, both physically and creatively, to make this next phase possible. I've been able to raise most of the money for this project on my own (privately and by working) but I'm going to need some help with this last bit of monetary funding.

WHERE WILL YOUR MONEY GO? 

This $4500 will go toward the costs of paying my directors/producers for their services, the man power and time needed for filming and editing, helping to pay for a couple of possible filming permits and the few miscellaneous costs that inevitably come up when doing projects such as this. Some of the shots and locations will be filmed in Manhattan which is hectic in itself (as you can probably imagine!). The high quality of visuals and aesthetic that we are pursuing require quite a bit of work, but the final product will be incredible!

^^^You can find audio clips of the new songs that I've been working on over the past few months at the top of the page!^^^

Any amount helps! Even if you can't donate monetarily just sharing this post would mean a lot and be of great assistance!

Feel free to reach out with any questions or comments by clicking the "contact" button up top and thanks so much for your time!


Peace and Love,

ORLANDO 

www.facebook.com/musicoforlando

www.musicoforlando.com

story:
"THE OPPORTUNITY OF A LIFETIME LAST IN THE LIFETIME OF THE OPPORTUNITY"

Dear reader,

I wanted to take a few moments to share my heart with you and give you the opportunity to get to know more about me and the journey's God has taken me on. I have been an "aspiring" artist since I was 16 years old. I started playing guitar at about 10 years old. I've always been fascinated with the ability music has to speak in a "different language" to people and influence our everyday lives...whether positively or negatively. No matter what I was going through I could always pick up my guitar or an instrument and just lay everything on the table for hours. I have  performed music on stage to larger audiences for years and have toured a little bit as well and it has been amazing, humbling and even frustrating at times- basically more of a growing experience first and for that I am thankful because we learn by more in our mistakes or in trial in the industry more than we do our successes. I gave my life to Jesus 5 years ago  in 2010  during college as God called me to greater things and my perspective on music changed( or rather expanded).

Allow me to fast forward. About 2 years ago  November 11, 2013 I traveled to Nashville, TN with my girlfriend and current wife Brittany. A Christian talent/booking agency had discovered some of my songs on a social media site and they asked me if I would be interested in performing in front of a panel of judges that included publicists, established producers, and record label A&R's. The goal was through them to be signed by a major label by some of my favorite artists and worship leaders around the world. It was a huge blessing and I was very humbled. One of the judges, named Nathan Walters. Nathan Walters is a former member of the Christian pop band Plus One that sold 1/2 a million records.  Long story short I wasn't ready to be signed because  I hadn't been properly developed by my previous independent record label.

Nathan and I have kept in contact and he agreed to produce and help me get in the studio with some of the best musicians in the industry. Nathan is also connected to radio promoters and label executives who help keep artist songs current to the music industry standards.

Furthermore, a lot of time has gone by and I have been in prayer about this for some time because I want to do God’s will in everything I set my heart to do. I really wanted to prioritize my life and really go after the things God has had me dreaming about and my BIGGEST goal was marrying my best friend Brittany. I told Nathan before I jumped back in to the big sea of the music industry I wanted to be married and have a nice place to live and settle in for a bit. Brittany has always been supportive of my purpose in Christ but she has also helped me to be patient and slow down a bit because everything works best in His time. The Bible states to “let God transform you into a new person by changing the way you think. THEN you will learn to know God’s will for you which is good, pleasing and perfect.” I am so blessed by you reading this and supporting my journey. My goal is to raise $6500 which will cover the recording process, travel(for Brittany and I a few trips), hotel stay and radio promotion. I pray and believe that God will use you to sow a seed and invest in this dream God has put in me!
story_txt:
"THE OPPORTUNITY OF A LIFETIME LAST IN THE LIFETIME OF THE
OPPORTUNITY"
Dear reader,
I wanted to take a few moments to share my heart with you and give you the
opportunity to get to know more about me and the journey's God has taken me on.
I have been an "aspiring" artist since I was 16 years old. I started
playing guitar at about 10 years old. I've always been fascinated with the
ability music has to speak in a "different language" to people and
influence our everyday lives...whether positively or negatively. No matter
what I was going through I could always pick up my guitar or an instrument and
just lay everything on the table for hours. I have  performed music on stage
to larger audiences for years and have toured a little bit as well and it has been
amazing, humbling and even frustrating at times- basically more of a growing
experience first and for that I am thankful because we learn by more in our mistakes or in trial in
the industry more than we do our successes. I gave my life to Jesus 5 years ago 
in 2010  during college as God called me to greater things and my perspective on music
changed( or rather expanded). 
Allow me to fast forward. About 2 years ago  November 11, 2013 I
traveled to Nashville, TN with my girlfriend and current wife Brittany. A
Christian talent/booking agency had discovered some of my songs on a social
media site and they asked me if I would be interested in performing in front of
a panel of judges that included publicists, established producers, and record
label A&R's. The goal was through them to be signed by a major label by
some of my favorite artists and worship leaders around the world. It was a huge
blessing and I was very humbled. One of the judges, named Nathan Walters.
Nathan Walters is a former member of the Christian pop band Plus One that sold
1/2 a million records.  Long story short I wasn't ready to be signed
because  I hadn't been properly developed by my previous independent
record label. 
Nathan and I have kept in contact and he agreed to produce and help me get
in the studio with some of the best musicians in the industry. Nathan is also
connected to radio promoters and label executives who help keep artist songs
current to the music industry standards. 
Furthermore, a lot of time has gone by and I have been in prayer about this
for some time because I want to do God’s will in everything I set my heart to
do. I really wanted to prioritize my life and really go after the things God
has had me dreaming about and my BIGGEST goal was marrying my best friend
Brittany. I told Nathan before I jumped back in to the big sea of the music
industry I wanted to be married and have a nice place to live and settle in for
a bit. Brittany has always been supportive of my purpose in Christ but she has
also helped me to be patient and slow down a bit because everything works best
in His time. The Bible states to “let God transform you into a new person by
changing the way you think. THEN you will learn to know God’s will for you
which is good, pleasing and perfect.” I am so blessed by you reading this and
supporting my journey. My goal is to raise $6500 which will cover the recording
process, travel(for Brittany and I a few trips), hotel stay and radio
promotion. I pray and believe that God will use you to sow a seed and invest in
this dream God has put in me!

story:
Iron Composer is an instant composition contest.

Five composers are invited to compete in person. On the morning of the event, the finalists are assigned an instrumentation and a secret musical ingredient. They have just five hours to write a piece of music that incorporates those two elements. Their work is performed and judged on a public concert that same evening.

Analog Arts established Iron Composer in 2007. The annual contest is held at Baldwin-Wallace Conservatory in suburban Cleveland. WCLV 104.9 FM broadcasts the evening concert live to its diverse audience in Northeast Ohio, and people from around the world can tune into the simulcast on WCLV.org. Since 2014, Ingeunity Festival Cleveland has been a presenting partner for Iron Composer.

Support the Composers and Performers...

There has never been, and there never will be, a fee to enter Iron Composer. The last thing composers need is an additional expense. Since this is one of the only contests which requires composers to be physically present, we do everything we can to reduce travel costs by providing free hosting and local transportation.

Analog Arts has cultivated several partnerships to keep the production costs of Iron Composer to a bare minimum. Every year, we have to raise money to cover the costs of performers and the prize purse. 

Because all of the music must be learned in just one rehearsal prior to the concert and radio broadcast, only the best performers are suitable for Iron Composer. Fortunately, Cleveland is home to some of the world's greatest musicians, and this is the talent pool that Analog Arts taps into for each competition.

Your contribution will help us commission five new works from a diverse and talented field of composers. It will also help sustain one of the world's most unique composition contests!

Other ways you can help...

If your business would benefit from broader exposure to supporters of classical music, advertising is available during the radio broadcast. We provide a diverse range of sponsorship and branding opportunities. For more information, please email info@analogarts.org or call (443) 977-6063.

If you can't contribute any money for Iron Composer 2016, don't forget to come to Iron Composer 2015! This competition will be held on Friday, September 4 at Baldwin Wallace University. 

We have a fantastic lineup of composers from around the world:

2015 FINALISTS:

Kirsten Broberg is an associate professor of composition at the University of North Texas. Her work has been performed by the Kronos Quartet, the Chicago Symphony Orchestra, and ICE. Her work has been supported by awards from the Fromm Music Foundation and American Composers Forum. Kirsten is also a seasoned entrepreneur, having founded Ensemble Dal Niente (2004–2010) and Ensemble 61. [www.kirstenbroberg.com]
Dorothy Hindman is an assistant professor of composition at the University of Miami Frost School of Music. She has collaborated with percussionist Evelyn Glennie, bassist Robert Black, the Goliard Ensemble, the Gregg Smith Singers, and the Freon Ensemble. She hosts a weekly radio show on WVUM 90.5 FM, and she recently spoke at a conference in Sicily about the religious implications in spectral music. [www.dorothyhindman.org]
Ryan Keebaugh is an assistant professor of music at Eastern Mennonite University. His music has been performed by the Ethos Collective, Sesquisharp Productions, the Great Noise Ensemble. He has earned residencies and awards from Wildacres Artist Colony, Factory 449 Theatre Collective, ASCAP, and the Virginia Music Educators Association. [www.ryankeebaugh.com]
Rica Narimoto is a lecturer at Aichi University of the Arts, Kanazawa University and Kinjo Gakuin University, and a researcher in Nagoya City University School of Design and Architecture. She has won the Kuwabara and the Irino Prize. Her works have been featured at Gaudeamus Music Week, the Alexandrina Contemporary Music Biennale, and at the International Festival of Modern Art’s 2D2N. [www.rica-narimoto.jimdo.com]
Tawnie Olson has won awards from the SOCAN foundation and the Guelph Chamber Choir/Musica Viva. Her work has been performed by the Calgary Philharmonic Orchestra, the Land’s End Ensemble, the Trinity Church Choir in NY, and the Toronto Chamber Choir. Her works have been recorded by various artists, including the Canadian Chamber Choir, bassoonist Rachael Elliott, and oboist Catherine Lee. [www.tawnieolson.com]


JUDGES

Stephen Hartke is the chair of composition at Oberlin College Conservatory. His prizes include the Rome Prize from the American Academy, two Koussevitzky Music Foundation Commission Grants, and a Guggenheim Fellowship. He has been commissioned by the New York Philharmonic, Glimmerglass Opera, the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall, and Harvard Musical Association. He won the Grammy Award for Best Contemporary Classical Composition in 2013. [www.stephenhartke.com]
The other two judges will be announced closer to the competition.


SCHEDULE

Finalists Forum
Thursday, September 3, 2015
5:30-7:00 p.m. – Kulas Hall (Room K115), Baldwin Wallace Conservatory

The finalists will discuss their music and careers. This is a great opportunity to meet the composers and learn more about their music!

Competition and Concert
Friday, September 4, 2015
9 a.m. – Opening Ceremony, Chamber Hall

The instrumentation and the secret musical ingredient are revealed!

8 p.m. – Concert, Gamble Auditorium, Kulas Hall

All five composers have their music performed live in concert and on the radio. Prizes are awarded and the title of Iron Composer is bestowed!

VENUE:

Baldwin Wallace Conservatory
Kulas Hall, Gamble Auditorium
96 Front Street
Berea, OH

Directions
Free street parking.

story:
Hi my names Paul Isaac. I'm a former Atlantic recording artists from the band Muse.
We need your help with our new project
People From Venus .
PFV has finished writing and recording all
10 songs for our new record called #onlylovewillsavethehumanrace //
We need your support to help us get the songs mixed mastered and printed. We also are working with Howard Rosen promotions to do a big college radio promotion all across the county. We feel that were all in it together in this world now . It's time to get inside our hearts and let them bloom till the world is a bloom of us all.


The funding for this project goes to the mastering / printing of this Record, and College Radio promotion in the USA. <3


The Bands objectives with this project is to first get #onlylovecansavethehumanrace printed ;)  A tour will follow to support radio air play across the USA. We will then find a small label to distribute our new record in America. At this point we will promote PFV in Europe PFV will do a good 6-12 month tour in Europe. We want to take you with us <3

Thank you so much for your support.


Paul Isaac


PFV PRESS LINKS BELOW:

story:
Hipsters.  Oldsters.  And  All The Lovers in Between,

Lend us your ears as we give you our hearts and offer this Music from the deepest part of our Beings. Casting our nets far and wide upon the cyber sea of Connection and Social Media, we are asking for your support in helping us raise $8000.00 needed to produce our first CD.
 
We play music that puts you in an altered state naturally
                               
We play music from all quarters of the Globe.
                
We play  music that you can trance and dance to.
                                 
 We play music that's well crafted with lyrics that Tanith Lee, Rumi, and Gil Scott Heron would have loved.
 
We play music informed by Mingus, Monk, Mitchell and Trane laid on top of a bittersweet Brazilian beat.

We play music that negates the war drum, believes in Quantum Dreaming and celebrates our shared Humanity and Heartbeat.

See you love us, you just don't know it yet. We want you to know us. We want to  share our music with you...... New World Music.....Music that makes your mind move and your body groove. And for your fine fabulous financial support we have  PERKS!
GREAT!!!!!       WONDERFUL!!!!!      GROOVY!!!!       PERKS!!!!


Budget Breakout/$8000.00

Studio Time/ Engineering/Recording...............................................$3000.00

Mixing/Mastering.................................................................................$950.000

CD's/ 1000............................................................................................$2000.00

Ad Min/Photos/Videos.......................................................................$500.00

Shipping.................................................................................................$500.00

Posters/Design/Materials/Printing..................................................$500.00

Marketing...............................................................................................$500.00


Beautiful Community, our main goal is raising funds for our first CD and making sure that all the costs are covered but in this age of Social Media, we understand how vital it is to have a dynamic internet presence. So we also need a great working website. Any extra monies raised will help us create a website so that we can stay in touch and reach out to you, our ever expanding delightful audience.

If you would like to know more about us, please read this fine article by Eric Swedlund

http://www.ericswedlund.com/temenos-quartet-excited-and-experienced/


~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~



TEMENOS QUARTET  plays music for The New Timeline: intelligent and emotionally evocative lyrics set to an eclectic collection of trance-dance grooves, powered by masterful musicianship and enlivened with high-spirited soulfulness featuring four of the Southwest's most enduring and original musical and artistic personalities. To-Ree'-Nee' Wolf / vocals and acoustic guitar, Heidi Wilson / sax and vocals, AmoChip Dabney / electric bass, brass, vocals, Will Clipman / drums and percussion.



Will Clipman           Heidi Wilson        To-Ree-Nee Wolf     AmoChip Dabney


Will Clipman: Drums and Percussion

•  Is a seven-time GRAMMY® Nominee

•  Has recorded over sixty albums

•  Plays over one hundred instruments

•  Is the house percussionist for Canyon Records

•  Has performed and recorded for twenty-five years with Gold & Platinum Record         winning Native American flutist  R. Carlos Nakai

http://www.willclipman.com/


Heidi Wilson: Saxophone and Vocals

•  Co-Founder (along with Ajule Rutlin of the Black Artist Group of St. Louis)  of               Eneke-the-Bird peforming company and arts organization that presented                     creative innovative music performances in the  U.S. Southwest for seventeen              years

•  Currently a performing member of Babamarimba of Tucson

•  Daughter of Professor Keith Wilson, concert clarinetist and Director of Yale                 Music School for forty years

 www.heidiwilsonfluidhealing.com  

www.babamarimba.com


To-Ree'-Nee' Wolf: Guitar and Vocals

•  Has opened for Larry Coryell, Brownie McGhee & Sonny Terry, Paul Geremia,               Tom Paxton, Dave Van Ronk, Jeanie Bryson and John Gorka

•  Currently performs in the singing duo The Scorpio Sisters with                                        Kathleen Williamson

•  Founding member of The Badgirl Storytelling Brigade, a performance art                       musical ensemble

•  Women On The Move Award Winner, 2003

•  Five-time Lumies Life Time Achievement Award Nominee

http://www.toreenee.com/


AmoChip Dabney:  Bass, Brass and Vocals

•  Is a two-time GRAMMY® Nominee

•  Has worked with Sun Ra and his Omniverse Arkestra, Cyril Neville of the                       Neville Bros. Band, Stephen Stills, Zydeco's Queen Ida and the worlds                             premiere Native American  flutist R. Carlos Nakai

•  Has appeared on over fifty albums

•  Engineered.  mixed, mastered, co-composed and performed on the 2005                     GRAMMY® Nominated Canyon Records  album People of Peace  with                               The R. Carlos Nakai Quartet

http://www.amochip.me/

story:
Hello, The Indigos here. We are a loud 8-piece funky rock band from Muncie, IN. By performing and singing about the importance of being yourself and following your passions, we are doing what we love and strive to encourage others do the same through. Right now we are working to become a professionally touring act within the next 1-3 years.

To make this happen, we are planning to do something crazy from July 16th – July 27th. We are heading out to the Viper Room in Los Angeles, CA on July 21st  and stopping for a few shows there and back including Las Vegas, NV, Beaumont, TX, Denver, CO, and Kansas City, MO just to name a few.

Not only are we fortunate enough to perform in LA with our friend and veteran of the road Rich Hardesty, but we also have the privilege of having some industry professionals coming out to see us. This is shaping up to be the break we need to make it to the next level – playing music professionally. Your support will go a long way to helping us make our dream come true. We will use the first $5,000 for gas, lodging and food for the band. The next $1,000 will help us take a videographer and stage crew with us. Anything past $6,000 will be put toward making the album for all of you even better.

We need $5,000 for road expenses:

This breaks down into $1,500 for gas for the van, $2,500 living expenses for the band for the duration of the tour, and an additional $1,000 in lodging expenses. Once we break $5,000, the next $1,200 will be used to take our videographer, a small stage crew with us, and some financial padding for the tour. Anything past that will go toward recording expenses for the album we are recoding later this year.

For supporting us, we’ve got some great perks for you!

We are so thankful for all of your support and any contribution that you are able to make. We have been fortunate enough to do well in Indiana so far, and we look forward to exploring new areas of music with you all. We’ve won Best Local Band of 2015, we’ve played many of the best venues in the state with more on the way, and had a blast every day with our fans – because when you’re around, we feel famous ;)

Right now we're all recent college grads or undergrads almost finished with our degrees, and right now we've got the desire and work ethic to pull off being a professionally touring act. We need your help now to help catalyze our progress.

We realize some of you are in our boat as well. Money can be an issue in everyday life and we understand. All we ask is that you share this with as many people as you can! Getting exposure helps us by getting word out there that we are trying to make a difference in the music industry and the world. If you're a fan of what we are doing, go ahead and hit that SHARE button.

Thank you for your support.

We love you all - The Indigos

story:
Short Summary



Hagiel previously known as Analoga K

http://www.hagiel.org

http:// www.facebook.com/hagiel.org

http://www.twitter.com/hagiel_org

http://www.reverbnation.com/hagiel


Artist/Singer/Songwriter/cie founder Specialties: Singing,video, acting, general stunts,songwriting, scriptwriting, poetry, monitor of youth video workshops,drawing,entrepreneurship, company founder. I also give back by supporting different causes.

Short bio

After doing back vocals for artists and being an artist invited in  jams nights of blues cats like Sonny Wolf, Jim Zeller, Carl Tremblay, Black Hats, etc. Hagiel previously known as Analoga K takes her place on the Blues/Roots scene. Some say she has a soulful voice that reflects her influences in gospel classic rock and blues. She would like also to try jazz in the future. She organizes events from time to time. She was one of the organizers of a fundraiser for Haïti in the past.


  • My campaign and why it's important to me.

My campaign is important to me because my followers are awaiting more  songs and it has been a while and I want to do this the right way with the dream team in a professional studio with a well-known Canadian Producer.

  • The magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

By helping me out you will be able to say you contributed to my first blues, gospel, jazz album and that these songs will travel in my followers audio systems or mp3 players from all over the world.


What We Need & What You Get


The 3500$ will go to recording part of the album then we would apply for funding with this song that will be high-quality then do more songs. I will apply also to another organization for a loan.

  • My unique perks. Are you excited?

Reward 1  Pledge 5,00$ or more

Printed pens with logo these pens will keep my business within easy reach.

Ships anywhere in the world - 

Shipping fees to be added


Reward 2 Pledge 10,00$ or more

A small limited edition t-shirts to promote the album

Ships anywhere in the world - Shipping fees to be added

Reward 3 Pledge 15,00$ or more

Price of an album

Ships anywhere in the world - 

Shipping fees to be added

If I don`t reach my goal the funds will still go to my company Hagiel that produces shows, events and will workshops to youth. The money will still be used for the album it will be put in a savings account. We will borrow to get the start-up money I will still give the perks to the people who contributed.

The Impact

I will also get more exposure by performing and selling my own original songs. Will be able to submit to Festivals, events all across Canada and the States. I have got great reviews for my demos that I did in a friend`s home studio and I would like to push these further with a producer and also record new material in blues, gospel & jazz. The songwriting was done by myself and getting the feedback of a producer who has many contacts can get your music out there and heard. Enough of a Woman and Survivors got great reviews. Enough of a Woman is definitely a favorite.

    Risks & Challenges


    Its a challenge to combine many kinds of music and do them well and inspire at the same time the next generation! I am ready for this new challenge and to use my creative ideas and those of my team of professionals to succeed in achieving this challenge.

     

    Please message me via Facebook so I can put you in contact with my lawyer if needed. All junk mail or spam will be reported if emailed.

    P.S. Please see all press reviews are on the official website.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean  you can`t help:

    • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

    And that's all !


    Hagiel anciennement connu sous Analoga K




    http://www.hagiel.org

    http:// www.facebook.com/hagiel.org

    http://www.twitter.com/hagiel_org

    http://www.reverbnation.com/hagiel






    Artiste/Chanteuse/auteure-compositrice/fondatrice de cie.

    Spécialités : Chanson, vidéo, jeu d’acteur, cascades général, écriture de chansons, scénarisation, composition de poèmes, monitrice d’ateliers vidéos, dessins, entrepreneurship, fondatrice de compagnie. Je redonne également à différentes causes qui me sont chères.

    Courte bio:

    Après avoir fait des back vocals pour des artistes et participée à plusieurs 'jam nights" en ville avec Sonny Wolf, Jim Zeller, Carl Tremblay, Black Hats, etc.  Hagiel prends sa place sur la scène blues/roots montréalaise. Certains disent qu'elle a une voix soul qui reflète ses influences gospel, classic rock et blues. Elle aimerait aussi faire du jazz dans le futur! Elle organize des événements de temps à autre. Elle était l'une des organisatrice pour une levée de fonds pour Haïti. 

    Ma campagne pourquoi c’est important pour moi.

    Ma campagne est importante pour moi car mes followers sur les réseaux sociaux attendent d’autres chansons. Puis cela fait quelques temps qu’ils attendent puis je veux faire cela de la bonne façon avec une équipe de rêve professionnel dans un studio avec un réalisateur Canadien qui est bien connu dans l’industrie.

    • Ce que les contributeurs peuvent m’aider à faire en contribuant!
    • En m’aidant vous allez pouvoir dire vous avez contribuez à mon premier album blues, gospel, jazz puis ces chansons voyagerons à travers le monde dans les lecteurs mp3 et système audio de mes fans à travers le monde.


    Ce que nous avons de besoin et ce que vous recevez

    Le 3500$ ira pour enregistrer une partie de l’album ensuite nous appliquerons pour du financement avec cet enregistrement the haute qualité pour faire d’autres chansons. Je vais appliquer également à une autre organization pour un prêt.

    • Mes recompenses uniques! Êtes vous énervés?
    • Récompense #1 avec une donation de 5$ ou plus.
    • Un stylo imprimé avec mon logo. Ces stylos garderons mon entreprise sur la map.

           Expédiés partout dans le monde.

           Des frais d’expéditions seront appliqués.

    • Récompense #2 avec une donation de 10$ ou plus.

           Une édition limité de t-shirt pour promouvoir l’album.

           Expédiés partout dans le monde.

           Des frais d’expéditions seront appliqués.

    • Récompense #3 avec une donation de 15$ ou plus.

            C’est le prix d’un album.

            Expédiés partout dans le monde.

            Des frais d’expéditions seront appliqués.

     

    Si je ne réussis pas mon objectif les fonds iront tout de même à ma compagnie Hagiel qui produis des shows, événements et offre des ateliers pour les jeunes. Les fonds seront mis dans un compte épargne affaires. Nous emprunterons pour avoir les fonds de départ pour l’enregistrement et tout le monde qui aura contribué aura leur marchandise tout de même.

    L’Impact

    J’aurais plus de visibilité en chantant et vendant mes chansons originales en spectacles. Je pourrai soumettre à des festivals, événements tant au Canada qu’aux États-Unis. J’ai eu des commentaires vraiment constructifs et excellents par rapport à mes démos que j’ai fait dans le studio maison de mon ami musicien professionnel. J’aimerais pousser le tout plus loin avec un réalisateur et également enregistré du nouveau matériel blues, gospel et jazz. L’écriture de chansons a été fait par moi et avoir du feedback d’un réalisateur qui a plusieurs contacts dans l’industrie de la musique peut juste aider à faire connaître notre musique et la faire entendre. Enough of a Woman et Survivors a eu d’excellentes critiques. Enough of a Woman est définitivement une chanson favorite.

    Risques et défis

    C’est un défi de combiner plusieurs genres de music et de bien le faire puis d’inspirer en même temps la prochaine génération.  Je suis prête pour ce nouveau défi et pour utiliser mes idéas créatrices et celle de mon équipe de professionnels pour réussir ce défi.

    S.v.p. prendre note: Les dons de sources fiables seulement seront acceptés. Les dons pour résoudre des situations problématiques devront être acceptés par mon avocat.


    S.v.p. voir toutes critiques sur le site officiel www.hagiel.org

    D’autres façons d’aider

    Certaines personnes ne peuvent contribuer mais cela ne veut pas dire que vous ne pouvez pas aider.

    • Passer le mot et faites du bruit pour ma champagne
    • Utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo !

    Puis c'est tout!

chansons. Je vais appliquer également à une autre organization pour un prêt.

Récompense #1 avec une
     donation de 5$ ou plus. 


Un stylo imprimé avec mon
     logo. Ces stylos garderons mon entreprise sur la map. 

       Expédiés partout dans le monde. 
       Des frais d’expéditions seront appliqués. 

Récompense #2 avec une
     donation de 10$ ou plus. 

       Une édition limité de t-shirt pour
promouvoir l’album. 
       Expédiés partout dans le monde. 
       Des frais d’expéditions seront appliqués. 

Récompense #3 avec une
     donation de 15$ ou plus. 

        C’est le prix d’un album.
        Expédiés partout dans le monde. 
        Des frais d’expéditions seront appliqués. 
  
Si je ne
réussis pas mon objectif les fonds iront tout de même à ma compagnie Hagiel qui
produis des shows, événements et offre des ateliers pour les jeunes. Les fonds
seront mis dans un compte épargne affaires. Nous emprunterons pour avoir les
fonds de départ pour l’enregistrement et tout le monde qui aura contribué aura
leur marchandise tout de même. 
L’Impact

J’aurais
plus de visibilité en chantant et vendant mes chansons originales en
spectacles. Je pourrai soumettre à des festivals, événements tant au Canada qu’aux
États-Unis. J’ai eu des commentaires vraiment constructifs et excellents par
rapport à mes démos que j’ai fait dans le studio maison de mon ami musicien
professionnel. J’aimerais pousser le tout plus loin avec un réalisateur et
également enregistré du nouveau matériel blues, gospel et jazz. L’écriture de
chansons a été fait par moi et avoir du feedback d’un réalisateur qui a
plusieurs contacts dans l’industrie de la musique peut juste aider à faire
connaître notre musique et la faire entendre. Enough of
a Woman et Survivors a eu d’excellentes critiques. Enough of a Woman est
définitivement une chanson favorite. 
Risques et défis

C’est un
défi de combiner plusieurs genres de music et de bien le faire puis d’inspirer en
même temps la prochaine génération.  Je
suis prête pour ce nouveau défi et pour utiliser mes idéas créatrices et celle
de mon équipe de professionnels pour réussir ce défi.
S.v.p.
prendre note: Les dons de sources fiables seulement seront acceptés. Les dons
pour résoudre des situations problématiques devront être acceptés par mon
avocat. 

S.v.p.
voir toutes critiques sur le site officiel www.hagiel.org

D’autres façons d’aider
Certaines personnes ne peuvent contribuer mais cela ne veut pas dire que
vous ne pouvez pas aider. 

Passer le mot et faites du
     bruit pour ma champagne
Utiliser les outils de
     partage Indiegogo !

Puis c'est tout!

story:
What is "OKLAHOMA RAIN"?

Hi. My name is Dara Tucker. I'm a singer/songwriter, originally from Tulsa, Oklahoma, now living in Nashville, Tennessee who's released 3 previous studio projects, and one live album. I plan on beginning work some time in the next 6 months on my next full studio album - a tribute to love, loss and healing - a collection of songs I'm calling, "Oklahoma Rain." 

After losing both my parents to cancer last year, I began to intensively write as a way of working through grief and creating catharsis. The result is a group of songs that document The Very Difficult Year, and the challenges and promises that are brought about by change.

It won't be all gloom and doom, though - not at all. This album, as with my previous projects, will ultimately focus on hope and healing. 

What We Need & What You Get

$6,000 - Tracking, musicians and engineer's pay 

$1,500 - Mixing, Mastering 

Additional expenses would be included under our 'stretch goal.'

$1,500 - CD Manufacturing 

$3,500 - PR/Advertising

$1,500 - Radio Campaign

$1,200 - Graphic Design/Photography/Website Redesign

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, getting the word out about the campaign is of the utmost importance. Even if you can't give what you'd like, it helps us tremendously when you share the campaign via social media (Instagram, Twitter, Facebook) or by word of mouth. We need foot soldiers! Thanks in advance for your help!

story:
Short Summary

 

Since 1998 the National Marian Anderson Historical Society has been an organization that has been dedicated to promoting the late classical singer, who was considered of the most important opera performers of the 20th century, showcasing her Residence as a Museum and supporting the development and performance of Young Classical and Performing Artist Scholars. The organization was founded by Blanche Burton-Lyles and has existed for the past 15 years. The society itself consists of The Marian Anderson Residence Museum at 762 S. Martin St., where Anderson lived for much of her life. Beyond that, the area around these sites has been named the Marian Anderson Village, which proudly boasts flags around the neighborhood. In addition to the residence houses, the village contains Marian Anderson’s church, elementary school and a recreational center dedicated to her. The society is working on creating the Marian Anderson Educational Pavilion, which it says is “designed to educate and produce and audio/visual interactive tour of the Marian Anderson Heritage Village.” Aside from merely promoting Anderson through displaying imagery from her life, the society seeks to spread Anderson’s music throughout the world. The scholars’ program frequently supports young classical and opera singers from around the world. These artists perform regularly at events that the society sponsors, and many have gone on to more prominent positions in places. As well as partnering with the Arts Empowerment Project to provide education, development and performance for all Children in the Arts in the Tri-State Area.

What We Need & What You Get

 

This Campaign has been created to continue with the Preservation of the National Marian Anderson Historical Residence Museum and the Classical Vocal Scholar and Arts Programs. Your help and support means that for years to come visitors from around the world can have a Living History Tour Experience at the National Marian Anderson Residence Museum and that very Talented Youth who have the Dream  of becoming a great Artist and Vocal Performers/Stars can have the support that they need to follow their dreams with Arts Education, Supplies & Performance opportunities.

 

The Impact

.This Campaign has been created to continue with the Preservation of the National Marian Anderson Historical Residence Museum and the Classical Vocal Scholar and Arts Programs. Your help and support means that for years to come visitors from around the world can have a Living History Tour Experience at the National Marian Anderson Residence Museum and that very Talented Youth who have the Dream  of becoming a great Artist and Vocal Performers/Stars can have the support that they need to follow their dreams with Arts Education, Supplies & Performance opportunities.

Risks & Challenges

 This Campaign has been created to continue with the Preservation of the National Marian Anderson Historical Residence Museum and the Classical Vocal Scholar and Arts Programs. Your help and support means that for years to come visitors from around the world can have a Living History Tour Experience at the National Marian Anderson Residence Museum and that very Talented Youth who have the Dream  of becoming a great Artist and Vocal Performers/Stars can have the support that they need to follow their dreams with Arts Education, Supplies & Performance opportunities.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Visit the National MAHS website and see all the different ways that you can help and support. www.marianandersonhistoricalsociety.weebly.com
