story:
Summary 

Hello everyone!

I'm in the process of recording my new solo record, Phantom Heart. For two years I've been composing the material for it, and it's come to a point where I feel the songs are fully realized. I'm playing a number of instruments on this record, including both acoustic and electric guitar, lapsteel, banjo, uke, piano, synth, alto and soprano sax, and some bass. I'm producing the record alongside my good friend, and co-producer/engineer, Shawn Kyle.

Phantom Heart is broad in style, in feel, and in the stories I'm telling. I grew up a lover of all forms of music, from the Allman bros. to Coltrane to Zeppelin to Marley to Dylan. If you listen closely, you'll hear those elements in the songs I write. It takes thousands of hours to hone your craft. I believe the wisdom and maturity I've gained over the recent years as both a songwriter/performer and as a man, has taken me to the brink of something great and sustainable. 

I've learned a lot through my experiences writing, touring, and running a business with my former band. Now that I'm re-branding as a solo artist, I feel confident in my understanding of the industry, and in my ability to execute the ideas I have in developing my brand. I have a killer group of producers, engineers, photographers, videographers, PR people and general facilitators that I can call on, to help me grow as an artist and as a business.

This campaign is important me, for a number of reasons. First, I want this record to be sonically robust, and vibrant, and accurately represent the vision for it that I have in my mind. A great mix and master are essential to achieving that. Second, I want to ensure it makes waves. This is an independently funded and produced record. For it to have a legitimate impact on the marketplace, the marketing and promotion have to be on point.

This is about more than donating your hard-earned money to an artistic endeavor. This is about supporting the idea that authenticity, honesty, and originality in art is essential to expanding and evolving as a culturally rich society. 

What I Need & What You Get

My goal for this campaign is to raise a minimum of $12,500. 40% of the money will go toward the mixing and mastering phase of the production. 45% will go toward the marketing and promotion side of things. This includes hiring a marketing firm for things like search engine optimization(SEO), and making my website functional and pretty. The remaining funds will go toward the purchase of equipment that will help take the studio versions of the songs to the stage. It's important to me to be able to perform the songs live, as closely as possible to how they're produced.

There are a number of stellar perks that I'm offering. From digital downloads of the record, to signed prints of the cover, to a live show in your living room, to executive producer credits, there is something for everyone who contributes! I'm putting everything I have into this record, and I want to show my gratitude to those of you who believe in me as an artist and as a business owner. 

The Impact

I feel a responsibility to be true to myself and to maintain my ethics and my authenticity, in hopes that I can do my part in bringing true craftsmanship back to the mainstream. It seems a monumental task, but I see the world to be a small place. This perspective affords me the unwavering belief that I possess; a belief that I can achieve great success while maintaining my core values and standards. I believe in all of you as well, and I know that together we can uphold a high standard of beauty in all art-forms if we simply make that choice. Contributing to this campaign is a step in that direction.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you do not wish to contribute financially, or simply do not have the means, there are other ways you can help. Sharing the link to the campaign on your social media sites would be greatly appreciated. Use the Indiegogo share tools, too! We really are all in this together. It's bigger than this record. It's on all of us to demand quality in the things that surround us.

story:
What we're about...

We're I Set The Sea On Fire (Billy, Pete, Meg & Josh). We've got the tracks together to record our first full length album, and we're really proud of the songs. We just need a little help funding the recording. We've had a few troubles with our last record label, so we are recording this album independently,  but cant financially make it happen without your support.

All the money raised will go towards paying for a studio for a week. As some of you know, this can be very expensive and on top of university & living costs, we just don't see it being possible in the near future.

Please dont think your moneys going to waste, we've been a band for around 5 years, and we are extremely passionate about music, and take the band very seriously. Over then years, we've opened for various successful bands, most notably Buzzcocks. We've also played many festivals & prestigious venues around the UK.

If you've got the money, we'd really appreciate anything you can give, but if not we're musicians, we know what its like to be skint. Thanks for all your support so far, and we wont let you down.

Billy, Pete, Josh & Meg (ISTSOF) x

story:
Summary

Now is the time for us to put our big boy pants on and make a mark on the world with our music.  Because of you, we have quickly taken over Memphis but we believe that there are even more of you out there that need our music for hope, for a smile, and sometimes the strength to get through the day.  

With that being said, we are making another record with the help of Lawrence 'Boo' Mitchell (John Mayer, Mark Ronson, Bruno Mars) at the legendary Royal Studios!

We’ve put together some awesome ideas, with the help of friends, to get this project off the ground. By doing this campaign through Indiegogo our goal is to include you as a part of something bigger than we could be on our own. We will work together to make something that will last forever and will always be a part of us.

There are a lot of different levels for contributing so you can find something you’re excited about! For $10 you get a digital download of the record with 2 exclusive acoustic versions of songs on the next record that NO ONE ELSE WILL GET unless they contribute...it's basically a pre-order.  The only difference is, instead of giving cash to iTunes you’re helping make the record right here and now, and you’ll be getting detailed updates along the way!  After that it can go anywhere from handwritten lyrics to one of our signed stage scrims. Those are just a few of the many perks!

This is our first record in a big studio and we're finally able to offer some of the awesome things we’ve always wanted to give to you.  This is our chance to make something permanent together and we couldn’t be more thankful to have such supportive fans that will be a part of this with us from start to finish. Whether you make a contribution, tell a friend, or share the campaign online, no matter what part you want to play in this effort, we love you for it.

Thanks so much for being a part of this journey with us. It’s going to be an amazing adventure!

What We Need & What You Get

Budget:

We want you to know exactly where your contributions are going so here is the projected budget for our campaign:

Studio Rental (Royal Studios)                                              $3,500

Mixing                                                                                            $2,800

Mastering                                                                                     $500                                    

Artwork/Printing (T-Shirt, CD)                                            $1,000

REACH GOAL:                                                                           $8,000

All we are asking:                                                                       $5,000

____________________________________________________________________________

____________________________________________________________________________
Shipping

Domestic shipping is built into each package. For international shipping, please raise your contribution by $10 after you select your package! See below for more details.


Other Ways You Can Help

No money?  No problems!  Whether or not you contribute financially, we need you on our marketing team.  Tell your friends, tell your parents, tell your friends parents......join us and help spread the word by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and every other social network you can think of!  We will have special prizes for those of you who get our campaign into the right hands! By creating awareness you directly help us reach our goal. 


FAQs

  • What sizes are available for the shirt & where do I pick?
    Standard sizes of S-XL will be available. Prior to shipment we'll send you an email and you'll be able to choose your size.
  • When will the album come out?
    We have not announced a release date as of yet but will communicate that to you at the end of this campaign.
  • When will my stuff ship?
    Just prior to release of the album (see above). Digital copies of the album will be emailed to everyone at least 1 week prior to official release.  That's right!! ONE WHOLE WEEK!
  • How do I pay for the international or extra shipping?
    After clicking "Contribute Now" and selecting your package you can increase the contribution amount in the field above by $10 or more.
  • I forgot to pay $10 or more for the international or extra shipping!
    No problem, just click "Contribute Now" again and make a contribution that is not for any specific package. Please make sure you make this contribution under the same email address as the original. Thanks!

Here's an exclusive look at our newest video at Ardent Studios!

Let's change the world,
The Passport

story:
* Hungarian summary below / Magyar nyelvű összefoglaló alább

 

Who We Are and What We Do

We are a passionate team of Transylvanian filmmakers and musicians playing a mixture of different genres. In the past 29 years (as Role band) we've had 14 concept programs (including a concert for children based on the principles of composer Zoltán Kodály, several rock albums with our very own and original songs, and two compilations of poems set to music). We've also orchestrated 5 rock operas presenting and reviving scenes from Hungarian history.

Since we are always trying to expand our boundaries on every level and always prefer to walk on paths that nobody has stepped on before, last summer we did something quite unusual, something that has never been done before. At least, not like this...

We have recorded an album on the top of a mountain.

Why? 

Our Moldavian Csángó folk song compilation Pille has ripened and waited for many years, ready for the day when we will record it in the nature. It’s not a common practice for a sound studio to move out under the open sky with its entire equipment, but it only felt right for us to take the songs back where they were born a long time ago… in the nature. It has always been very important to us to nurture our traditions, and to bring to light all those values, which we have discovered. The secrets lying in these folk songs should never be forgotten.

Who are the Csángós?

If you'd like to find out more about the Csángó people (roughly translated as "wanderers") and their very specific music, click on the link below.

Link About Csángós 

While working with these treasures and adapting them, we carefully paid attention to the lyrics, the rhythm and the melodic line of the songs. However, we transmit them with the instruments of up-to-date sound technology and modern orchestration, all this in our very own way.
Pille (that is Feather) drifted by the wind, human fate, lives, love, joy and sorrow, You and I, we all are a part of these songs.
And now you can help us show everyone how it has been done.
We (= the video crew and the musicians) plan to release the video material made during the audio recordings on DVD as a unique making-of movie, with interviews and background info on our difficulties, struggles, accomplishments, personal experiences, and meanwhile each of the 20 songs will come to life through live footage and illustrations.  

Video crew:

Zsuzsa Demeter (Demizsu) - video concept, director

Barna Nagy - camera operator, editor 

Dénes Sántha - production manager, camera operator, animations

Please help this enthusiastic and devoted little team finish and release the Pille DVD!

What We Need & What You Get

The funds raised from this campaign will pay for the DVD production and for finishing the final edit and packaging costs. 

To show our gratitude, we hope you will find something on this list you will appreciate from us and our most sincere thanks for being a part of this. Thank you... have so long worked to manifest this project and have created some really great perks that include original art work, hand painted t-shirts, signed CDs and, of course, a signed DVD that you helped fund, as well as other "surprise" items.

The funds raised with your help will cover the cost of:

  • Recording, mixing, mastering, artwork, manufacturing and distributing the DVD Pille 
  • Basic PR & marketing and technical equipment, costs

The more funds we manage to raise, the more money we will put into making this DVD spectacular.

We believe in these songs, this video and this project, and we will see it through!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute in form of one of the perks, you can still help:

-  Tell your friends about our upcoming DVD!

-  Share this campaign on Facebook and other social media!

Only together can we make this thing hum, so let's DO IT!

Thank you so much!!!

- Demizsu, Barni, Dénes, Edina, Zsuzsa, Mesi, Orsi, Tivadar, Ferenc and Zoli



Summary in Hungarian/Összefoglaló magyarul

Egy lelkes kis erdélyi csapat vagyunk, amely egy elkötelezett videós stábból és sokféle műfajt játszó erdélyi zenészekből áll. Az elmúlt 29 évben (Role zenekarként) 14 koncept műsort készítettünk (a kodályi elvekre épülő gyerekkoncerttől Ady Endre és József Attila verseinek dalba öntéséig). Mivel mindig próbáljuk feszegetni a határainkat és gyakran indulunk el olyan utakon, melyeken előttünk senki nem járt, ezért tavaly nyáron egy egészen különleges dolgot valósítottunk meg.

A legutóbbi albumunk hanganyagát egy hegy tetején vettük fel.

Miért?

A Pille című moldvai csángó műsorunk sok évet érett és várt rá, hogy zenekarunk egy napon kivigye a természetbe és felvétel készüljön róla. Nem mindennapi dolog, hogy egy profi hangstúdió a teljes felszerelésével kiköltözik a szabad ég alá, de úgy éreztük helyénvalónak, ha visszavisszük a dalokat oda, ahol egykoron születhettek... a természetbe. Fontosnak tartjuk hagyományaink ápolását és azt, hogy megmutassuk másoknak is azon értékeket, amelyeket felfedezhettünk magunknak. Olyan titkok rejlenek ezekben a népdalokban, amelyeket nem lenne szabad elfeledni.

Az átdolgozásokban gondosan ügyeltünk a népdalok szöveg, ritmus és dallam világára, ugyanakkor a korszerű hangtechnika, a modern hangszerelés és hangszerek eszközeivel, a magunk módján közvetítjük őket.

Pille, amit sodor a szél, emberi sorsok, életek, szerelmek, öröm és bánat, Te és mi, mindannyian benne vagyunk ezekben a dalokban.

És most Ti segíthettek nekünk abban, hogy mindenkinek megmutathassuk, hogyan csináltuk.

Az audió CD már elkészült, de most a videó stábbal közösen, ki szeretnénk adni a hangfelvételek során készült videóanyagokat DVD-n egy egészen egyedi werkfilm formájában interjúkkal, háttérinfókkal a forgatással kapcsolatos nehézségeinkről, küzdelmeinkről, sikereinkről, személyes tapasztalatainkról, mindeközben pedig a 20 dal mindegyike életre kel helyszíni élő felvételek és illusztrációs képanyagok révén.

A videós csapat: Demeter Zsuzsa (Demizsu) - videó koncepció, rendező; Nagy Barna - operatőr, vágó; Sántha Dénes – gyártásvezető, operatőr, animátor

Kérünk, segíts ennek a lelkes kis csapatnak befejezni és kiadni a Pille DVD-t!


A jobb oldalon látható "csomagok" közül reméljük találsz olyant, ami a kedvedre való. :) A támogatásodért cserébe a dedikált DVD mellett sok izgalmas, apróbb és nagyobb dologra is szert tehetsz.

Például:

*9. A TASTE OF TRANSYLVANIA! + DVD / ERDÉLYI ÍZELÍTŐ! + DVD

Három barátoddal részt vehetsz egy exkluzív gasztro esten Csíkszeredában, ahol megismerkedhettek az erdélyi ízekkel és nem mellesleg velünk. A finom étel, ital, és a szórakozás garantált! + egy dedikált DVD (az ár nem tartalmazza a szállás és utazás költségeit)

*10. TRIP TO THE LOCATION! + DVD / KIRÁNDULÁS A HELYSZÍNRE! + DVD

Gyere velünk vissza a lélegzetelállítóan gyönyörű helyszínre! Elviszünk egy kirándulásra a Nagyhagymás Nemzeti Parkba, felviszünk a felvételek helyszínére és ott választhatsz egy dalt, amit elénekelünk neked. Igen, ott kinn a hegyen! :) + egy dedikált DVD (az ár nem tartalmazza a szállás és utazás költségeit)

*11. TIVADAR'S GUITAR! + DVD / TIVADAR GITÁRJA! + DVD 

Megkapod Tivadar gitárját, egy nagyon ritka Fernandes AFR 95S sustainer gitárt, Barden középső pickup-pel, amit Tivadar sok CD-nk felvételén és turnéink alatt használt. Ez az egyik gitár, amin a Pille DVD felvételei során is játszott. Egy nagyon ritka hangszer, felbecsülhetetlen érték! + egy dedikált DVD (Fontos tudnivaló: az ár nem tartalmazza a postaköltséget.)


A kampány során gyűjtött támogatást a DVD legyártására, a végső videó utómunkájára és a lemez kiadásával kapcsolatos nyersanyag-költségek fedezésére használjuk fel.

Őszintén köszönjük, hogy részese akarsz lenni ennek a projektnek!

Hogyan tudsz még segíteni?

-  Beszélj barátaidnak a készülő DVD-ről!

-  Oszd meg a kampányt Facebook-on és más közösségi oldalakon!

Csak együtt sikerülhet véghez vinni ezt, számítunk rád!

Nagyon szépen köszönjük a segítségedet!!! 

- Demizsu, Barni, Dénes, Edina, Zsuzsa, Mesi, Orsi, Tivadar, Ferenc és Zoli

story:
Short Summary

Patchwork Project is a new initiative for the performance of American music. Our goal is to present innovative programs that reflect the unique American artistic fabric.

Through research, collaboration, and performance we will join together a wide variety of artists to create something new. Our program will evolve and change to honor the musical culture of each city we perform in. We aim to create something that will echo the voices of the vast American musical landscape, whether that be through the works of popular composers such as Aaron Copland and Leonard Bernstein or through exploring the works of lesser-known composers such as Hub Miller and Gabriel Kahane.

Our name is in homage to the process of making a patchwork quilt. Traditionally, scraps or pieces of worn textiles are sewn together to make a vibrant new fabric for use in a variety of ways. We aim to reflect this process in our creation and presentation of our concert programs.

We are raising money and building a network to support our first concert tour across the Midwest and Northeast this coming July and August! We'll be roadtripping between Chicago, IL and New York, NY with stops in various cities in Ohio, Illinois, upstate New York, Massachusetts, and more to come! In each city we will feature a rotating cast of guest artists-- both singers and instrumentalists-- who will collaborate with us to present each unique program. No two concerts will be the same! 


What We Need & What You Get

We are not seeking to make a profit on this venture, rather just to create some awesome programs and cover our own travel and preparation expenses. The majority of funds raised will go towards hiring collaborative pianists and securing venues in each city. A small portion of funds raised will cover our Indiegogo platform fees and the remainder of the funds will cover the cost of advertising, printing programs, and recording and photography of our concerts. 

If you live in one of the cities on our tour, you will get to experience a concert unlike anything you've ever experienced before! Additionally, we are providing some pretty cool incentives for different donation levels. Most importantly, by giving to our campaign, you will get to be part of our ever-growing Patchwork Community that supports collaboration and creativity among young artists and audiences of all kinds! 

The Impact

Your contribution will help bring to life a completely unique set of concerts. We believe that our project provides an opportunity for underrepresented music to come to the foreground in an innovative way. Additionally, we believe that through our flexible performance medium, we will be able to reach a larger, more diverse audience--hopefully creating some new classical music fans.  

Risks & Challenges

All projects have their risks and challenges-- and ours is no exception. Most of our project's challenges are logistical-- finding places to perform, finding places to stay, navigating travel, making connections, staying healthy. We are hope that the flexible nature of our project will allow us to adapt to any challenges that may come our way.

That being said, our biggest challenge is funding-- so please consider supporting us through a monetary or other donation! All amounts and ideas help. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We welcome your support in any variety of ways! We are looking to secure performance venues and housing in each of the stops on our tour, as well as assistance with advertising, merchandising, and ticket sales at each of our concerts. If you'd like to contribute in one of the above listed ways, please email us: info@patchworkproject.co.

story:
Dear Hollow Followers,

We have decided to invest our lives into making musical entrepreneurship our profession and you’re an absolutely pivotal player in our musical endeavors.

...and for that, we’re forever grateful.

The support you show is inspiring and fuels our confidence to continue to follow our dreams. So we’re excited to announce *bombaaadaadaaaa*

WE'RE GOING ON A SOUTHWEST TOUR, BABY!!

Your constant support enables us to 'Dare To Dream', whereby we can create and share our music for you.

Because MUSIC brings US together.

This tour is a springboard into building a community of Hollow Followers across the Southwest US. We're hoping to influence the largest group of people via our live performance, and in doing so, our community grows. 

Let's grow our community together... we need your support!

What We Need & What You Get

There’s a ton of work that we (as rock music makers) are dedicated to put in every day...

  • Writing songs
  • Rehearsals
  • Booking Shows
  • Live Shows
  • Music Video Content Creation and Shooting
  • Touring Various Cities
  • Instrument and Gear Upkeep
  • Maketing and Promoting Shows
  • Selling Tickets
  • Growing / cultivating a community of followers

The list goes on, and on, and on...

But, importantly, the costs are real too. Until we’re able to fully support the endeavor, we’re asking you to consider donating to support our "Crobot Tour" and allow us the opportunity to live out our dream of giving our music to as many people as possible with the hope that it impacts them as much as it's impacted you.

We’re looking to raise $4,000 to fund the tour. Here’s the breakdown:

  • Band Van
  • Trailer Rental
  • Gas
  • Insurance (Car and Renters)
  • Food
  • Lodging
Touring these great Southwest Cities:
  • Fort Collins, CO - 2/17
  • Salt Lake City, UT - 2/18
  • Los Angeles, CA - 2/19
  • San Diego, CA - 2/20
  • Las Vegas, NV - 2/21
  • Phoenix, AZ - 2/23
  • Albuquerque, NM - 2/24
  • Colorado Springs, CO - 2/25
  • Denver, CO - 2/26

But Hey!!

By donating, you'll get some cool stuff out of it! Be sure to check out THE PERKS! We're offering GOOGLE HANG OUTS, HANDWRITTEN LYRICS, DINNER WITH THE HOLLOW, and even A PRIVATE ACOUSTIC CONCERT!

If you can contribute ANYTHING to our worthy mission, we'll repay your kindness with some amazing and personal perks. We are asking for your support, in whatever capacity you can offer.

Music Is About Love

We have the opportunity to make the world a better place through sharing our music. We learned in music, you have to share it LIVE and IN PERSON, hence our need to go on the road. 

We believe that it's because of our music that you are here currently. Something about our music has resonated with you. We're hoping that more people across the Southwest US will share similar experiences. For themselves, but also with you. And with us.

ONE GREAT ROCK SHOW CAN SAVE THE WORLD!

And we know we can bring it to you by perfecting our craft and touring.

We Can Do It!

We KNOW that we can go the distance because we've learned it’s not about us. It's about the community we’re apart of. We are so grateful to be in 'startup' band in the beautiful city of Denver, Colorado.

We’re going to run into some challenges. It's inevitable. But if we fall short of our goal, 

WE'RE STILL GOING ON A SOUTHWEST TOUR, BABY!!

We've reached a milestone by realizing our dream of making music our singular occupation. It's extremely important that we prove to ourselves that music is in fact how we want to spend our time and energy. We’re putting in the work. We want our community to bare the fruits of our labor because we don't just do this for us. We do this to help others through our music and experiences. 

Anything Helps!

Anything you can spare would be greatly appreciated. Seriously. No donation is too small. We are grateful that you've even made it this far!

If you are unable to contribute financially, you can still help out tremendously by sharing this page on your social medias! (use the share icons above)

We appreciate you supporting our music by way of supporting the people who make music.

We have one definitive goal: 

To make people fall in love with rock & roll all over again. 

Will you fall in love with us?

Cheers,

Spencer, Jonathan, & Angela

The Hollow
story_txt:
Dear Hollow Followers,
We have decided to invest our lives into making musical entrepreneurship our profession and you’re an absolutely pivotal player in our musical endeavors.
...and for that, we’re forever grateful.
The support you show is inspiring and fuels our confidence to continue to follow our dreams. So we’re excited to announce *bombaaadaadaaaa*
WE'RE GOING ON A SOUTHWEST TOUR, BABY!!Your constant support enables us to 'Dare To Dream', whereby we can create and share our music for you.Because MUSIC brings US together.This tour is a springboard into building a community of Hollow Followers across the Southwest US. We're hoping to influence the largest group of people via our live performance, and in doing so, our community grows. Let's grow our community together... we need your support!What We Need & What You GetThere’s a ton of work that we (as rock music makers) are dedicated to put in every day...
Writing songs
Rehearsals
Booking Shows
Live Shows
Music Video Content Creation and Shooting
Touring Various Cities
Instrument and Gear Upkeep
Maketing and Promoting Shows
Selling Tickets
Growing / cultivating a community of followers

The list goes on, and on, and on...But, importantly, the costs are real too. Until we’re able to fully support the endeavor, we’re asking you to consider donating to support our "Crobot Tour" and allow us the opportunity to live out our dream of giving our music to as many people as possible with the hope that it impacts them as much as it's impacted you.We’re looking to raise $4,000 to fund the tour. Here’s the breakdown:
Band Van
Trailer Rental
Gas
Insurance (Car and Renters)
Food
Lodging
Touring these great Southwest Cities:

Fort Collins, CO - 2/17
Salt Lake City, UT - 2/18

Los Angeles, CA - 2/19

San Diego, CA - 2/20

Las Vegas, NV - 2/21
Phoenix, AZ - 2/23

Albuquerque, NM - 2/24

Colorado Springs, CO - 2/25

Denver, CO - 2/26



But Hey!!By donating, you'll get some cool stuff out of it! Be sure to check out THE PERKS! We're offering GOOGLE HANG OUTS, HANDWRITTEN LYRICS, DINNER WITH THE HOLLOW, and even A PRIVATE ACOUSTIC CONCERT!If you can contribute ANYTHING to our worthy mission, we'll repay your kindness with some amazing and personal perks. We are asking for your support, in whatever capacity you can offer.Music Is About LoveWe have the opportunity to make the world a better place through sharing our music. Cheers,

story:
Passionate about supporting local talent and promoting emerging musicians?

Despite drastic cutbacks to the arts, Derby is fast becoming a recognised hub of musical talent. To reflect this we, Furthest From The Sea, are aiming to raise £3,500 to produce ‘Derby Un-Scene 2016’ an album of nine of the best Derbyshire based acts featuring The Barnstormers, David Chabeaux, Karl & The Marx Brothers, Scribble Victory and The Herron Brothers to name but a few.

The money raised will be used to create, produce and market an album of original recordings from Derbyshire based artists and bands, available on CD, download and Vinyl, to be distributed to national press, radio stations and reviewers as well as being available at all 2016 Furthest From The Sea events.

The fund will also enable an album launch night, taking place at The Venue, Abbey Street, Derby on Friday 8th April, featuring performances from all the bands who have contributed at a venue in Derby, a true celebration of Derby’s thriving music scene.

The night will also be included as a prelude to The 2Q Festival 

We will also be working with local press and radio stations to find one additional band to be added to the line-up, supporting emerging talent in the area.

We aim for Derby Un-Scene to become an annual release and an annual event, and develop it to include tour support, something for Derbyshire musicians to aspire to and an experience to remember, but we can only do this with your involvement.

With your help we can put Derbyshire musicians on the map and give Derbyshire the recognition it deserves.

story:
I'm Scott, I've been performing and recording around the US for the last ten years, and I want my next album to be a collection of personalized theme songs.
With this crowdfunding project, I want to collect a group of strangers who want their emotions and ideas conveyed thru music. I am deliberately not reaching out to my personal networks and friends, because I want to find the musical ideas that resonate with people outside of my experience. 
After this campaign assembles a collection of individuals, I will call/text/email everybody and have a series of conversations- they will serve as the inspiration for everyone's theme song.

My previous recordings can be found at www.carbonandsoul.bandcamp.com


What We Need & What You Get

I own several instruments and recording equipment, so these funds will go into purchasing one or two pieces of gear to make recording easier (a new mic, and maybe a tracking compressor) but mostly the funds would allow me the free time to devote to this project. The $800 goal would allow me to take 2-3 weeks and dedicate them to this recording.
The perks will be simple for this project- for $10 you can get a digital copy of this album, with stranger's theme songs on it.
For $25 you will receive a physical copy- in CD, flash drive, or Cassette format (your choice!)
For $50 you will receive a personal theme song.
If I don't reach the $800 and you order a theme song, I will still be able to make your theme. In the event that an entire album isn't created from this project, then I will flesh out the album with 'non concept' material, and everyone will receive a full length album.


This album is both a unique experience for the audience and for me, I'm very excited about getting to know people and create melodies around their personalities. It's a truly interesting experiment.
I've been a part of many albums, but this feels like a whole new adventure.


Risks & Challenges

Recording can always run into lots of little troubles- sometimes a mic breaks, or a cable stops working, or Windows updates all your audio drivers overnight without telling you, and you have to go thru and roll back every piece of the update. 

I've dealt with all these small problems, and never let them stop me from recording!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you stumbled onto this campaign and don't have any cash- feel free to listen to my back catalog, maybe tell a friend or two. That is always incredibly helpful.

Thank you!

story:
[an exodus through great lands]

Welcome! First off, we'd like to thank you for taking the time to visit our page and seeing what we are all about. ＼(^o^)／ (a hug from us). 

We are artists from Kitchener/Waterloo, Ontario and are passionate about each other's music and this new adventure across Canada before us. Our manifesto is to innovate the cultural music norm and create new experimental sounds with a message universal to all. This is the foundation we live upon, and therefore believe this tour is important for both of us in order to continue pushing current popular musical fixations forward. With both of us releasing new works, we feel now is the right time for this adventure and we want you to be a part of this journey with us. 

As upcoming and independent artists, we are responsible for what comes with the title: booking shows, transportation, writing, arranging, producing, networking, creative design, and financial management. But this is the labour of our love. It is a part of our manifesto. It is our livelihood. Yes, the hours can be gruelling with many sleepless nights (being a musician is not easy) but we know it will be well worth it when we are able to share our creations with others across the country. 

By embarking on our first journey across Canada, we are putting forth a bold move. We want you to be apart of this action with us. We have planned 24 concerts in 9 different provinces. With your support we will be able to put forth our canon and expand our platform to those who otherwise may not hear our music. With your generosity we would be able to make this tour a success. 




[the obstacle]

Together we have constructed a strict budget for our tour:

  • Gas/ Transportation across the country with a full band: $2000

  • Food (at $10 per meal, 3 times a day): $1065.00

  • Venue Costs (not all venues are free unfortunately): $300.00

  • Lighting and Sound Rentals: $300.00
  • Total: $3,665.00

  • Indiegogo costs: (%4 of net amount fee, Paypal/ credit card/perk and shipping costs): $835.00
  • Grand Total Goal Amount: $4500.00
Thankfully, finding accommodations will not be an issue on our tour as we are able to reside with friends and family on this journey. 

This is what is in it for you: glorious, glorious perks. 
Together we have put together a plethora of incentives for you to choose from as a thank you for your generous donation. A vast array of possibilities await you on the right side of this screen ------------------------->
For example, you can choose from our entire discography, a candle lit dinner, a ukulele lesson, to merch bundles and more. 


[Elsa Jayne "We Took Flight" Tee] [Perk #7]


[Realistic sketch of Nicolas Cage] [Perk #3]


[Bubble Tea Date] [Perk #9]

[Candlelit Dinner] [Perk #11]

[JoJo & Elsa's Infinite Playlist] [Perk #2]

[after effects]


We are Art Sisters. We compliment each other's work and believe that on this tour we are stronger together. We have had the pleasure of collaborating and experimenting before in the past. You can visit our work here: 


By participating in our campaign, you are helping us take the next step in our careers. You are a part of this adventure and are joined with us in our creative manifesto to innovate music. 


[make noise]

As musicians, we understand not everyone can contribute monetarily. Sharing our campaign with your loved ones on any social medium is a crucial part of reaching our campaign goal and we appreciate it immensely. 

In the event that we do not reach our goal, we will paddle on with what we have been given. We are determined and excited to embark on this journey with the resources that come our way.

We sincerely thank you for taking the time and energy to look through our campaign. 
Sincerely, 
Elsa & JoJo

story:
大家好，我是來自台灣的Melody,  目前在倫敦皇家音樂學院就讀大提琴演奏。我需要您的協助，來完成我的夢想。

三歲時，開始學鋼琴，七歲時，由鋼琴老師推薦學習大提琴，十三歲時，赴美圓夢就讀新英格蘭音樂學院預備學校，目前於倫敦皇家音樂學院就讀大學。就學期間，我曾經在卡內基音樂廳，林肯中心等世界知名音樂廳演奏。我也非常驕傲的在劍橋大學舉辦獨奏會時演奏台灣作曲家李和莆先生的作品， 德國的巴赫 以及 英國的布瑞頓作品，以「台灣是寶島」這首作品 在英國宣揚台灣的美好。在英國的這兩年，我參與了各種僑界活動的演出，包含另老華僑感動的台灣民謠音樂會，春節團拜活動 等等。

自從本學年初，我面臨了一些困境。非常幸運的，我得到學校大量獎學金來支付學校的費用，剩下的開銷由募款活動得到私人贊助，不幸的是...計劃無法趕上變化，我的經費受到了影響，很可惜的是...在未完成學業的情況下，我將被迫離開倫敦。非常幸運的，事情有了轉變，我被著名位於瑞士德籍大提琴家兼指揮家科里茲斯奇教授收為學徒。值得一提的是，與英國相比，瑞士的學費整整少了快20倍。這也表示，我再也不會遇到同樣的狀況。

但是只差一學期就可以得取今年辛苦完成的學分，在完成最後這個學期之前，我必須在四月中之前籌到剩下的學費。我必須完成今年的學業，才能確保在明年暑假前完成大學學業。一旦得到大學學歷，我將能成為全職音樂家，不但完成了兒時的夢想，也能為世界演奏動人的樂聲。我非常希望還能繼續在海外為僑胞們演奏來自台灣的民謠 以及台灣作曲家的作品。

請您協助我完成夢想，讓我有機會用音樂感動世界。捐款金額或多或少，或是手指一點與朋友分享這份感動，這小小的舉動，將影響一位音樂家的未來。

謝謝大家的支持！


MEET MELODY…

My name is Melody Lin, and I am a third year student studying for a Bachelor of Music degree in cello performance at the Royal College of Music. I specialise in chamber music and solo performance, and truly hope that I have a promising career ahead of me as an internationally performing musician! I have made a brilliant life for myself in London over the last few years, and adore the country and culture of the UK.


UNI FEES...


As an International Student, the cost of my degree each year is a staggering £20,850, which is nearly three times the price offered to domestic students. This cost has been partly subsidised by the RCM via a merit-based Foundation Scholarship, whilst the remainder of my funds come from the generous support from my family and friends. This works out at the cost to study of around £3,000 per month.


In the previous two years of my study, a scholarship from RCM and a company sponsored my study in London and could therefore keep up with my tuition, as well as helping the enormous living costs faced by Londoners.


DISASTER HAS STRUCK.


Since last year in September I have been struggling to cover my £3,000 monthly instalments for my tuition fees. I have managed to raise nearly £3,000 in a private fundraising concert and have another concert scheduled for the end of April.


As an international student on a Tier 4 Visa, I also have limited options to obtain income by working, as although I could be earning a fantastic income via teaching, my visa imposes a maximum limit of just 20 hours work per week.


Suspending my studies would mean suspending my right to study in the UK, and the end of my career development plans at the Royal College of Music, including the cancellation of all of my upcoming concerts.


I have reached out to the RCM’s hardship fund, but was rejected because my professional income from teaching and playing in external concerts is insufficient to fulfil the remaining of my tuition fee due to my Visa restrictions.  

My only option remain that does not involve interrupting my studies is the transfer of my degree to another institution. Fortunately, I have managed to secure a fully funded Scholarship to the world-renowned Conservatorio della Svizzera Italiana in the Swiss town of Lugano, where I will be finishing off the fourth and the last year of my degree.


THE ISSUE IS THIS:


  1. If I do not complete this year at the Royal College of Music, I will be unable to earn credits towards the completion of my degree.

  2. I have already spent £14,000 on my degree studies in London this year, and if I do not complete the year, this will have been effectively wasted. I will have to redo all of this year in Lugano.

  3. I cannot work to earn the money to pay for my outstanding fees, due to visa requirements.


SOLUTION:

This has left me with one option: to ask my friends and colleagues to help me to raise £4,000 to pay for the remaining fees for this year, so I can transfer my degree studies to Lugano at the end of the year.


It is of course a lot to ask, but by many people coming together and pledging a small amount of money, I know that we can raise enough funds to secure the final few months of my studies at the RCM!


So please, give what you can. This is literally my last chance to save what remains of my degree in the UK before transferring to Switzerland. I appreciate any and all support that you can give me.


Thank you.

三歲時，開始學鋼琴，七歲時，由鋼琴老師推薦學習大提琴，十三歲時，赴美圓夢就讀新英格蘭音樂學院預備學校，目前於倫敦皇家音樂學院就讀大學。就學期間，我曾經在卡內基音樂廳，林肯中心等世界知名音樂廳演奏。我也非常驕傲的在劍橋大學舉辦獨奏會時演奏台灣作曲家李和莆先生的作品， 德國的巴赫 以及 英國的布瑞頓作品，以「台灣是寶島」這首作品 在英國宣揚台灣的美好。在英國的這兩年，我參與了各種僑界活動的演出，包含另老華僑感動的台灣民謠音樂會，春節團拜活動 等等。
自從本學年初，我面臨了一些困境。非常幸運的，我得到學校大量獎學金來支付學校的費用，剩下的開銷由募款活動得到私人贊助，不幸的是...計劃無法趕上變化，我的經費受到了影響，很可惜的是...在未完成學業的情況下，我將被迫離開倫敦。非常幸運的，事情有了轉變，我被著名位於瑞士德籍大提琴家兼指揮家科里茲斯奇教授收為學徒。值得一提的是，與英國相比，瑞士的學費整整少了快20倍。這也表示，我再也不會遇到同樣的狀況。
但是只差一學期就可以得取今年辛苦完成的學分，在完成最後這個學期之前，我必須在四月中之前籌到剩下的學費。我必須完成今年的學業，才能確保在明年暑假前完成大學學業。一旦得到大學學歷，我將能成為全職音樂家，不但完成了兒時的夢想，也能為世界演奏動人的樂聲。我非常希望還能繼續在海外為僑胞們演奏來自台灣的民謠 以及台灣作曲家的作品。
請您協助我完成夢想，讓我有機會用音樂感動世界。捐款金額或多或少，或是手指一點與朋友分享這份感動，這小小的舉動，將影響一位音樂家的未來。謝謝大家的支持！


MEET MELODY…



My name is Melody Lin, and I am a third year student studying for a Bachelor of Music degree in cello performance at the Royal College of Music. I specialise in chamber music and solo performance, and truly hope that I have a promising career ahead of me as an internationally performing musician! I have made a brilliant life for myself in London over the last few years, and adore the country and culture of the UK. 
UNI FEES...
As an International Student, the cost of my degree each year is a staggering £20,850, which is nearly three times the price offered to domestic students. This cost has been partly subsidised by the RCM via a merit-based Foundation Scholarship, whilst the remainder of my funds come from the generous support from my family and friends. This works out at the cost to study of around £3,000 per month.
In the previous two years of my study, a scholarship from RCM and a company sponsored my study in London and could therefore keep up with my tuition, as well as helping the enormous living costs faced by Londoners. 
DISASTER HAS STRUCK.
Since last year in September I have been struggling to cover my £3,000 monthly instalments for my tuition fees. I have managed to raise nearly £3,000 in a private fundraising concert and have another concert scheduled for the end of April.
As an international student on a Tier 4 Visa, I also have limited options to obtain income by working, as although I could be earning a fantastic income via teaching, my visa imposes a maximum limit of just 20 hours work per week. 
Suspending my studies would mean suspending my right to study in the UK, and the end of my career development plans at the Royal College of Music, including the cancellation of all of my upcoming concerts.
I have reached out to the RCM’s hardship fund, but was rejected because my professional income from teaching and playing in external concerts is insufficient to fulfil the remaining of my tuition fee due to my Visa restrictions.  
My only option remain that does not involve interrupting my studies is the transfer of my degree to another institution. Fortunately, I have managed to secure a fully funded Scholarship to the world-renowned Conservatorio della Svizzera Italiana in the Swiss town of Lugano, where I will be finishing off the fourth and the last year of my degree.
THE ISSUE IS THIS:

If I do not complete this year at the Royal College of Music, I will be unable to earn credits towards the completion of my degree.
I have already spent £14,000 on my degree studies in London this year, and if I do not complete the year, this will have been effectively wasted. I will have to redo all of this year in Lugano.
I cannot work to earn the money to pay for my outstanding fees, due to visa requirements.

SOLUTION:
This has left me with one option: to ask my friends and colleagues to help me to raise £4,000 to pay for the remaining fees for this year, so I can transfer my degree studies to Lugano at the end of the year.
It is of course a lot to ask, but by many people coming together and pledging a small amount of money, I know that we can raise enough funds to secure the final few months of my studies at the RCM! 
So please, give what you can. This is literally my last chance to save what remains of my degree in the UK before transferring to Switzerland. I appreciate any and all support that you can give me.
Thank you.

story:
Une graine semée par plusieurs mains, prédit une récolte salutaire. A seed sown by many hands precludes a bountiful harvest. 

C'est l'histoire de l'aiguille qui va à la rencontre du fil et des tissus. L'histoire d'années de recherche, de péripéties, de joie, d'amour, de partage, d'apprentissage et d'influences. 
C'est un long chemin qu'on a parcouru ensemble main dans la main. Certains nous ont vu débuter ce tissage, d'autres nous ont rejoints dans le cercle. Ils nous ont donné l'amour et l'énergie nécessaire afin que nous puissions tisser une humanité commune. 
Aujourd'hui, le cercle s'agrandit, il est en perpétuelle expansion et représente finalement une relation qui dépasse celle d'un groupe et de ses fans. Nous devenons ensemble une communauté ouverte  où chacun donne et reçoit en même temps. On dit que le fruit mûr tombe, mais la moisson nécessite la force de plusieurs bras. 
Ça y est, on se lance ! L'album va sortir en Octobre et nous avons particulièrement besoin de votre énergie, de votre amour, de votre force et de vos fonds pour que ce processus aboutisse.

De la graine au fruit, du fruit à la graine, aidez-nous à faire germer cet album, car une graine semée par plusieurs mains prédit une récolte salutaire.

It’s the story of a needle going to meet yarn and fabric. A story of years of research, adventures, joy, love, sharing, learning and absorbing.

A long path that we’ve traversed together, hand in hand. Some have been with us since the beginning, others have joined throughout the journey. They’ve given us the love and energy necessary to tie together our common humanity.

Today our circle continues to grow and it has come to represent a relationship that’s beyond the typical fan-to- group dynamic. We’ve become an open community where each member simultaneously gives and receives. The saying goes that the ripe fruit is the one to fall, but a harvest necessitates the force of many hands.

As such we go forward ! The album will be released in October. We especially need your energy, love, force, and financial support to realize this goal.

From seed to fruit and fruit to seed, help us bring this album to fruition… a seed sown by many hands precludes a bountiful harvest.


Sahad, c’est la moisson en serer. Prononcé un peu différemment avec un « t » à la fin c’est la résurrection en wolof. C’est aussi le prénom du lead vocal de la formation musicale Sahad and the Nataal Patchwork.
Sahad and the Nataal Patchwork reflète une moisson de diverses influences musicales, une errance, une voie d’éveil, un trait d’union entre plusieurs cultures. Ce groupe est en effet un carrefour culturel où se rencontrent des musiciens de différents horizons. Ensemble, ils s’inscrivent dans cette tradition de jeunes qui portent avec eux le nouveau souffle de la musique africaine. Leur musique se trouve à la croisée des chemins entre le blues Malien, l’Afrobeat, le rock et le jazz qui font naître une sonorité kaléidoscopique. 

The word Sahad translates to harvest in Serer. Change the last syllable to a « t » sound, and Sahad becomes the Wolof term for « resurrection. » It’s also the first name of the lead singer of the musical ensemble known as Sahad and the Nataal Patchwork. 

Sahad and the Nataal Patchwork is a reflection of many diverse musical influences, a wandering spirit, a journey of awakening, a hyphen between cultures. This group is in effect a cultural crossroads where different musicians from all walks of life meet. Together they make their contribution to the rich traditions of young musicians who carry the torch of the new African music. Their music finds itself at the intersection of Malian blues, Afrobeat, rock and jazz all of which nourish this kaleidoscopic soundscape. 

Nous ne sommes pas dans une maison de disque et nous n'avons pas encore de label, c'est pour cela que nous faisons appel à vous.

Nous avons eu la chance de remporter le Tanit d'Or aux Journées Musicales de Carthage en Tunisie, accompagné de 8 800 €. Cette somme nous a permis :

- de donner une petite participation aux musiciens du Patchwork (1 750 €);

- de couvrir la moitié des frais de la soirée sur Dakar organisée à l'effigie de cette récompense et pour lancer le crowdfunding (750€);

- de rembourser les frais d'un an de travail (production de l'EP, production du clip-vidéo, création du site internet, frais de communication, relation presse, matériel studio et technique, etc.) (6 500€).

We aren’t yet part of a record company or record label, that’s why we need your help.

We were lucky enough to take the Golden Prize at the Carthage Music Days festival in Tunisia, accompanied by an award of 8,800 euros. This sum will allow us to :

-  Compensate the musicians with 1750 euros

- Cover half the cost of the celebratory concert in Dakar and fund this crowdfunding

campaign (750 euros)

-Cover the cost of a year’s work including production of an EP, production of a music video, creating a website, publicity and press coverage, technical equipment, etc.

Nous sommes en train de réaliser les pré-productions avec un ingénieur son dans notre studio. Les maquettes seront bientôt prêtes ! Il nous reste encore tout un circuit à réaliser pour produire l'album et le défendre, afin qu'il sorte en Octobre 2016.

Et il faut savoir qu'un album de qualité, c'est beaucoup de frais !

Après l'enregistrement des morceaux : frais de studios, techniciens, musiciens, choristes, réalisateur artistique, etc. ils méritent tous une participation, vient l'étape du mixage de l'album, puis du mastering (étape finale sur l'audio), de la création de la pochette et des éléments graphiques, des clips, etc.

Et une fois que les côtés artistiques du projet de terminés, il faut s'occuper de la promotion, pour faire connaître l'existence de l'album. Cela passe par une équipe de communication et des attachés de presse.

On vous passe d'autres frais annexes (droits d'auteur, impressions de visuels, transports, nourriture, contreparties, etc.)

Les frais de l'album s'élèvent à 15 000 €, nous faisons appel à vous pour avoir les deux tiers de cette somme, soit 10 000 € ($11 500).

Voici la répartition de notre budget :

- Ingénieur son + séances studio live = 2 000 €

- Réalisateur album = 1 500 €

- Mix + mastering = 2 000 €

- Pressage albums (1000 CD) + vinyls (120 vinyls) = 1 600 €

- Musiciens = 3 000 € (15 musiciens)

- Budget communication = 2 000 €

- Réalisation d'un clip = 1 500 €

- Frais annexes = 1 000 €

We’re already working on the preproduction process with an engineer in our studio. The demos are already finished. All that remains is a path to production and promotion of the album as soon as it is released in October 2016.

As you may already know, producing a quality album comes with a high price tag.

Costs associated with recording and production of the album inclue : studio fees, technicians, musicians, back-up singers, the artisitc director, etc. After recording is taken care of, mixing and mastering remain as well as design of album art & cover, music videos, etc.

Once the creative phase of the process is finished, the promotion process must begin in order

to make known the existance of the album.

Other auxilliary costs include copyrighting fees, printing fees, transportation, meals, etc.

The total cost of the album will be 15,000 euros. We’re asking you to help cover two thirds of that cost, 10,000 euros ($11,500).

Here’s how our budget breaks down :

- Sound engineer and live studio recording sessions = 2000 euros

- Album producer = 1500 euros

- Mix + mastering = 2 000 €

- Production of 1000 CD’s and album jackets + 120 vinyl copies = 1600 euros

- Compensations for 15 musicians = 3000 euros

- Communication budget = 2000 euros

- Production of 1 music video = 1500 euros

- Additional fees = 1000 euros

On compte sur vous !
Merci - Thank You - Jere Jef !


www.sahadpatchwork.com

story:
Hello Beautiful Friends! We are Kat and Wilson- aka The Goodnight Darlings- a husband and wife, New York City electronic rock duo! We've been described as a "Modern Day Version of Blondie" by The Record Journal.

We are very excited to share our music, our vision, and our love story with you. We just completed our new EP "All I Ever Wanted" with a dream team we assembled at Studio G Brooklyn. Now we need your help launching the music to the world! Please give to this campaign so we can create this dream music video for "Carousel"!

We are unsigned. So in a way, you and your donations will be our "label" as we release our new single "Carousel". We are striving to create the boldest possible music video for this true love song, to really launch ourselves into a further reach with listeners-- and guess what?! The most talented famous director, Ethan Tobman (Madonna, OK GO) is on board!

We created this EP rising up from the ashes of the most challenging year of our lives. Kat's mom was diagnosed with Cancer. We battled incredibly hard. It changed our lives--and our insides were turned upside down. She passed away, and everything we thought we knew seemed microscopic. We were grieving and floating in space...

From this turmoil emerged "All I Ever Wanted". We realized we had to keep "fighting the good fight" for the things most precious things in life- and remember the importance of joy. The time is NOW or NEVER!!

This EP was absolute fun permission to create our music like a little kid planning a birthday party. We self-funded an enormous effort, strived for abundance, and sparing no effort- we received back the the coolest gifts of inspired music and new friends.. The final and most humbling step in bringing Carousel to life is this: asking for your help. It simply won’t happen without you. There are sets to build, flights to book, professionals to pay, equipment to rent, and so much more.

We hope you enjoy! Here's "Carousel":


"All I Ever Wanted" was recorded at Brooklyn's Studio G (Black Keys, Iggy Pop, Tom Waits). Producer Tony Maimone (member of Pere Ubu, bass player with Frank Black and They Might Be Giants,) worked with us, and two renowned musicians contributed as well: drummer Joe Tomino (Matisyahu and Dub Trio) and a rap cameo from Jabee (Emmy Award Winning MC from Oklahoma, associated with hip-hop acts Murs, El-P, and Run the Jewels.) The EP also features a re-mixed version of "Empire Vampire" via producer Nic Hard (Taylor Swift, Joey Ramone) and includes re-cut vocals and revisiting the raw instrumental tracks. 


Written by Seth Cohen PR (Bruce Springsteen, Shania Twain):

"The Goodnight Darlings are real-life married couple Kat Auster (vocals/lyrics) and Wilson Jaramillo (guitar, beats/synth). Their sound/style finds its home somewhere between where The Yeah Yeah Yeahs, Santigold, and early Blondie might hang out. Singer Kat Auster, (Juilliard Theater Grad, EMI/SONY songwriter, and former coach on MTV's hit TV show "Made",) brings explosive energy to each live performance. She was nicknamed "Gwen Stefani's evil twin," by The Village Voice.

Guitarist/Programmer Wilson Jaramillo has recorded and toured arenas internationally with various music icons and Grammy award-winning producers, including The Fugees, Wyclef Jean, Lauryn Hill, Mary J. Blige, DMC, Patti La Belle, and Pras. The Fugees nicknamed Wilson "the punk" and "the scientist" due to his mind-blasting energy and impressive array of 13 guitar pedals."

"Auster brings her pop rock singing into Jaramillo's eclectic music that spans hypnotic beats, and New Wave, and dance punk. Auster's voice commands attention immediately with a younger Deborah Harry feel, fiery, danceable, with an indie-ironic feel--glows with an undeniable energy.." The Daily Vault

To ensure the process will be one of utmost brilliance and effective clarity, we brought back our amazing Producer, Isis Masoud (Close Up Experience) and genius celebrity stylist, Joey Bevan (America's Next Top Model, The X Factor). We have already experienced a proven GIGANTIC magic working with them, as seen on our last music video "Empire Vampire". We are beyond thrilled to team up with them again, and transcend our success together even higher!

Check it out---

"Empire Vampire" is a darkly majestic visual feast featuring members of Cirque de Soleil, The Orlando Ballet, massive snakes, knife throwers, bloodthirsty creatures of the night, and a cast of dancers, actors, magicians, and circus performers from across the globe. 

"The innovative new Fantasy-Thriller Musical short film is blazing a trail, paving the way for a new genre that tells a story within a song, on screen, seamlessly intermingled with a vibrant array of performance and fine art."- Broadway World

Here's "Empire Vampire", as premiered in Huffington Post:


We will re-unite with Isis & Joey and fly to the "City of Dreams", LOS ANGELES!!!! The Goodnight Darlings can't wait to hit the West Coast for the very first time, and meet up with the prestigious Ethan Tobman to manifest some destinies..

Our mission is to create the most powerful sonic vehicles of imagination. We want to provoke thought and generate beauty. We want to abundantly give back to our community and to positive social causes that are dear to us! For example, as part of this campaign, donations have been to Brooklyn's Promenade Park to support Brooklyn's beautification. In turn, we were able to offer the fun "Project Perk"of a private photo shoot on the famous Brooklyn Carousel...Your contribution will not only make this video come to life, it will also bring us closer to realizing our life long aspirations of being full-time musicians-- able to perform and give back to those we care about.. 

We are going to pour our entire hearts into bringing this story to life, and we will be forever grateful for whatever you can contribute, however small...And if you can't afford anything at all, that's OK too!! We know how it is to squeeze through tough times.

So if you think this is a cool project, please HELP GET THE WORD OUT! Please give us a shout out to your friends who like rock music and music videos.. We've always loved and supported other indie bands and we hope you'll help us make this project be as great as it deserves to be. 

This project is our dream, and we can’t thank you enough for your support.

Your contributions are tax-deductible! See each perk for details!

*Please note, since this is through an artistic non-profit, they do not accept PAYPAL- it is a Credit Card checkout.

Kat Auster is a sponsored artist with Performance Zone Inc (dba The Field), a not-for-profit, tax-exempt, 501(c)(3) organization serving the performing arts community. Contributions to The Field earmarked for As arts NY / Hyung Ji ( Heidi ) Yu are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law. For more information about The Field contact: The Field, 75 Maiden Lane, Suite 906 New York, NY 10038, phone: 212-691-6969 or fax: 212-255-2053or for our national charities registration, see details. A copy of our latest financial report may be obtained from The Field or from the Office of Attorney General, Charities Bureau, 120 Broadway, New York, NY 10271.

story_txt:
Hello Beautiful Friends! We are Kat and Wilson- aka The Goodnight Darlings- a husband and wife, New York City electronic rock duo! We've been described as a "Modern Day Version of Blondie" by The Record Journal.We are very excited to share our music, our vision, and our love story with you. We just completed our new EP "All I Ever Wanted" with a dream team we assembled at Studio G Brooklyn. Now we need your help launching the music to the world! Please give to this campaign so we can create this dream music video for "Carousel"!We are unsigned. So in a way, you and your donations will be our "label" as we release our new single "Carousel". We are striving to create the boldest possible music video for this true love song, to really launch ourselves into a further reach with listeners-- and guess what?! The most talented famous director, Ethan Tobman (Madonna, OK GO) is on board!We created this EP rising up from the ashes of the most challenging year of our lives. Kat's mom was diagnosed with Cancer. We battled incredibly hard. It changed our lives--and our insides were turned upside down. She passed away, and everything we thought we knew seemed microscopic. We were grieving and floating in space...From this turmoil emerged "All I Ever Wanted". We realized we had to keep "fighting the good fight" for the things most precious things in life- and remember the importance of joy. The time is NOW or NEVER!!This EP was absolute fun permission to create our music like a little kid planning a birthday party. We self-funded an enormous effort, strived for abundance, and sparing no effort- we received back the the coolest gifts of inspired music and new friends.. The final and most humbling step in bringing Carousel to life is this: asking for your help. It simply won’t happen without you. There are sets to build, flights to book, professionals to pay, equipment to rent, and so much more.We hope you enjoy! Here's "Carousel":"All I Ever Wanted" was recorded at Brooklyn's Studio G (Black Keys, Iggy Pop, Tom Waits). Producer Tony Maimone (member of Pere Ubu, bass player with Frank Black and They Might Be Giants,) worked with us, and two renowned musicians contributed as well: drummer Joe Tomino (Matisyahu and Dub Trio) and a rap cameo from Jabee (Emmy Award Winning MC from Oklahoma, associated with hip-hop acts Murs, El-P, and Run the Jewels.) The EP also features a re-mixed version of "Empire Vampire" via producer Nic Hard (Taylor Swift, Joey Ramone) and includes re-cut vocals and revisiting the raw instrumental tracks. Written by Seth Cohen PR (Bruce Springsteen, Shania Twain):"The Goodnight Darlings are real-life married couple Kat Auster (vocals/lyrics) and Wilson Jaramillo (guitar, beats/synth). Their sound/style finds its home somewhere between where The Yeah Yeah Yeahs, Santigold, and early Blondie might hang out. Singer Kat Auster, (Juilliard Theater Grad, EMI/SONY songwriter, and former coach on MTV's hit TV show "Made",) brings explosive energy to each live performance. She was nicknamed "Gwen Stefani's evil twin," by The Village Voice.Guitarist/Programmer Wilson Jaramillo has recorded and toured arenas internationally with various music icons and Grammy award-winning producers, including The Fugees, Wyclef Jean, Lauryn Hill, Mary J. Blige, DMC, Patti La Belle, and Pras. The Fugees nicknamed Wilson "the punk" and "the scientist" due to his mind-blasting energy and impressive array of 13 guitar pedals.""Auster brings her pop rock singing into Jaramillo's eclectic music that spans hypnotic beats, and New Wave, and dance punk. Auster's voice commands attention immediately with a younger Deborah Harry feel, fiery, danceable, with an indie-ironic feel--glows with an undeniable energy.." The Daily VaultTo ensure the process will be one of utmost brilliance and effective clarity, we brought back our amazing Producer, Isis Masoud (Close Up Experience) and genius celebrity stylist, Joey Bevan (America's Next Top Model, The X Factor). We have already experienced a proven GIGANTIC magic working with them, as seen on our last music video "Empire Vampire". We are beyond thrilled to team up with them again, and transcend our success together even higher!Check it out---"Empire Vampire" is a darkly majestic visual feast featuring members of Cirque de Soleil, The Orlando Ballet, massive snakes, knife throwers, bloodthirsty creatures of the night, and a cast of dancers, actors, magicians, and circus performers from across the globe. "The innovative new Fantasy-Thriller Musical short film is blazing a trail, paving the way for a new genre that tells a story within a song, on screen, seamlessly intermingled with a vibrant array of performance and fine art."- Broadway WorldHere's "Empire Vampire", as premiered in Huffington Post:We will re-unite with Isis & Joey and fly to the "City of Dreams", LOS ANGELES!!!! The Goodnight Darlings can't wait to hit the West Coast for the very first time, and meet up with the prestigious Ethan Tobman to manifest some destinies..Our mission is to create the most powerful sonic vehicles of imagination. We want to provoke thought and generate beauty. We want to abundantly give back to our community and to positive social causes that are dear to us! For example, as part of this campaign, donations have been to Brooklyn's Promenade Park to support Brooklyn's beautification. In turn, we were able to offer the fun "Project Perk"of a private photo shoot on the famous Brooklyn Carousel...Your contribution will not only make this video come to life, it will also bring us closer to realizing our life long aspirations of being full-time musicians-- able to perform and give back to those we care about.. 


We are going to pour our entire hearts into bringing this story to life, and we will be forever grateful for whatever you can contribute, however small...And if you can't afford anything at all, that's OK too!! We know how it is to squeeze through tough times.
So if you think this is a cool project, please HELP GET THE WORD OUT! Please give us a shout out to your friends who like rock music and music videos.. We've always loved and supported other indie bands and we hope you'll help us make this project be as great as it deserves to be. 

This project is our dream, and we can’t thank you enough for your support.
Your contributions are tax-deductible! See each perk for details!
*Please note, since this is through an artistic non-profit, they do not accept PAYPAL- it is a Credit Card checkout.





Kat Auster is a sponsored artist with Performance Zone Inc (dba The Field), a not-for-profit, tax-exempt, 501(c)(3) organization serving the performing arts community. Contributions to The Field earmarked for As arts NY / Hyung Ji ( Heidi ) Yu are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law. For more information about The Field contact: The Field, 75 Maiden Lane, Suite 906 New York, NY 10038, phone: 212-691-6969 or fax: 212-255-2053or for our national charities registration, see details. A copy of our latest financial report may be obtained from The Field or from the Office of Attorney General, Charities Bureau, 120 Broadway, New York, NY 10271.

story:
Short Summary

I'm Matt Brown, and I make music for people that believe in the idea of persevering through any and all obstacles. This tour will help us reach out to those people in need of a voice who feel that they are alone:

  • I've been making songs for 6 years, I have over 300 written and 60 recorded.
  • This campaign is important because it will help Strive meet a whole new market and people that can connect us with larger audiences.
  • By helping us you are not only funding one tour, you are funding a platform that will help thousands of young and hungry artist reach their goals.

If you believe in helping the youth of today learn how to grow and become more successful without selling their souls to a record company, than this campaign is for you.

What We Need & What You Get

Let me break it down for youl:

  • This campaign is mainly for Transportation, we need Gas that will help us get from B.C Canada to San Diego.
  • Our perks are very cool because they come in all shapes in sizes. If you have 1 dollar you can still help out! Or if you want to be a major contributor to Strive and Matt's next album you have the option of spending $1,000 to become a PRODUCER!
  • If we don't reach our goal of $5,000 then we will still use the money we gather to by Merchandise and help us market the tour so more people can participate.

The Impact

Many people think that their contribution doesn't impact us, WRONG:

  • You're help will influence a younger generation of Self Motivated artist feel empowered and willing to achieve their dreams.
  • Matt has already had years of live performance experience and has been doing test runs all over Washington State which has already been benificial.
  • You have an opportunity right now to make a huge difference in people lives, from audience members to entrepreneurs.

Risks & Challenges

This tour does come with many risks. I could easily become sick and have to cancel some shows due to that, or I may run out of guitar strings if I try and do this tour self funded.

  • However I already have experience working 18+ hours in a Seafood Processing Plant in Alaska, so being tired is not a challenge to me.
  • I already play two to three open mic nights a week so I have trained my body to be ready for this endeavor.
  • For the first two weeks I will be on my own. However after Silas finishes school he will join me for the more difficult part of the journey stretching down from Oregon to California. With his help, this tour will be successful, no doubt in my mind.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this campaign and my music with all of your friends and family members. Ask them to share it if they like it. By showing more people you can have an even greater impact then just contributing financially 
  • Please use Indiegogo's share tools so that people you will be showing can come directly to this page!

Thank you so much for reading, feel free to contact us with any questions!

story:
A ONE-OF-A-KIND MUSICAL MASTERPIECE

  • Monteverdi's 1610 Vespers stood as the grandest piece of religious music for more than a century after its composition, and many musicians today consider it some of the best music ever composed.
  • Calling for rarely heard, exquisite historical instruments and early music singers, this masterpiece expresses a great variety of sounds and emotions.
  • This piece has never been performed in Detroit due to the expertise needed for a historically inspired performance. Audivi, a professional vocal ensemble, and Dark Horse Consort, a nationally renowned instrumental ensemble, will join to perform the Monteverdi Vespers at the grand, resonant Cathedral of the Most Blessed Sacrament on Sunday, April 24, at 3:00 p.m.
  • We hope that you will join us for this concert, a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to hear this piece locally. Please invite your friends, family, and anyone who loves music to our concert.

Support Our Project

  • The scope of this project far exceeds any others which Audivi has undertaken. Most of the instrumentalists are nationally-known experts in their field of early music. We have set out on this journey in hopes of a transcendent experience for all present.
  • Please consider supporting us in any way that you can. Every donation helps, even simply $1.
  • Audivi, comprised of many of the top singers in the Detroit metro area, New York City, and beyond, will offer you our gratitude for your support. To show our thanks, we will send you a video, a recording of this concert, recordings of all of our archived concerts, an option to perform repertoire of your choosing in the future, and even a private concert at your arrangement, depending on the level of support.
  • All financial support will go directly towards our concert production.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help our project by getting the word out.

  • Share news of this concert with those in the Detroit metro area.
  • Pass on our Indiegogo page to those who love music.
  • Visit our website: Audivi.net.

Thank you!

We hope to see you at the Monteverdi 1610 Vespers at Sunday, April 24, 3:00 p.m., at Blessed Sacrament, Detroit, whether in person or via a note of gratitude in our program. You can buy concert tickets online here.

Thank you for visiting!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Aminu and I'm a Singer Songwriter born in West Africa. Educated and raised in the United Kingdom. As a young child I always dreamed of being a top performer and musical sensation and never stopped dreaming ever since. My influences are some of the greats such as Michael Jackson, Marvin Gaye, Prince and so much more. I'm a classically trained vocalist and find so much joy in fusing different styles of music from Pop to Jazz to Latin and Afrobeat. My EP is ready to be released which was fully funded by myself and i need your help to get it fully mastered, released and promoted through my existing digital music distribution platforms such as iTunes, Spotify and Amazon and Google Play. 
My Campaign means so much to me because I've taken a while to write songs that mean a lot to me and hopefully to other people as well. Songs from the heart and fun stories in my life I'm willing to share with the world. My experiences have played a huge role in shaping me into the artist I have become today and it's time I use my voice to say the important things that i know everyone else might be thinking in their minds,  or wanting to say.
The Contributions i receive will go a very long way in helping me and my musical team achieve our goals in making this EP a smash hit and get you all singing along in no time. Promoting music is not the easiest process these days and if you have the funds to focus and promote your material correctly and effectively. Then do not leave any stone unturned. We are going global and we want you to be part of it!
I would be so grateful if i could gain your support in exchange for some of the lovely perks i have created for you. All you need to do is pick your choices and we will deliver! Some of my perks might include things completely outside of the box but still desirable so allow me to surprise you with perks I have designed specially for you!

What We Need & What you get

We need £15,000 to go into the final mastering of the Album and promotion as well. So in more detail:

  • Advertising (Public transport such as busses and underground trains, Billboards, posters, CD's, Radio, DJ's and remixes) Promoting existing music videos i.e airtime.
  • Perks you will be receiving will be surprising, exciting and a unique mixture! From earlybird opportunities such as signed album cd's before the official release date, Branded Tshirts, creative Logos and slogans, half priced tickets on future concerts/ VIP seats, Private gigs for you and your friends and family or privately parties you may be thinking about hosting, mentioning your name in my album credits, 3 course dinner prepared by myself for you and a friend as i am a great chef! Also chance to experience a free latin dance class with me (A group salsa class i will host at a secret venue on a few dates you could chose from) Surprise surprise! I told you it would be surprising and exciting! If a perk is not listed in the perks section then it means you can request the specially for yourself and we promise to try and make it available to you! 
  • If we succeed in raising the full amount we are asking for we will be in a very good position to have numerous chart topping singles from the EP/album as we already currently have strong digital distribution channels such as iTunes, spottily and Amazon. 
  • The first stop for the funds to be used will go into pressing cd copies of the album, album artwork, album booklet.
  • Dj's need to be contacted and distribution means they are a few of the first people who will receive a copy of the EP.
  • Posters and billboard advertising in public areas and public transport are also a very effective source or advertising.
  • Remixes of hit singles will also be budgeted for in the funding. 
  • Street teams and managers.
How else can you help?

By spreading the word! Please share our story with all your friends and music lovers out there about what we are trying to do. Wherever i go my band also goes with me and they also need some recognition and some credit! Thank you so much for sharing our story! Blessings to you all!

story:
About Mephisto

There is nothing we enjoy more than those performances during which it feels as though the audience is in the palm of our hand. We have their undivided and complete attention: the perfect atmosphere for communicating our ideas. Sometimes it is the characterful and theatrical aspect of our interpretation that captures the audience's imagination. The movement, the drama, the intensity. But on other occasions it's the sheer virtuosity that grabs our listeners, with almost mysterious effect.

Legend has it that the bourgeoisie regularly fainted at concerts given by the great Niccolò Paganini. The aura of mystique enshrouding his personality and talent was truly remarkable, to the point where the only possible explanation for such great artistry had to be something super-human. No wonder so many believed he had sold his soul to the devil, a legend which persisted even after his death, denying him a proper burial in sacred ground. He was a genuine interpreter, perhaps one of the first for whom what he played did not matter as much as how he played it. It seems very possible that the young Franz Liszt wanted to exude a similar air of mystique when he started writing and performing his own virtuoso piano music, often borrowing themes from other composers and transforming them into fantastic virtuosic showpieces in the great Paganini tradition.

We couldn't resist this idea ourselves when we decided to weave our next album around this red thread – this mephistophelian virtuosity.

 

On the CD:

W. A. Mozart: Octet in C minor
D. Shostakovitj: Schauspiel Suite
F. Liszt: Mephisto Waltz no. 1
F. Liszt: Grandes Études de Paganini No. 6
B. Bartók: Romanian Folk Dances

all in arrangements by David M.A.P. Palmquist

Help us bring Mephisto to life!

Only on CD of course.. We need your help to succeed bringing this new CD to you, and we hope you would conisder one of the great perks we created!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate all the help you can give us! If all our perks are sold out, or you can spare a couple of minutes of your time, we would appreciate if you would share this campaign with the world. Or share one of our videos, spreading our music around. Every share counts! :)
