story:
Short Summary

Hey there, fellow music-lover! Have you ever wondered why the same standard works are repeated over and over again in concert houses all over the world? Do you believe that there is a good deal of lesser-known repertoire that deserves getting heard more often?  Then you're in excellent company. "Key discoveries" is a new piano recital series offering a stage to pianists with a curious mind, eager to  reach far beyond the most often heard repertoire. While it also offers room for traditional repertoire, the central aim of the concerts is to offer something new and unexpected to the concert-goers. A regular piano recital series has long been missing in Helsinki - finally it is becoming reality! The concerts will be video-recorded and shared in part via YouTube, also reaching audiences far away from Finland.


For the first season, there is a total of six recitals planned. If the final budget allows for more, there will be more concerts planned. Among the concerts taking place in the 15/16 season of "Key discoveries" we have:


An opening recital by Kiril Kozlovsky, focusing on 'emigrant composers'.  The Russians Nikolai Medtner and Sergei Rachmaninoff are heard in the second half, and the first half includes music by contemporary composers including Matthew Whittall, Matei Gheorghiu, Pasi Lyytikäinen and Ilari Kaila. The concert will include a world premiere of Mikko Nisula's Piano Sonata. 

Pianist Risto-Matti Marin will act as a host for this opening concert, and will hold a pre-concert discussion with the composers who will be present at the concert. 


Anna Christensson's recital "Awekening - Swedish 1920's" offers an unusual and rewarding glimpse into the Swedish musical life of the beginning of the last century. The concert explores three Swedish composers that were active during this time, and through whose deeds the Swedish music tradition finally woke up to the dawn of modernism. We meet the young pioneer Hilding Rosenberg in the early stages of his highly productive artistry that continued until the very end of the 1900's. We meet the vagabond Gösta Nystroem, who spent most of the decade at sea and in Paris. There he experienced the optimism of the new times both as a painter and as a composer. And we meet Henning Mankell (grandfather of the writer with the same name), the shy loner. Eternally in love with the sound-world of the piano, he writes sprawling, dramatic and beautiful works.


Oskar Ekberg will present an all-Swedish program ranging from baroque to early 20th century, including works by Johan Helmich Roman, Adolf Fredrik Lindblad, Gustav Düben, Elfrida Andrée and Valborg Aulin. Though considered 'the father of Swedish music', a great deal of Johan Helmich Roman's music has been obscured by the immensely popular "Drottningholm music". Such was the fate of his twelve keyboard suites, until Oskar Ekberg came along and made the premiere recording (on piano) of the entire set. The rest of the concert shines light on other interesting figures in Swedish music life, and also focuses on several somewhat neglected female composers of the 19th century.


Jonas Olsson will perform a program of 'contemporary classics', focusing in particular on music written in the 2000's. Brian Ferneyhough's classic Lemma-Icon-Epigram is heard along with works by a new generation of composers, some of whom are heard for the first time in Finland! Vassos Nicolaou, Johan Svensson, Art-Oliver Simon, Pedro Alvarez and others will be heard.


Inese Klotina has become well known as a temperamental pianist with particular interest in the music of Nikolai Medtner. For this recital however, she will play a program including music by the Finnish-Swedish composer Laura Netzel, Ture Rangström, Karl Nicklas Gustavsson, as well as works by the Lithuanian composer Mikalojus Konstantinas Čiurlionis.


...for information about remaining concerts, programs and performers, do stay tuned! Details will be revealed as our crowd-funding campaign continues.


This project is run by pianist Martin Malmgren and composer/producer Karl Nicklas Gustavsson. Martin has a long-time interest in exploring lesser-heard repertoire, and Nicklas has many years of experience as organizer and producer of concert series and music competitions, such as SIMC (Stockholm International Music  Competition). Pianist Risto-Matti Marin will also function as an adviser and concert host.



What We Need & What You Get

"Key discoveries" has so far received generous funds from the Swedish Cultural Foundation and Musiikkin Edestämissäätiö. However, the rental of the concert hall turned out to be higher than we expected, and we also want to pay all pianists an acceptable sum for their performances. As it is hard to estimate how much incomes we will have through ticket/program sales, we are still in need of more funds.


Contributing to this project will help in starting out something new, important and valuable to the cultural life in Helsinki. We are starting out with a highly limited budget and with only six concerts per season, but if the series will receive enough attention, it will have the chance of receiving more funds for future series. By contributing, you will help the ball start rolling. Larger funds for future seasons would give us the possibility to invite international artists, as well as organizing seminars and masterclasses. Anyone that contributes will receive something in return, as all of the concerts will be recorded and released in part via YouTube. A website will soon be up, and it is our idea that a website for a concert series of this kind will also be educational, and include extensive information about the composers that are highlighted and their times, as well as the pianists invited to perform.


As things stand right now, any contributions through this campaign will be crucial to having the concert series launched the way that it is planned. With a lack of funds, we will have to limit the amount of concerts further, which is not something we would like to do at this point. Meanwhile, we are also applying for scholarships through various cultural foundations. If we are lucky enough to reach our goal with such help, all donations received through this campaign will serve other goals, such as:


* Raising the somewhat limited compensation for the pianists invited

* Recording all concerts professionally, with more amount of microphones and cameras, and covering costs for editing the material

* Spending more money on advertisement

* Including one or two more concerts in the series

* Saving money for the following season


The Impact

What we hope is that this initiative will reach out to audiences and make them discover music they otherwise would not have come across, played by pianists they likely would not have heard otherwise. 

Risks & Challenges

As long as we raise enough money for this project, there are no significant challenges ahead. One challenge in these early stages is going to be to advertise the series - Helsinki has a lot to offer on the music scene as it is, and there is a risk that an event of this kind will drown amid all other musical happenings. Our idea is to have a concert series that is welcoming towards everyone - therefore, we would like to keep the concerts free of charge, but with sales of concert programs for anyone that is interested. As the concert series also is meant to be educational, we program leaflets will cover a wide range of topics relevant to the music being performed.

Other Ways You Can Help

The best way to help us is to spread the word, and perhaps offer advice and suggestions! You are most welcome to put a 'like' on our Facebook page to find out the most recent about "Key discoveries"!


https://www.facebook.com/keydiscoveries


Additionally, we are always happy to communicate with anyone interested in finding out more about the series, and anyone willing to help us out in other ways! Suggestions on repertoire, interesting pianists, composers and whatnot are certainly most welcome. Feel free to send an email to:

key.discoveries.helsinki@gmail.com
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hey there, fellow music-lover! Have you ever wondered why the same standard works are repeated over and over again in concert houses all over the world? Do you believe that there is a good deal of lesser-known repertoire that deserves getting heard more often?  Then you're in excellent company. "Key discoveries" is a new piano recital series offering a stage to pianists with a curious mind, eager to  reach far beyond the most often heard repertoire. While it also offers room for traditional repertoire, the central aim of the concerts is to offer something new and unexpected to the concert-goers. A regular piano recital series has long been missing in Helsinki - finally it is becoming reality! The concerts will be video-recorded and shared in part via YouTube, also reaching audiences far away from Finland.


For the first season, there is a total of six recitals planned. If the final budget allows for more, there will be more concerts planned. Among the concerts taking place in the 15/16 season of "Key discoveries" we have:

An opening recital by Kiril Kozlovsky, focusing on 'emigrant composers'.  The Russians Nikolai Medtner and Sergei Rachmaninoff are heard in the second half, and the first half includes music by contemporary composers including Matthew Whittall, Matei Gheorghiu, Pasi Lyytikäinen and Ilari Kaila. The concert will include a world premiere of Mikko Nisula's Piano Sonata. 
Pianist Risto-Matti Marin will act as a host for this opening concert, and will hold a pre-concert discussion with the composers who will be present at the concert. 

Anna Christensson's recital "Awekening - Swedish 1920's" offers an unusual and rewarding glimpse into the Swedish musical life of the beginning of the last century. The concert explores three Swedish composers that were active during this time, and through whose deeds the Swedish music tradition finally woke up to the dawn of modernism. We meet the young pioneer Hilding Rosenberg in the early stages of his highly productive artistry that continued until the very end of the 1900's. We meet the vagabond Gösta Nystroem, who spent most of the decade at sea and in Paris. There he experienced the optimism of the new times both as a painter and as a composer. And we meet Henning Mankell (grandfather of the writer with the same name), the shy loner. Eternally in love with the sound-world of the piano, he writes sprawling, dramatic and beautiful works.

Oskar Ekberg will present an all-Swedish program ranging from baroque to early 20th century, including works by Johan Helmich Roman, Adolf Fredrik Lindblad, Gustav Düben, Elfrida Andrée and Valborg Aulin. Though considered 'the father of Swedish music', a great deal of Johan Helmich Roman's music has been obscured by the immensely popular "Drottningholm music". Such was the fate of his twelve keyboard suites, until Oskar Ekberg came along and made the premiere recording (on piano) of the entire set. The rest of the concert shines light on other interesting figures in Swedish music life, and also focuses on several somewhat neglected female composers of the 19th century.

Jonas Olsson will perform a program of 'contemporary classics', focusing in particular on music written in the 2000's. Brian Ferneyhough's classic Lemma-Icon-Epigram is heard along with works by a new generation of composers, some of whom are heard for the first time in Finland! Vassos Nicolaou, Johan Svensson, Art-Oliver Simon, Pedro Alvarez and others will be heard.

Inese Klotina has become well known as a temperamental pianist with particular interest in the music of Nikolai Medtner. For this recital however, she will play a program including music by the Finnish-Swedish composer Laura Netzel, Ture Rangström, Karl Nicklas Gustavsson, as well as works by the Lithuanian composer Mikalojus Konstantinas Čiurlionis.

...for information about remaining concerts, programs and performers, do stay tuned! Details will be revealed as our crowd-funding campaign continues.

This project is run by pianist Martin Malmgren and composer/producer Karl Nicklas Gustavsson. Martin has a long-time interest in exploring lesser-heard repertoire, and Nicklas has many years of experience as organizer and producer of concert series and music competitions, such as SIMC (Stockholm International Music  Competition). Pianist Risto-Matti Marin will also function as an adviser and concert host.




What We Need & What You Get
"Key discoveries" has so far received generous funds from the Swedish Cultural Foundation and Musiikkin Edestämissäätiö. However, the rental of the concert hall turned out to be higher than we expected, and we also want to pay all pianists an acceptable sum for their performances. As it is hard to estimate how much incomes we will have through ticket/program sales, we are still in need of more funds.


Contributing to this project will help in starting out something new, important and valuable to the cultural life in Helsinki. We are starting out with a highly limited budget and with only six concerts per season, but if the series will receive enough attention, it will have the chance of receiving more funds for future series. By contributing, you will help the ball start rolling. Larger funds for future seasons would give us the possibility to invite international artists, as well as organizing seminars and masterclasses. Anyone that contributes will receive something in return, as all of the concerts will be recorded and released in part via YouTube. A website will soon be up, and it is our idea that a website for a concert series of this kind will also be educational, and include extensive information about the composers that are highlighted and their times, as well as the pianists invited to perform.


As things stand right now, any contributions through this campaign will be crucial to having the concert series launched the way that it is planned. With a lack of funds, we will have to limit the amount of concerts further, which is not something we would like to do at this point. Meanwhile, we are also applying for scholarships through various cultural foundations. If we are lucky enough to reach our goal with such help, all donations received through this campaign will serve other goals, such as:



* Raising the somewhat limited compensation for the pianists invited
* Recording all concerts professionally, with more amount of microphones and cameras, and covering costs for editing the material
* Spending more money on advertisement
* Including one or two more concerts in the series
* Saving money for the following season



The Impact
What we hope is that this initiative will reach out to audiences and make them discover music they otherwise would not have come across, played by pianists they likely would not have heard otherwise. 


Risks & Challenges
As long as we raise enough money for this project, there are no significant challenges ahead. One challenge in these early stages is going to be to advertise the series - Helsinki has a lot to offer on the music scene as it is, and there is a risk that an event of this kind will drown amid all other musical happenings. Our idea is to have a concert series that is welcoming towards everyone - therefore, we would like to keep the concerts free of charge, but with sales of concert programs for anyone that is interested. As the concert series also is meant to be educational, we program leaflets will cover a wide range of topics relevant to the music being performed.


Other Ways You Can Help
The best way to help us is to spread the word, and perhaps offer advice and suggestions! You are most welcome to put a 'like' on our Facebook page to find out the most recent about "Key discoveries"!

https://www.facebook.com/keydiscoveries

Additionally, we are always happy to communicate with anyone interested in finding out more about the series, and anyone willing to help us out in other ways! Suggestions on repertoire, interesting pianists, composers and whatnot are certainly most welcome. Feel free to send an email to:
key.discoveries.helsinki@gmail.com

story:
The violin-accordion duo Cricket & Snail is in the process of releasing a NEW CD entitled Street Symphonies! But we need your help. We’ve got the recordings and $500 already raised, but we are not there yet financially to fund the production costs ($1000 for the CDs + $500 for song licensing= $1500) so we still need $1000. We are offering some incentives as well including a copy of the CD (for $20 contribution) and a house concert (for $250). (For more see below.)
The title Street Symphonies refers to inclusion of 5 symphony movements arranged for violin and accordion on the program.  These are cleverly and effectively arranged pieces that we have played on the streets of Prague. Other songs on the CD have street themes as well (Pigalle, Der Gasn Nigun/2nd Avenue Square Dance, Theme for Mon Oncle and Raglan Road). We look forward to sharing our latest mix of French, Klezmer, Celtic and classical tunes with you soon!

Listen to a preview of Street Symphonies here:

https://soundcloud.com/cricket-and-snail/street-symphonies-cd-preview

Here's the complete track listing:

1. Symphony No. 40 ("The Klezmer"), G minor, I. Allegro Molto, Mozart       
2. Pigalle, Ulmer/Luypaerts
3. Der Gasn Nign/Second Avenue Square Dance, Klezmer      
4. Symphony No. 7, II. Andante (Tango), Beethoven   
5. Theme from the film Mon Oncle                      
6. Menuetto from Symphony No. 39, Mozart    
7. Raglan Road, Trad. Irish              
8. Symphony No. 1, III. Feierlich, Mahler   
9. J’Attendrai (I Will Wait)                    
10. Az der Rebbe Zingt a Tanzt, Klezmer      
11.  Largo from New World Symphony, Dvorak 
INCENTIVES –

$20 “street” level = copy of Street Symphonies CD
$40 level = copy of Street Symphonies CD + copy of one of our other CDs (your choice)
$65 level = 3 CD of your choosing
$75 level = 3 CDs of your choosing + an autographed 8×10 photo of CS + CS art print
$100 = 4 CDs (your choice)
$250 level = house concert (Greater Nashville/Knoxville/Chattanooga, Seattle, Prague areas only)

Thank you for your support! 

Jim & Lucie

story:
Hi, I’m Tony Fernandez and for the past two fun filled decades I’ve been performing as the lead singer of a critically acclaimed The Doors tribute band: Peace Frog in Venice, California. Our band is really excited to bring you the news of raising the stakes creating a brand new Doors show: The Ultimate Doors Experience and we need your help.

The Doors music has had a significant ongoing impact on me throughout my life transporting me during the good, bad and best times. The Doors to me are the greatest rock 'n' roll band ever to live.

The Doors music is so theatrical that the natural next step would be a brand new show enhanced with state of the art lighting and cinematography.

Even though the Peace Frog tribute to The Doors has been touring internationally for decades and now it is time to take it to a next level of an interactive production.

The Doors music means a lot to so many fans over the years and your contribution will make a huge difference in keeping The Doors music alive and bringing doors fans together over and over again. What a way to celebrate The Doors music in a new venture.

We need $30,000 to make this full production a reality.

Please take a few minutes to view this time lapse video that shows how many crew members are involved to set up an elaborate production is this. At least 25 crew members are involved in the stage production. We also need to rent a theater in Los Angeles that's capable of handling this kind of full production. Our friend Matt who designed lights for Rush and toured with them for 17 years will be the main stage manager lighting designer. 

http://www.britfloyd.com/videos/16-behind-the-scenes/146-stage-setup-time-lapse-syracuse-2012

Some of our unique perks are a tour of Los Angeles stores hearts, Jim Morrison Concho belts, Jim Morrison Miami hat, Jim Morrison beads, peace frog CDs autographed, Las Vegas cannery show VIP, and the largest perk executive producer

story:
Christian Cybermall is a place that unifies Christian companies in hopes to further Gods kingdom. 

Christian Cybermall is an online marketplace where people can buy and sell faithfully inspired products. Currently, there are 105 Christian companies that offer a wide range of products such as: apparel, jewelry, music, and home & living items. 

Christians helping Christians:  Christian companies have similar goals: to reach other Christians through their gifts and talents. We hope that in unifying these companies they may be able to help one another. We also believe that Christian Cybermall can offer individuals a way to raise money for Church retreats and mission trips.  

We Support Gods Kingdom Builders!  We believe that by sharing each other’s struggles and successes, Christian companies will be able to strengthen and encourage each other.  These companies have a story to tell and they tell it through their gifts and talents. 

You can visit our site at:  www.christiancybermall.com 

Customer Benefits:

·  One stop shopping mall for Christian related products

·  Able to purchase products from around the world

·  Christian Cybermall is translatable in 50 languages

·  Product is delivered to your physical address

·  No more standing in long lines

Vendor Benefits:

·  No hosting costs

·  Don’t need to build a website

·  Able to set your own costs and shipping

·  Unlimited product uploads

·  Customizable vendor page

Other Benefits:

·  Community page

o  Prayer requests

o  Praise reports

o  Events

o  Photo gallery 



Customer Process

The customer process is very simple:  Search, Purchase, & Spread Gods Word 

  • Search:  Our strategically placed search boxes and various departments will enable you quick access to the item you are looking for.
  • Purchase:  The action of purchasing Christian products is what we call the "Blessing Process".  Our shopping cart process is simple, safe and secure when purchasing within our system. 
  • Spread:  There’s no better feeling then sharing God’s word by representing faithfully inspired products!   

View a quick video of the shopping experience and a small glimpse into our community page.


       


Vendor Process

The vendor process is also very simple:  Sign up, Set up a Vendor Profile, & Join Our Community.

  • Sign up:  Signing up take less than a minute. After signing up you are then able to post your products (physical & downloadable items). 
  • Vendor Profile:  God placed visions and dreams only in the heart of the Christian companies itself (and they are all different); therefore, as a vendor it is imperative you set up your vendor profile. The vendor profile is where you tell your customers who you are; ultimately where you can speak to them directly.  This is where you can also set up your parameters (shipping and return policies).
  • Join our Community:  We want you to be a part of our movement. As a Christian company, there may be times when life gets challenging. Be a part of a community where Christians support Christians!

View a quick video of how easy and fast it is to sign up and get started.
      



We want to showcase Christian companies in the best ways possible; thus, we need monetary support to do so. Your funds will help us with:

· Internet & Conventional Marketing  

·  Update the website’s design and functionality

·  Provide additional features for vendor customization

·  Provide a faster checkout page

·  Mobile friendly

·  Obtain software to convert currency

·  Ability for buyers to donate to non-profits of their choice



Please view our detail fund breakdown by  "Clicking Here"



Meet our existing Vendors!


Meet the team...Meet the family! 

Keala is 24 years old and the founder of Christian Cybermall. Her duties include overall management of the company. She is an entrepreneur at heart and loves God, family & friends. She hopes to dedicate her life to creating and running nonprofits. 

Josh is 28 years old and the marketing director of Christian Cybermall. His duties include creating and managing marketing strategies (i.e., Radio, Facebook, Instagram, etc.).   He is also an entrepreneur and founder of "Friday's" a Christian outreach program that welcomes people from all walks of life and different churches. Fridays is an event every second Friday of the month that provides: worship music, art and fellowship in a unique way.

Malia is 25 years old and is the sales executive for Christian Cybermall.  Her duties include communicating with the vendors and helping them through the process of getting started. She takes pride in being a mom, to her beautiful one year old son. She also enjoys serving on the worship team with her husband at Inspire church. 

Damon is 48 years old and is the regional manager of Christian Cybermall. He is the customer relations manager, husband to wife, Karen and father of Josh, Malia, Keala and Isaac. He's a huge inspiration to his Children's and is the person who introduced them to Christ. He enjoys surfing and spending time with his family. 


Friends in Christ,

My name is Keala Duhaylonsod and I am the founder of Christian Cybermall.  My family and I would like to thank you in advance for your interest and support for our cause…Christians supporting Christians!

We sincerely appreciate your monetary contributions towards our cause; however, we would also like to you to join us in prayer, as we ask our Savior, Jesus Christ, to bless us with wisdom, leadership, direction and the will to reach all people of Christ.

We ask you also, to pray for all the present and future companies associated with Christian Cybermall.  Each of these companies are following the dreams that God have placed in their heart.  

Growing a business in Christ can be challenging; thus, we ask our Lord to bless each and every one of them with the will to persevere, the strength to keep moving forward and a steadfast faith able to move mountains. 

Once again, thank you for your generosity and for making our dreams become a reality.


God bless,

Keala Duhaylonsod

CEO

keala@christiancybermall.com 



READY TO DONATE?

Click "HERE"



What is the mission of Christian Cybermall?
The Mission of Christian Cybermall is to fulfill the dreams God has placed on the hearts of Christian companies.

How can I support?
Prayer- We could use your prayers! We know that only through God we will be able to hit our goal. Please pray for us. 
Donations- We ask that if you are able to support financially, please do so!  
Spread the word-Share our campaign on FB, twitter & google plus. Also we would love to hear from you. Please leave us a comment (on the top of the page to the left, click the "comment" button). 

What if I can't Donate?

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean that you can’t help! Please PRAY for us! Help spread the word and let other people know about our film by sharing this page and on Facebook, Twitter, G+, or wherever else you can think up!

Are you a distributor, or a larger company that would like to talk about large-scale sponsorship? Email inquiries to keala@christiancybermall.com 


When will I receive my reward?
We are working hard to get you your reward as soon as possible. At the latest expect it by the end of the year.  We hope to get it to you ASAP.

How can I get updates?
As Christian Cybermall grows from your kind donations you can check the updates of our progress on our blog at: blogccm.com

I have questions and concerns!
We would love to answer any questions or concerns you may have. Please email us at: admin@christiancybermall.com // We will respond with in 24/hrs.

Please email us at: admin@christiancybermall.com // We will respond with in 24/hrs.

story:
Plugged Inn Venues is a new independent live music and retro gaming venue opening in Liverpool. 


What is the idea?

I am proposing the opening of a new music and gaming venue, Plugged Inn, located in Liverpool city centre. The venue aims to offer a variety of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages presented within a new concept bar, tailored to creating a social experience while addressing a visible gap in the bar industry.

Plugged Inn Venues (PIV) aims to offer a unique bar experience by reinventing the institution of the British Pub, replacing typical bar games such a darts, dominos and pool with a modern substitutions. The main aim of Plugged Inn Venues is to stop fighting against the influx of technology, instead embracing it too attract target customers by using traditionally in home gaming systems in a bar environment to create a uniquely stimulating atmosphere.

By replacing traditional games with on-site video gaming options, that are equipped with multiplayer games, I hope to create an engaging and invigorating environment that gives customers a reason to visit. This will all happen while being backed by a sound tracked provided by local original bands and performers. The attraction of on-site gaming and the availability for local acts to perform at the venue are all part of providing entertainment that encourages customer involvement, not only presenting target customers with events but allowing them to have as much or as little involvement as they wish. 


Who are we?

Business Manager - With 10 years experience working within a variety of roles in the bar industry from bar staff to managing of large workforces in very busy establishments, i have had the chance to learn and develop skill such as conflict management, customer services and finical responsibilities vital in the daily running of a venue. Since graduating with honours from Liverpool John Moores University i have used this time to gain valuable incite into the gaming industry and its customers working Sony Computer Entertainment Europe as a functionality and quality assurer. This has allowed me to visit international conferences, events and promotional launches for a variety of games and systems including the Playstation 4 launch. I am confident i can transfer this idea from a sound business plan to a striving venue as i have a background in developing projects successfully with previously being involved in the creation and development of local mens sports teams and a key member in large city centre charity. 


Music Manager - Working in the industry almost 10 years she has worked with hundreds of bands and performers from the local area, in both a personal capacity and an established musician herself and as an events organisers and live music event provider. She has a proven track record in providing a unique live music experience with events such a 12 bands of Christmas, Battle of the Bands, Band Royales. Her PR experience has allowed her to promote herself and her events in large scale publications such as Terroriser, Kerrang, Big Cheese as well as mulitple local newpapers and magazines.


PR and Financial Advisor - As we are a relatively inexperienced business we have externally sourced a financial advisor and PR advisor to help with the initial development of the business. This is sourced though local support supplier MBJ Solutions. 


What we are fundraising for?

We are looking to source £25,000 this will be invested alongside £2,500 in capital already held by Plugged Inn Venues towards initial costing and outgoings, such as cash purchases, sub-contractors and business insurances. 
These have all been carefully managed and can be provided if requested i a full cash-flow forecast, please contact us for this information. 


Why should i get involved?

We are hoping that we can create a hub for musicians and performers in Liverpool and the North West, that is highly influenced by it's customers. We want to hear your ideas on how we can make that happen, we want your bands, do you play something different? we want you too! To get this venue up and running we NEED you, help by pledging as little or as much as you can. Support us!!


Contact Us

Email - Pluggedinnvenues@gmail.com

Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/pluggedinnvenues

Twitter - @pluggedinnvenue

story:
My Background & The Recording Of "Northern Town"

I have been a working musician in the Niagara area since the spring of 1979. I have always written my own songs, but it took me until 2005 to finally record and release my first album, "Ghosts," and the main reason it took so long was a lack of the money to do it. Life certainly enjoys throwing its curves my way. Thanks to the help of many friends, I was able to get that album done on a relatively small budget. I immediately began to write songs for a new album, and now it is ten years later, and I'm ready to do a second one, but I am going to need some help to accomplish it. I want to do a bit more musically this time, with bass and percussion and keyboards, and get a bunch of CD's actually manufactured this time, and every little bit will help bring me closer to my goal. The first recording session has already taken place. Now it's time to get this thing going and get it finished.

My goal is to raise about $1600. That should cover the cost of the recording sessions, paying the musicians, and getting 300 CD's manufactured at the end. It's not a lot of money, but for a person working hard on minimum wage, as I am, there isn't a lot extra to go around. My music has always been the most important thing in my life, outside of my family, and the new songs are good and just begging to be put out there properly. My fans have been asking me for a new album for years now. "Ghosts" was extremely well-received, and I feel this new album will be even better. The new album is based around my experiences during vacation times spent on the Bruce Peninsula. It will be a positive, spiritually uplifting record.

In return for your contributions, everyone who donates money to my cause will receive an autographed copy of the new album, which will be in CD/Digipak format. I will also do a draw for two contributors to receive a private concert at their home, provided that they live within driving distance for me from Niagara, and we are able to set up a suitable, convenient date.

story:
SUSPENSION OF DISBELIEF PREVIEW
(¡Baja un poco para la versión en Español!)

Short story

Hello! For those of you who haven't met us yet, we are Caleidofonio, a musical group formed by six musicians that want to invite you to perceive reality in a different way. With original songs and improvisations that promote the suspension of disbelief, we extend our hand and welcome you to listen and see everything that we sometimes give for granted when we see it with the eyes of habit.
In the last months we managed to record our first album, Suspension Of Disbelief , and this has made us very happy because we got to enjoy every part of a process in which  the songs that once were just a fragment of our imagination, finally materialized. We went through the phase of composing and arranging, we gathered to rehearse the songs with a lot of enthusiasm and went to the recording studio to have some fun; achieving the sound of our dreams through the processes of mixing and mastering.  Finally we got to translate the universe of every song into illustrations that build up a beautiful booklet that narrates several ways of perception.

With all of this ready, there's only one more step: Making everything possible so that this album that we love so much is finally available to get to you, either in a physical format or in a digital platform. We want it to get as far as it can go. We also want to make a big launching concert with other artists, dancers, and acrobats.

What we need and what you get

For this we need 4,500 dollars that will be distributed the following way:


By helping us with our dream, you deserve to get several rewards which range from getting the digital copy of the album, all the way to getting a concerts in your house or via streaming, the signed physical copy of the album, and several other surprises. 

If we don't reach our goal, we're using the funds mainly for the physical copies of the album and it's digital distribution.

Impact

In this world that is moved by habit frenzy and it's mechanical movements, sometimes we need to remember that, in the most unsuspected corners of reality, universes full of beauty and wonder are hidden, and we want our songs to be a reminder of that search; an invitation to perceive reality in other ways. Help us build a world where the Great Habit and the disbelief are suspended with more frequency, and extend this invitation to every one that could enjoy our proposal.

Risks and challenges

In Colombia, crowdfunding campaigns like this one are still a relatively unknown method for independent artists like us to raise funds for their projects. This might difficult the diffusion and support of our campaign at a national level. Never the less, we are hopeful because we believe in the quality and the emotional and esthetic value of our music. We've also been shown by the raising number of artists and creators that there is a great collective need to break the Great Habit and be able to see reality in different ways, which is why we believe that our proposal will be in sync with every person that is in that search. We are more than willing to share every week in this campaign, music and videos that inspired us to open reality for us, hoping that you get to experience something similar.

Other ways to contribute

We know that it's not always possible to contribute economically, but if you like our music and our proposal, we invite you to share our campaign using the several Indiegogo tools, and you will greatly help us achieve our dreams.


(Scroll up for English!)

Breve historia

¡Hola! Para quienes aún no nos conocen, somos Caleidofonio, una agrupación constituida por seis músicos que buscan invitarte a percibir la realidad de una manera distinta. Mediante canciones propias e improvisaciones que promueven la suspensión de la incredulidad, extendemos la mano para invitarte a oír y ver todo aquello que pasamos por alto cuando vemos con los ojos de la costumbre.

En los últimos meses logramos grabar nuestro primer disco Suspension of Disbelief y esto nos tiene muy felices, porque pudimos disfrutar cada parte de un proceso en el que las canciones que alguna vez fueron sólo un fragmento de la imaginación, llegaron a materializarse. Pasamos por la fase de composición y arreglos,  nos reunimos para ensayar las canciones con muchas ganas, fuimos a divertirnos al estudio de grabación, y logramos obtener el sonido que soñábamos tras los procesos de mezcla y masterización. Finalmente pudimos traducir los universos de cada canción a ilustraciones que componen un bello librillo donde se teje la narrativa proveniente de otras percepciones. 

Teniendo todo esto listo, nos hace falta dar el último paso: Hacer todo lo posible para que este disco que tanto queremos esté en formato físico para que pueda estar en tus manos, subirlo a plataformas digitales para que lo puedas llevar contigo a cualquier lado y promocionarlo para que llegue tan lejos como sea posible. También queremos hacer un concierto de lanzamiento lleno de sorpresas, acompañados de otros artistas, bailarines y acróbatas.

 Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

 

Para todo esto necesitamos 4.500 dólares que irán destinados de la siguiente manera: 

Al ayudarnos a llevar a cabo este sueño, mereces llevarte varias recompensas que van desde la descarga digital de Suspension Of Disbelief, hasta un concierto en tu casa o vía streaming, acompañado del disco autografiado y muchas sorpresas más.

De no lograr llegar a la meta, destinaríamos los fondos para poder tener las copias físicas del disco y su distribución digital.

El impacto

En un mundo que se mueve con el frenesí de la costumbre y sus movimientos mecánicos, a veces necesitamos recordar que en los rincones más insospechados de la realidad, se esconden universos llenos de belleza y de asombro, y nosotros queremos que nuestras canciones sean un recordatorio de esa búsqueda, una invitación a percibir la realidad de otras formas. Ayúdanos a construir un mundo donde la Gran Costumbre y la incredulidad se suspendan con mayor frecuencia, extiende con nosotros esta invitación a todas aquellas personas que puedan disfrutar de nuestra propuesta.

Riesgos y desafíos

En Colombia las campañas de crowdfunding aún son un método relativamente desconocido para que artistas independientes como nosotros recauden fondos para sus proyectos. Esto puede dificultar la difusión de nuestra campaña a nivel nacional. Sin embargo nos sentimos esperanzados porque creemos en la calidad y en el valor estético y emocional de nuestra música.También el creciente número de artistas y creadores nos ha mostrado que hay una gran necesidad colectiva de romper los esquemas de la costumbre para ver la realidad de otra manera, por eso creemos que nuestra propuesta va a resonar enormemente con todas aquellas personas que están en esa búsqueda,  y nosotros estamos más que dispuestos a compartir en cada semana de la campaña, música y videos en los que la realidad se abrió para que la viéramos de una manera distinta, esperando que la experiencia sea similar para ti.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Sabemos que no siempre es posible hacer una contribución económica, pero si te gusta nuestra música y nuestra propuesta, te invitamos a que compartas nuestra campaña a través de las herramientas de Indiegogo y así nos ayudarás enormemente a cumplir nuestro sueño.

story:
Our Story

 

Subway Talents was born as a solution to numerous problems we had involving the underground subway performing scenery. We love subway performers, but it was difficult to enjoy full shows of their performance, because we were always on the run trying to catch the train to our next destination. It’s extremely rare to run into the same subway performer the next day at the same spot. We had a lot of curiosity about subway performers, so we begin searching online with the hope of finding a platform specifically designed to learn more about subway performers or discover their next performance in advanced, but it was very difficult to find a specific online platform cater to subway performers. Out of frustration we decided to take it upon ourselves to find a solution to this problem by creating Subway Talents.

 

 
 

Why We Are Raising Money

We are raising money because after launching we notice a rapid growth in our website visitors, audience and performers wanting to be featured on the website. There are so much performers to cover, and so many business related tasks that needs to be done. At the moment we are really short on staff we need funds to grow our video team.
We are backed up with videos that need to be edit, a lot of new and old performers that need to be recorded, a lot of shows to cover, and so much more. We also need money to upgrade our video equipment so we can capture great high quality content to provide to both, the performers and the audience.  
 
Equipment Need:

$1,270.99 Camera: Panasonic Lumix DMC-GH4 4K

$1,397.99 Lens:  Panasonic H-NS043 Lumix G Leica DG Nocticron 42.5mm/F1.2 Lens

$629.95 Lavalier Mic: Sennheiser EW112P G3 A-Band Wireless Lav Mic Bundle

We plan to spend $5,500 to hire additional staff to keep up with video production and new artists.

The rest of the money will cover Indiegogo fees.
 
Our Perks

We will thank you in our email and also share something special about our future plans.

 

                                           

  

Sticker size is 3" x 3"

 

 

 

 

All sizes available except XXL. 

 

 

One of the subway or street performers will sing a song for you. The video will be uploaded and share to you. 

 

Choose 1 out of 3. It will be carefully packaged and shipped in a tube. 

 

                                

 

                               

                               

 

 

Choose 1 out of 3. It will be carefully packaged and shipped in a tube. Limited quantity.

 

                                

                                

                               

 

Choose 1 out of 3. All paintings made on canvas. You will receive a unique framed spray painting made in New York City with any initials you would like to see. 

 

                                     

                                    

                                    

Hope you love food like we do, if so dinner on us. You will receive a personal dinner with both co-founders.

 

 

The size of the art will be 10.76 sq ft (1 sq m). All details about location and a picture will be sent to your email (Bike sold separately). 

The size of the art will be 21.53 sq ft (2 sq m). We will send you the exact location, a picture and a video of this perk.

 

Only one perk available and this deserves something special. We will fly to your place to personally thank you for this amazing support. Oh yeah, great selfies and great conversation guaranteed.

 

Press

 

      

 

 

 

How To Help Us

The biggest way to help us is to get one or more perks we offer and share this campaign with your friends, family and all the followers on your social media.
Please share this campaign anywhere you can and tell you friends about it. By using hashtag #subwaygogo we will track the most active promoter and reward him/her for this amazing job. It doesn't matter if you're in New York or in Brazil. What you will get? It will be a surprise.
If you have friends who would love the Subway Talents idea and would be interested in helping us grow? Please share this campaign with them. 
If you bring more donors than anyone else we will reward you with one of two prizes of your choice: 
- Monthly MetroCard or
- Spray or BikeMap NYC painting.
Make sure you used Indiegogo sharing tools so we can track your awesome friends!
Thank You in advanced for all your support.

Our Story
 
Subway Talents was born as a solution to numerous problems we had involving the underground subway performing scenery. We love subway performers, but it was difficult to enjoy full shows of their performance, because we were always on the run trying to catch the train to our next destination. It’s extremely rare to run into the same subway performer the next day at the same spot. We had a lot of curiosity about subway performers, so we begin searching online with the hope of finding a platform specifically designed to learn more about subway performers or discover their next performance in advanced, but it was very difficult to find a specific online platform cater to subway performers. Out of frustration we decided to take it upon ourselves to find a solution to this problem by creating Subway Talents.

 
 
 
Why We Are Raising Money
We are raising money because after launching we notice a rapid growth in our website visitors, audience and performers wanting to be featured on the website. There are so much performers to cover, and so many business related tasks that needs to be done. At the moment we are really short on staff we need funds to grow our video team.


We are backed up with videos that need to be edit, a lot of new and old performers that need to be recorded, a lot of shows to cover, and so much more. We also need money to upgrade our video equipment so we can capture great high quality content to provide to both, the performers and the audience.  

 
Equipment Need:

$1,270.99 Camera: Panasonic Lumix DMC-GH4 4K
$1,397.99 Lens:  Panasonic H-NS043 Lumix G Leica DG Nocticron 42.5mm/F1.2 Lens
$629.95 Lavalier Mic: Sennheiser EW112P G3 A-Band Wireless Lav Mic Bundle
We plan to spend $5,500 to hire additional staff to keep up with video production and new artists.The rest of the money will cover Indiegogo fees.
 
Our Perks


We will thank you in our email and also share something special about our future plans.



 
                                             Sticker size is 3" x 3"
 



 
  
All sizes available except XXL. 
 

 

One of the subway or street performers will sing a song for you. The video will be uploaded and share to you. 

 

Choose 1 out of 3. It will be carefully packaged and shipped in a tube. 
 
                                
 
                               
                                 
Choose 1 out of 3. It will be carefully packaged and shipped in a tube. Limited quantity.


 
                                
                                
                                
Choose 1 out of 3. All paintings made on canvas. You will receive a unique framed spray painting made in New York City with any initials you would like to see. 
 
                                     
                                    
                                    

Hope you love food like we do, if so dinner on us. You will receive a personal dinner with both co-founders.

 
 The size of the art will be 10.76 sq ft (1 sq m). All details about location and a picture will be sent to your email (Bike sold separately). 

The size of the art will be 21.53 sq ft (2 sq m). We will send you the exact location, a picture and a video of this perk.
 

Only one perk available and this deserves something special. We will fly to your place to personally thank you for this amazing support. Oh yeah, great selfies and great conversation guaranteed.
 


Press
 
        
 
How To Help Us

The biggest way to help us is to get one or more perks we offer and share this campaign with your friends, family and all the followers on your social media.
Please share this campaign anywhere you can and tell you friends about it. By using hashtag #subwaygogo we will track the most active promoter and reward him/her for this amazing job. It doesn't matter if you're in New York or in Brazil. What you will get? It will be a surprise.
If you have friends who would love the Subway Talents idea and would be interested in helping us grow? Please share this campaign with them. 
If you bring more donors than anyone else we will reward you with one of two prizes of your choice: 

- Monthly MetroCard or
- Spray or BikeMap NYC painting.
Make sure you used Indiegogo sharing tools so we can track your awesome friends!
Thank You in advanced for all your support.

story:
THANK YOU! You have raised whopping 85% of our original goal! 

Follow us on Facebook to hear news about the pre-Christmas single release and EP launch updates! Soon, you will also be able to support us, pre-order the EP and more!


WHO WE ARE & WHAT THIS IS...

We are Squid & The Krakens! We love to interact with audiences and bring them surreal, pun-tastic stories about coffee, romance and adventures - and for this landmark EP, we aimed to raise £880* and succeeded in raising nearly 74%** of this! 
This recording project features two brilliant songs - never previously recorded in a studio. The charmingly disaffected 50's croon/ punk/musical/ boogie woogie extravaganza, "Don't Call Me Darling" and the slurp-inducing story, "Affogato", PLUS new retellings of familiar favourites from Kraken Antiquity: "Tira Misu", "Caffeine Lover", and "Early One Morning".  

*Recording Costs Breakdown (for those who like maths)

Total: £880. 
You helped raised a total of £648 !!! WELL DONE YOU AWESOME PEOPLE!
**(£508 from Indiegogo plus some from people who donated in other ways). 
  • 2 Studio sessions:  £430 (We used two recording sessions and an hour extra!)
  • Bandmembers session fee: £100 x 2 = £200
  • Mastering £250
  • We'll use whatever money we have raised towards this project. We have the skills and creativity to make this sound great, and sufficient studio time will help make it sound even better! People will get their perks no matter what and Squid will just eat beans on toast, keep hassling people to buy the new EP to make the money back and you can buy him sandwiches! (cheese and pickle on brown bread please). 
We thought we would only need £600 but it was so good, we wanted to make it even better. We're really excited about how it's going to turn out!

The Power of Tentacles

  • This sounds different from the previous recording for a few reasons - Squid is going to use a PIANO sound only, to explore the possibilities of the piano sound and because pianos rock! On the previous EP, we used various instrument sounds such as electric organ and kitsch orchestra - so it will be an exciting re-working of the material.
  • There will also be some little changes, in the words and how we perform the songs - spot the difference and let us know what you found!
  • The live recording will pave the way for mixed media/animated music videos by Squid, with a booster of audience excitement/support and fresh audio material to choose from. Watch the facebook page for updates!

Other Ways You Can Help

People who didn't have any spare cash helped us by:

  • Spreading the word - share this on your social media with a personal recommendation
  • Writing me enthusiastic messages and liking our page!

THANK YOU SO VERY MUCH FOR TAKING AN INTEREST IN THE PROJECTS OF THE MOLLUSC!

Kraken, Coffee & Cake

story:
Hi my name is Xavier, my stage name is "Xclusive" I'm 10 years old, I have been given an opportunity of a lifetime to audition for Sony Music a major recording company. I need your help in order to record my professional EP which is a four song demo and music video.  I am concerned with the message that other recording artist are sending to children my age.  I am being raised by my supportive parents Mr. & Mrs. Bates.

Education is very important to me, I maintain a straight A average in school. I rewarded my parents by studying hard  and staying out of trouble.  Music is a big part of the lives of kids my age. Most all of the music the kids listen to is negative, about selling drugs, or calling woman and young girls bad words.

I want to spread a positive message to other students and kids. Lots of my friends learned profanity from the records they listen to.  It doesn't have to be that way. Will you help me make a difference for children all over the United States? I take pride in being a young role model. I love to educate and mentor other kids with homework and help them in areas where they are struggling in school

Mr. June Walton and Mr. Youngblood my mentors stated:  "Its very rare for anyone, especially kids who are pre-occupied with their cell phones and  problems in life to make a decision to be a positive role models" It gets sad sometimes with all the bad news in the media and all the negativity around us. I just want to make someone happy.

What makes me happiest is knowing  the parents would be okay buying my music. Since I do not talk about drugs or gangs or anything negative.  It will give the kids a break from all the music that teaches them to be a part of gangs, do drugs and treat girls and women with no respect. I see this everyday at school, and you can help me change minds and attitudes. 

 I was told and I believe that you are never too young to be a role model.  I know everyone needs someone to help them with their dreams.

As a young person my parents told me I have choices, It is important to me to do something positive in the world. Instead of being in gangs or using drugs I have decided to do something positive with my life. This positive experience  will help carry me through a challenging life ahead. I can be strong in knowing that people believed in me. This experience will give me a chance to pay it forward in the lives of others kids who may feel alone or rejected. 

Well, I can't talk as much as the adults, so I am running out of words, choose a perk and please help me accomplish my dreams. Remember you are investing in the life of a child who is seeking to be a positive influence in our world. If for nothing else the fact that I am trying to do something positive is worth paying it forward in my life. I will always pay it forward for someone else thank you very much Xavier "Xclusive" Bates.

story:
This campaign is to raise funding for the initial publication of the first book in a series, and for recording and mastering of associated songs. it is a story coloringbook witn music to reitterate the message. 

Positive Encouraging Music and a Heartfelt 
Adventure to Increase Kids Self Esteem!

(Note of changes: the title has been changed to match the message of the book and the song "Trust What You Know" and it is a story coloring book, allowing create the color they want to!

The Books
“The Adventures of Positive Penni” is a series of books with adventures for Penni and her animal friends that will cover subjects like self-esteem, social interaction, negative/positive perception, quiet time, forgiveness, food, and more! Many positive lifestyle topics.These subjects are important to children in the target age group of 5-9.  To date, one book has been written and privately printed to get feedback and another book is in the story-blocking process to be submitted for publication with a company. 

I was able to do a public school reading for 3rd graders and when I asked how many had experienced what happened to Penni in the story, about half of the room raised their hands. This experience speaks to the need for this material. The teachers loved it too!

Process Page at the End of the Book

The stories create opportunities for kids to talk to about their personal experiences with their parents, and process through their feelings.  Parents can use the content and Miranda's special process page int he back to jumpstart family discussions about choices and family values. This can create skills in children to serve them a lifetime and create unforgettable memories between the parent and child. 

The Music

The music for Positive Penni, combined with the messages in the books, together are a driving force for the success of  the series to come.  Children just love the catchy tunes and words! 

The Singers and Production

Jessica Collins

CH Henry

Faith Dengate

The Positive Penni singers ages 9-12;  Faith Dengate, Jessica Collins and CH Henry are some of the children that will record the songs that Miranda Sullivan co-wrote. with other writers.  Miranda's songs that need to be recorded are: The Adventures of Positive Penni Theme song, and "Trust What You Know"  these 2 songs will be included with the book along with Laurie O"Shea's "Perfectly You."  (that has already been recorded) and then the other songs, "Keep On Believing In Me," "Find Your Own Voice" and "I Can Do It On My Own" will be offered later on, keeping a connection with the families. The recordings will take place at the Music Row's Parlor Studio. 

Positive Penni Is Already Making A Difference!

The songs and the book speak for themselves in touching the hearts of kids. The project isn't complete yet, but has already touched so many lives, both young and old.  Just think what it can do for thousands of kids once it's complete.  Over the creation of this project, I have not spoken with one parent who hasn't said “I love it, the kids need it, and I want a book!”


Faith Dengate's story.

Positive Penni is an avenue for kids to learn to care for themselves and process through their feelings. "I wish I would have had something like this when I was a kid, my life would have changed for the better." Miranda Sullivan

Faith Dengate's mother - Amy Dengate


Opportunity For Growth Through Public Performances 
and Community Involvment

Positive Penni is also offering it's singers opportunities to sing in the public. They have been invited to and will have shows at churches, Girl Scout of Middle TN meetings , family businesses, schools, and other opportunies that present themselves.  Go the www.positivepenni.com for their up and coming schedule. 

  • We are in the midst of getting approval for 10 Percent of the proceeds for this book will be given to the Girl Scouts of Middle TN.

 

About The Author Miranda Sullivan and The Inspiration Behind The Series

I have been a Professional Nanny for 8 years and now am a Certified Positive Discipline Educator, lyricist and author. I have worked for over 10 years with kids in capacities such as a nanny, motivational speaker, a coordinator for a Church Children's Choir, and a reading tutor for high-risk teens.

I came up with the idea for 'Positive Penni' because of a little girl I used to nanny. I remember her using the word "ugly" to describe a rainy day.  I told her it was a beautiful day in disguise because the rain was feeding the grass, flowers and trees.  A few days later, when it rained again, she called it 'a beautiful day'.  Like the character in my book, her focus was suddenly on the positive rather than the negative.

The creation of “The Adventures of Positive Penni” have been a gift. I truly believe that I was given this idea to fill a void that is needed for children ages 5-9. I would have loved to have something like this book series with music when I was a child. I guarantee it would have made a difference in how I viewed my world, made decisions, in my relationships at work, personal relationships and how I felt about myself.  How children view themselves makes all the difference in the experience they have in this life. 

Join The Positive Penni Team

The goal is to raise $5500 to cover the musical production and initial publication costs and the creation the EP, printing of books,and a promotional video. The financing will help get the project up and going.  I am also praying that we are able to go above and beyond the $5,500.  This extra money will be put to good use with advertising, additional book printing, and development of future books. 




Saved Save Saving...

story:
Yo les amis

  • Je gère actuellement la chaîne xRapGames sur Youtube avec énormément de passion. J'écris et fais des vidéos de rap sur des jeux-vidéos, des films, des séries et des mangas, parce que ça, j'aime !
  • Cette passion est vraiment importante pour moi, et avec l'ordi actuel, les capacités sont réduites pour développer mes créations à fond.
  • En m'aidant, je pourrais créer sans contraintes, sans que mon ordinateur actuel ne plante, ne me limite a si peu.

    Mes vidéos se tiennent, mais c'est grâce à l'aide que m'apportent plusieurs personnes superbes aux montages. Donc pour ces raisons, j'aimerai être indépendant.

Ce que je demande

  • Mettez même 2 euros je m'en fous ! Juste un petit coup de pouce pour m'aider :D 500 euros, ça serait un rêve.
  • Les contreparties seront nombreuses, selon mes envies mais d'abord les votres.
Si jamais vous avez pas envie de donner (ce que je trouve normal) hésitez pas à aller voir ma chaîne Youtube xRapGames !

story:
Calling all friends of the Junkshop Republic.

Get in on the music business BELOW the ground floor- Way under Down under In Australia

Picture yourself as a (list roles/gift levels) Groupie, Roadie, Tour Manager or, The Big Cheese

But you’ll never have to: pack a bag, sit in a plane for 18 hours be cavity searched on arrival

This kangaroo kickin’ appearance won’t be possible without you.

So, pledge what you can – and stay connected through Buddy’s annoying updates.

For the love of music – and Buddy.

Thank you. Gracias. NBL

story:
Short Summary


This is Moses Mo from the Funk Rock group Mother's Finest.  Some of you may know me as Gary Moore from Kettering, Ohio, others may call me "MO" or "Moses".  I began this journey fresh out of high school, no expectations, just wanting to play music for a living.  I met a couple playing in another band at a club across the street from a place where I played at and was asked to join them in Florida.  The rest became history.  My love for creating music grew along with my career.  Once comfortable as a guitarist, songwriting then grew into a passion, exploring what lyrics could do combined with music, one of my earliest compositions will be included as a bonus for this project performed by 3D Poet, a name I've given to a group of works I share with my daughter and her husband. 

Over time I've had the opportunity to write with many talented artists, most of the songs were co-written and recorded by Mother's Finest, but also recorded by the group Illusion (USA/Geffen/Universal), Caroline Aiken, Carl Carlton and The Songdogs, along the way I established a collections of songs, waiting to be recorded by someone and that someone turned out to be me.  I released a debut solo project entitled CARTOON YOU, these songs were my babies.  I began the process of becoming an independent artist and learned what so many had been doing for me along the way.  I became a producer, an engineer, a vocalist, and enlisted many of my friends with skills far greater than mine, to help me create my first solo endeavor.  I created a record company and became a publisher, distributor, and promoter of my songs.  I am pleased to announce the birth of another!

My family fully funded the debut project, this time, I am asking ALL OF YOU, to support this next step in the journey.  In the beginning it was just about the music, but I am now aware of how much that "music" costs just to get it to the people who want to listen and be a part of my experience.  By pre-ordering this new music project titled "2 TON MESSAGE", you become a part of the process.  The songs have already been recorded and mixed.  The next step is mastering and then, production of products, you decide what should be offered.  By helping to fund and promote this project, you are getting the first release of 2 TON MESSAGE, and anything else you would like to have as a contributing member at any level.

A successfully funded campaign will allow me to connect with others by doing what I love most and will help establish a tour of dates to perform the songs from CARTOON YOU and 2 TON MESSAGE.  Your support means EVERYTHING!  The industry will be watching, you can help get their attention and hear some great songs!  It takes a village to raise a baby! 

What We Need & What You Get

There's a lot of different facets to making a record.  I spent several years just writing the songs.  Sometimes beginning with a few notes, a few words, inspired often from the chaos in my own head.  I practice everyday, several hours at a time or for a few minutes whenever I can, sometimes on my travel, student size guitar, other times on an acoustic or electric guitar.  This practice then leads to organizing the parts into an original piece of music, I record these into a small recorder with a microphone, jot down some of the lyrics or open a session and begin with a drum track.  Each song may go thru many revisions before actually becoming a song I would like to group with others to make a project.  This is perhaps the longest part of the process. 

I've completed ALL the songs and ALL have been recorded, the next part is getting the mix.  The payoff of all that recording of the music.  Much like building a ratrod, all the nonessential parts are removed, and the polishing occurs.  I now have 8 out of 12 mixes ready for mastering.

This is where the funding begins:

Most of the musicians have agreed to be paid by tracks used.  This said, I used a bass player, a drummer, and myself.  There are special guests appearance throughout the project.  This cost is approximately $3600  ($100 X 12 X 3)

Mixing - this requires special equipment that I don't have in my home studio and an experienced, outstanding set of ears, the engineer.  This cost is approximately $1200  ($100 X 12)

Mastering - this is where all the peaks and valleys from track to track is balanced out so you hear one continuous piece from song to song without too much adjustment on the equipment you are using to listen back with.  Several different masters will be made, the one for downloads, CD/USB production, and vinyl.  This cost is approximately $800  (40 min. X $20 a minute)

Production of Product:  (Your reward for your contribution)

There are a variety of ways to supply listeners with music.  There are many distributors with offers to provide downloads, CDs, USBs, and Vinyl.  My idea is to offer the album art work and you decide the format you would like to receive the music. All packages will come with a full size album jacket just like in the old days. I think every band should use old school album jackets and we could hang them on the wall and enjoy!

Artwork is approximately $250 (Album sleeve, CD cover, brand logo)

Printing:

2 Panel, 12" Record Jacket - (min. quantity 200)  $5.47ea X 200 = $1094

Credit Card style USB - (100 - 2G card stock, 1 side with white housing)

$7.28 X 100 = $728

Digipak CD - (min. 1000) $1.65 X 1000 = $1650

12" 180gm Vinyl record (min. 300) = $2663

Promotional Items:

T-shirt (200) 5.35 X 200 = $1070

Posters (min. 300)  $198

Post Cards (min. 1000)  $95

Cover Art Stickers (100 min.)  $65

Postage and handling:

Domestic Priority Mail:  $5-20 (200+) = $1000+

International Priority Mail:  $25-50 (200+) = $5000+

it costs more to offer a package like this but I'm not through with album covers yet!i would love to have it the way I remember it and it was good!!

Unique perks:

Anyone funding the project $100 or more will also have their names added as super supporters of the project on All printed and social media.

Lead sheets and Lyrics - $50 per song

Studio Work: $500 - 4 hour session - guitar tracks by MosesMo  This can be done thru the internet through a secure file sharing site.  You can send your session and I'll add my tracks and return it to you for review. (Travel, Lodging, Hospitality extra for out of town sessions).

Song Demo - $1000  I'll create the tracks needed for your song . I'll use all my resources and come up with a cool track you will love.

Record Release Party - $1500  We'll use your venue to perform songs from 2 Ton Message and Cartoon You (standard venue contract, back line and sufficient PA, travel, lodging, hospitality extra)

VIP Executive Producer:  $2500 will have name, business, listed everywhere on everything made possible b/c you're an ANGEL!  Managers, Booking Agents, Venues, local businesses, etc.  A private special occasion will be planned to thank you for your support and will receive every perk offered.

Giving back - if we exceed our GOAL 10% will be donated to a charitable organization

Not making our goal means we have to take care of business first, the 12 songs will be mastered, copyright fees for published project will be paid, fees for website downloads will be paid, Album covers will be printed, CDs will be ordered, and rewards delivered to those who made the choice to support Independent Artists!  Man, I don't want to cross anything off but we'll have to cross that bridge when we get to it.

The Impact

I've been extremely fortunate and I'm deeply grateful for the life, experiences, and relationships that I've had.  Each day, I strive to be better than the day before .  I have a whole lot more to give but I need your support.  I'm asking you because you are the only ones who really make a difference.  You listen and decide.  My entire career has been an outstandingly awesome event, my loyalty, love, and respect for those I've worked with has taken me to great heights in my life.  This is something I am compelled to do, I've got a message, a 2 TON MESSAGE, that will be delivered but your support will make it happen that much quicker.  I'm OLDER and BOLDER, not afraid to try something new, I hope you won't be either!

Risks & Challenges

I promise to you, that I will give this project ALL that I have to give, to deliver to you a professionally AWESOME piece of me in the quickest time possible.  This project will go for 45 days, some may lose interest or simply forget but we have to remind them.  I will share music, moments, photos, and whatever else comes to me but I can't do this alone. That's why they call this CROWDFUNDING!  I need a CROWD for support of this project.   Tell your friends, family, co-workers, EVERYBODY, that Moses has a NEW MUSIC PROJECT of 10 uniquely original songs and that I'm letting supporters preview and be a part of the process!  Tell them to pre-order NOW and support an Independent Artist. This is the first time, on my own, no one else making the decisions, no one else directing, learning as I go.  This is an opportunity, not a RISK!  Let's make this happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

I'm not just asking for financial support, there are many ways to support this project, share the links, share the music, the photos, etc.  The internet has such connectivity!  On Facebook, share with friends, post links or photos, On Twitter?  I am, follow me and share the posts, links, and photos you find there, might even catch me in a conversation, let me know what you think about the songs!  Invite others to follow me!  Instagram, yea, share a photo of your perks and yes, the one you take with me!  Everyone supporting the project will have the chance to take a selfie with me.  That sounded odd but taking pictures are a wonderful way to show support!  YouTube, you betcha!  Write a blog, newsletter, articles for magazines?  Include a little something about the project, or just ask and we'll do an interview!  Help me get the word out.  If you've read this far, there is nothing else left but to use the Indiegogo share tools, make enough noise that people will have to listen, then, they can decide if they want to support the project and pre-order the CD or whatever format they want the music delivered to them as.  Let's do this! Let's keep the music coming!

Even if you can't contribute, there is something here for you.  We will be releasing videos and the tracks from the album on YouTube, just enjoy and tell your friends, that's the important thing!  We're trying to build an army of like minded funkrockers and you're invited!  MOSES
