story:
Short Summary

My name is Angel Luís Figueroa (Latin percussion, vocals, production), I’m Margarita Figueroa’s son. Chris James Scornaienchi (guitars, production) and I are largely responsible for producing my Mom’s songs. We had lots of help from George Black (guitars, tres, strings pad, audio engineer), Brian Hargrove (piano, Roy Hargrove's little brother), Nate Light (upright bass & arco bass string sections), Luis Eric Gonzalez (trumpet, horn arrangements), Peter Jacobson (cello), Irene Gregorio (introductions) and her friend Joo Lee (cello, violin), Lourdes Eve Mack (back ground vocals), Dave Hampton (audio engineer) and No'a Winter Lazerus (mastering).

"En Mi Canción" Audio Sample

The money you contribute to this campaign will pay for the recording studio, mixing engineer, musicians, mastering process, CD cover design, CD release party, CD duplication, instrument rental fees and the mugs we’ll be sending to our generous contributors. This project has been an amazing journey full of huge joy and great frustration, and getting through it all has indeed made me a much better person. Help a man repay his mom an incredible debt of gratitude for gifting his life with beautiful original music. Your contribution to this project is a testament of the profoundly inspiring and healing relationship between mother and child, a central aspect of being a moral sentient being. Thank you in advance for your consideration and here is our story...

Since I was a boy my Mom, Margarita Figueroa, would sing the most amazing songs to me and my siblings. Each morning a new song would fill the house, and her voice would raise us out of bed as she cooked our breakfast. We would always eat our food watching her prepare to go to work, never once thinking about the incredible sacrifice she was making for us.

On the weekends, she would sit by my side on my bed and sing a new song she had worked out that morning with her guitar. The whole time, I thought she was listening to records or the radio and watching TV to learn and practice all those great songs that she would play for us. So, I came to believe in discipline through total devotion and applied this philosophy to my training as a Latin percussionist, practicing up to 9 hours a day for long periods at a time.

One day I was asked to write a song by my friend Mikey Rivera for the La Juventúd Típica band in Chicago. He was an awesome bass player, and we were in this band together. At that time Mikey was the smartest guy I knew. I used to think it was because he went to Francis Parker High School for privileged kids on scholarship, but as I became a man, I realized he was just smart. So, not to disappoint him, I gave it a try.

When I told my Mom how hard it was for me to write a song, she told me that it wasn't hard at all. She told me to just explore what my heart is feeling and what my mind is thinking, and I'd have a song in no time. I smugly asked her how could she know that. She turned to me in her calm demeanor and said, "Toñito, I've been writing a new song every day since you were 3 years old. If I can do it having only gone to the 3rd grade, surely you can do it, being so intelligent." After picking my jaw up from the floor, I proceeded to try to prove that she couldn't have written ALL those songs, day in and day out, with no one to help or praise her! No, I thought, she can't possibly understand what I mean.

After checking every possible avenue of music, every library, every radio station for weeks on end, I couldn't find ANY of her songs. I began to exhibit symptoms of depression. Not because my Mom was more prolific than I could ever hope to be, but because I didn't believe her.  No one ever complimented her on her massive daily efforts. No one ever encouraged her to continue writing or to look for a record deal or a song publishing entity. Furthermore, because of her humility, she was never able to tell us that she was the one writing all those beautiful songs we would hear her sing and play every day. Something in me had changed. A seriousness for music and it's therapeutic power to heal us overcame me. 

We lived in Humboldt Park, Chicago -- a gang infested, punishing urban environment. Thinking back to all those times she made me feel better when I thought our world was ending just by singing a song that she was composing while singing it right then and there just for me and exactly for the difficult situation I had just described, I realized she literally saved most of our lives with her inspired original music. I say "most" because my little brother was killed at age 17.

So I wrote the song my friend Mikey requested, it was waxed and released on the Ebirac Records label. I grew up, went to college, moved away from Chicago to Los Angeles and pursued a music career as a Latin percussionist. I played and recorded with Mongo Santamaria, Herbie Hancock, Maxwell, Brian McKnight, Sting, Kenny Loggins, Vikki Carr, Billy Preston, The Pointer Sisters, Patti Austin, Biz Marquis, Mark Anthony, The Temptations, Jeffery Osborne, Ivan Neville, and many others...But never could I ever fathom writing a song or two every day, or composing as I played to heal someone's heart from hurting. And, with all due respect, none of the musicians I ever worked with did that either -- no matter how prolific, how famous or how much they're considered to be geniuses.

I decided to record my Mom's CD myself. I saved my tour money and built a recording studio, learned the process of audio production from George Black (an incredible producer in Los Angeles), Dave Hampton (an innovative audio engineer) and Shawn Rivera (an awesome vocalist of Az Yet fame). I began recording my Mom singing every time she came to visit me in Los Angeles (she now lives in Aurora, Illinois, just outside of Chicago). Once she arrived, I would throw these song parties where she would sing and make everyone cry. We would witness this time and again until it became a dare to see who would show up and attempt not to cry while she sang and played guitar. Those were incredible times.

Producing is kind of like Latin percussion in that it requires a skill set anchored in multiple disciplines. But despite that, I was REALLY bad at it, so I decided to co-produce any chance I got, and eventually came to produce on my own to better hone my skills. When several of the artists I produced told me they liked my production style I began work on this CD, checking in with George Black, Dave Hampton and Shawn Rivera and their infinite patience, knowledge and generosity to make sure I wasn't making any major mistakes.

And here we are. My Mom is an angel from heaven that I was lucky to have as my parents (she was both my Mom and my dad.) Now, through your generosity, her dream will finally be realized and we'll be better off for it. I say this with the utmost conviction that you will be touched by her voice, changed by her words and moved by her songs. You don’t even have to know Spanish to feel the grace and power of her voice and be forever transformed into believing that music is a sacred healing force for good. Who knows, perhaps you'll be inspired to write a song or two yourself.

played and recorded with Mongo Santamaria, Herbie Hancock, Maxwell, Brian
McKnight, Sting, Kenny Loggins, Vikki Carr, Billy Preston, The Pointer Sisters,
Patti Austin, Biz Marquis, Mark Anthony, The Temptations, Jeffery Osborne, Ivan
Neville, and many others...But never could I ever fathom writing a song or two
every day, or composing as I played to heal someone's heart from hurting. And,
with all due respect, none of the musicians I ever worked with did that either -- no
matter how prolific, how famous or how much they're considered to be geniuses.
I decided to record my Mom's CD myself. I saved my tour money and built a
recording studio, learned the process of audio production from George Black (an
incredible producer in Los Angeles), Dave Hampton (an innovative audio engineer) and Shawn Rivera (an awesome vocalist of Az Yet fame). I began recording my Mom singing every
time she came to visit me in Los Angeles (she now lives in Aurora, Illinois,
just outside of Chicago). Once she arrived, I would throw these song parties
where she would sing and make everyone cry. We would witness this time and
again until it became a dare to see who would show up and attempt not to cry
while she sang and played guitar. Those were incredible times.
Producing is kind of like Latin percussion in that it requires a skill set
anchored in multiple disciplines. But despite that, I was REALLY bad at it, so
I decided to co-produce any chance I got, and eventually came to produce on my
own to better hone my skills. When several of the artists I produced told me they liked my production
style I began work on this CD, checking in with George Black, Dave Hampton and Shawn Rivera and their infinite
patience, knowledge and generosity to make sure I wasn't making any major mistakes.

And here we are. My Mom is an angel from heaven that I was lucky to have as my parents (she was both my Mom and my dad.) Now, through your generosity,
her dream will finally be realized and we'll be better off for it. I say
this with the utmost conviction that you will be touched by her voice, changed by
her words and moved by her songs. You don’t even have to know Spanish to feel the
grace and power of her voice and be forever transformed into
believing that music is a sacred healing force for good. Who knows, perhaps you'll be inspired to write a song or two yourself.

story:
After recording with many bands over the years, I've decided it's time to record my own group's original compositions. The Brian Mesko Danktet features the amazing musicianship of bassist Dane Alderson, saxophonist Willis Greenstreet, and drummer Forrest Young. We have just begun the recording process with engineer Jake Dempsey at Summit Sound Studio. 

Anyone who has ever released a professional album understands the time commitment and expenses involved:
  • Musicians
  • Engineering/Production
  • Artwork
  • Replication
  • Merchandise
  • Advertising

By contributing to this campaign you will help create something beautiful and keep jazz alive. If you are unable to contribute financially, please consider posting my campaign through Indiegogo's "share" option. 

If you have chosen one of the perk packages, please give me one year from the end of this campaign to complete the album and mail those out. If we reach our goal of $5000, this deadline will be moved up!

Please check back for updates, photos, and clips from the recording sessions!


Thank you for your time and support!


PERSONAL BACKGROUND:  

In high school I studied Jazz Theory & Ensemble for college credit under Michael Carenbauer (who studied under Pat Metheny at Berklee) at the University of AR Little Rock. While completing a bachelor's degree in Recording Industry at Middle TN State, I lived in or near Nashville from 1997 - 2005 and played with such international jazz greats as Les McCann, Tony Monaco, Dr. Lonnie Smith, John Jorgensen and Jeff Coffin. I also worked with such talents as Roland Gresham, The Tao Jones, Sam Brooker, Greg Bryant, Chris West, Moe Denham, Nioshi Jackson and Charles Treadway.

After moving to central Virginia in 2005, I have been privileged to play with such artists as Robert Jospe, John D'earth, Bobby Read, Charles Owens, Jonah Kane-West, The Rootdowns, Lew Taylor, Graham Spice, Juliana Marques, The Nicholson Brothers, Liz Barnes, Ray Caddell, any many more. I have also shared the stage with blues legend Bob Margolin, Vegas staple Wayne Newton, and the DJ Williams Projekt. 
I currently live in Roanoke VA, performing music regionally and teaching at the Music Lab at Jefferson Center.

For more about me or any projects I'm currently involved with, check out www.brianmesko.com

story:
What's the Plan?

What’s the biggest obstacle to any unsigned, unmanaged band trying to tour? Money, 100% of the time. When someone’s trying to go to college but can’t afford it, what do they do? Apply for loans, scholarships, and other financial aid. However, no such thing exists for metal bands. In the spirit of Brian Shields, a man who always made it his priority to do whatever he could for bands, no matter how small, we’re aiming to set up, in his honor, essentially a “fund” for unsigned bands in the metal community.

With the support of heavyblogisheavy.com, if this crowd fund is successful, our goal is to be able to every year, starting in 2015, provide two bands each with an interest-free loan for $2,500, to get their music on the road.

After completion of the funding, eligible bands can submit directly to Heavy Blog is Heavy. A selection committee, comprised of members of some well-known and diverse bands in the metal community will pick the top 10 bands from the submissions. Those top 10 will then be voted upon by Heavy Blog readers, and the top two will win the $2,500 grants.

To keep this project self-sustaining, the bands would then be required to return the money to Heavy Blog by March 1st of the following year, after which we would accept submissions again, and continue to allow two bands to tour, year after year!

Selection Committee, 2015:

John Matos (Abiotic)
Sacha Dunable (Intronaut)
Zach Dresher (Wings Denied)
Eli Whitehead (Enfold Darkness)
Dan Weiten (The Omega Experiment)
Kyle Gaddo (Heavy Blog Is Heavy)
Jordan Eberhardt (The Contortionist)
Michael Rumple (Lorelei)
Marty DePietro (Fivebyfive Records)
TBD

Why are you taking my money?

Goal- $6,500 USD
Breakdown:
  • $5,000- to be used towards the grants. Two bands will each win amounts of $2,500.
  • $1,500- Perk fulfillment. 

Stretch Goals:

  • $9,000 USD- We'll add a third band!
  • $12,000 USD- And a fourth band!

Why is this a good idea?

  • Because touring is expensive! A typical three-week DIY tour can end up costing over a thousand dollars in gas expenses alone. Food expenses, between five people, even eating on $10-15 per day, can easily amount to around a thousand total as well. Not to mention the costs we all know, of pressing merch, purchasing quality gear, and maintaining/renting a van.

  • Because most importantly, we are a community, and this matters. Every single one of us writes or appreciates music, and this in turn makes us appreciate each other. The rest of society may not understand why we prefer a blast-beat or a breakdown to what's typically on the radio, but we do. We appreciate each other, we create art, and always want to help our friends. Many of us have hosted touring bands or bought them a drink, and all of us have gone to a show, with the hopes of meeting one of these people we admire. We're always willing to pay a few dollars for a Bandcamp album we particularly like, even if it's free. But by letting a band tour, we can take that support even further, and honestly make a difference in the world and community we've created.

What do these shirts look like?

We're glad you asked. We've commissioned designer Mike Graziano, to create the following shirts:

"Dabs in Heaven:"

And, "This Shirt Helped a Band Tour"


    I'm Broke. What can I do?

    • Help share this crowdfund! Every voice can reach a new donor.
    • Go to your local DIY show! Every dollar that goes towards an unsigned band on tour is a dollar well spent. 

    I claimed a perk, and I have questions?

    • IF THE PERK YOU HAVE CLAIMED ISN'T SHOWING UP ON THE SIDE ANYMORE: Don't worry, we've got it. Indiegogo only lets us show 20 at a time, and we've had some pretty generous people that have offered things to this campaign. Everyone who selected a perk that has sold out (Contortionist shirts, posters, and Eli's guest solos) will receive that perk.
    • If you have selected ANY sort of shirt option, you will receive an email AFTER the completion of the crowdfunding, where we'll get your shirt size, and confirm the shipping address.
    • If you have selected a guest solo/lesson, upon completion of the crowdfund, we will put you directly in touch with the person you have claimed the perk from, and at that point, it is your responsibility to set up the particulars for the lessons/solo.

    Thanks again!

story:
Our Story! 

Los Gatos Negros are Sayulita, Mexico's only Mexi-Punk n' Roll band! We are a family driven, local band that is community and Rock minded! We all come from diverse backgrounds and countries, but Rock n' Roll has brought us together. 

Los Gatos somos un grupo como ningun otro, Mexi-punk Rock, con un corazon para nuestro pueblo y pais! 

We have been playing live for 4 years now, and unfortunately have lost much of our key equipment. We want to keep playing live and brining our brand of Mexi-punk to Sayulita. With your help, we can buy a new PA, keep making music and shaking up the town throughout the year! 

  • We know that many of you love to come to Gatos show, and we love you for that! Hopefully you can help us keep rocking and showing the town a good time! 
  • Sabemos que los encanta los shows Gatos, si los ayudan podemos seguir rockeando!! 

What We Need & What You Get - Que necesitamos, y que les damos! 

We need $1000usd for a new PA, monitors and mixer. Its that simple. With this, we can keep playing  and showing Sayulita a good time! Our next show is March 28th, and we need help to play it! 

Necesitamos $1000usd para nuevo PA, monitores, y mixer. Es tan Facil, con esto rockeamos! 

As fans of Los Gatos, contribute $50usd (or more we hope!) and get a one of a kind Gatos shirt! 

Si Dan $50usd = $600p o mas si pueden, les damos una playera commemertiva especial para ti! 

Even if we don't reach our main goal, we will keep trying to save us and get the equipment, but with your help, we can start practicing again and play soon! 

Why?

We believe in Rock n' Roll, and truly know one night of music can change your life. Help us change some lives, one broken eardrum at a time! 

Viva Rock n' Roll Sayulero! 

You can help us by sharing this! Sayulita Music is the lifeblood, and punk rock is the vein! Thank you!!

story:
The story behind Matthew: requiem of man
There are events in the world that grab our attention & become indelible. Some are joyful; some are monumental; some are historical; and some are abhorrent. One of the latter occurred October 6, 1998. A young man was tied to a fencepost, brutally beaten, and left to die on a lonely slope of land overlooking Laramie, Wyoming, guarded by a brilliant star-ﬁlled sky and a watchful doe, solely because of who he was.  

Matthew Shephard's death affected individuals in different ways. Yes, some encouraged more hatred but even more people were made aware of how much animosity there is in the world and they decided it time to do something. This piece, Matthew: requiem of man, is a testament to his life and the lives of those who want to take action and speak through music.

We Need Your Help

The North Shore Opera Hour is a non-profit organization established focusing on producing superior quality, entertaining, and educational musical productions throughout the year that provide opportunities for artistic expression, creative development, and the growth of theatrical talent and experience. 

Arts organizations make very little money on ticket sales. Most of the funding for arts organizations comes from a combination of individual giving, corporate giving, foundations, endowments, and government funded grants. We hope you will believe in what we want to achieve and will contribute as generously as you can.  The North Shore Opera Hour and composer Floyd Thompson and Lyricist J. Michael Ireland hope you will find this musical homage to Matthew Shephard one that you will believe in and support.  At its base we are actually grieving of ourselves. We all have loss; we need to deal with it. Hopefully, Matthew: requiem of man will play some small part in easing our pain & sorrow.

What you will get:
Our perks are listed on the right hand side of the page. You'll also get our undying gratitude, which we hope counts for a lot, and a feeling that you are making a difference. Your contribution, however big or small, helps us tremendously! You're also helping to keep the performing arts alive. 

Where the money goes:

  • Singers
  • Pianist
  • Instrumentalists
  • Performance Space Rental
  • Recording and Sound Engineering of CDs and DVDs
  • Reception

  • Printing of postcards, programs, posters and scores

Other ways you can help:

  • Come and see the debut of this musical work on Sunday, May 17 at 3 PM at Immaculate Heart of Mary Church, 3834 N. Spaulding, Chicago, 60618. Admission is FREE
  • Share this link with others 
  • Like us on Facebook - 
    https://www.facebook.com/events/141506160880828
    https://www.facebook.com/pages/North-Shore-Oper...
  • Follow us on Twitter - https://twitter.com/NorthShoreOpera
  • Visit our website at http://www.northshoreoperahour.com
  • Help us spread the word!
The Impact:
There have been many tributes created for Matthew Shepard to expand awareness, from a well-known play, The Laramie Project to the Matthew Shepard Foundation: embracing diversity. All are meant to not only keep his memory alive but also the legacy of the ﬁght to stop more violence. This piece, Matthew: requiem of man, is an opportunity for you to literally have a voice in your support of respecting life and all individuals; how we deal with our grief; and how fragile our lives really are.  Your donation is appreciated.

story:
(Scroll down for English)

--

Bu kampanyaya bağış yaparak sadece bir kişiye değil, 36 yetenekli gençten oluşan koromuzun tümüne destek olmuş olacaksınız...

Biz kimiz?

Biz Rezonans, 36 genç ve dinamik koristten oluşan kadromuzla, a capella koro müziği üzerine odaklanıyoruz. 2010 yılındaki ilk provamızdan itibaren sahnemizi başta Grammy® ödüllü besteci & şef Eric Whitacre olmak üzere, dünyaca ünlü birçok isimle paylaşma fırsatı yakaladık.

Europa Cantat nedir?

Europa Cantat, dünyanın en büyük koro festivallerinden biridir. Festival her üç yılda bir Avrupa'nın başka bir ülkesinde düzenleniyor. Bu yılki festival Macaristan'ın Pécs kentinde 24 Temmuz - 2 Ağustos 2015 tarihleri arasında gerçekleşecek.

Rezonans, Europa Cantat Festivali'ne Türkiye'yi temsilen katılan ilk koro olacak. Tüm dünyadan 3.000'i aşkın koro aşığıyla buluşacak olmanın heyecanını yaşıyoruz.

Bize nasıl yardım edebilirsiniz?

"Contribute Now" bağlantısına tıklayarak genç üyelerimizin festivale katılım masraflarını karşılamamıza yardımcı olun. Her bağış bu toprakların müziğini Avrupa'nın müzik dünyasıyla paylaşma hayalimize bizi bir adım daha yaklaştıracak.

--

By donating to this campaign, you will support not a single person, but our whole choir consisting of 36 talented young singers.

Who are we?

Rezonans is a Turkish choir made up of 36 young and enthusiastic singers that focuses on a cappella music. In the four and a half years since our first rehearsal in 2010, we have had the privilege of sharing the stage with world-renowned conductors, including the Grammy® Award-winning composer and conductor Eric Whitacre.

What is Europa Cantat?

Europa Cantat is one of the biggest international choral festivals in the world. The festival is organized once every three years in a different country. This year it will be held in Pécs, Hungary between July 24 and August 2, 2015.

We are very excited about Rezonans being the first choir from Turkey attending this musical event, which brings together more than 3.000 singers from across the world.

How can you help?

By clicking on the "Contribute Now" button you help us cover our participation expenses. Any donation you make will support us in our effort to share our music with music lovers in Europe.

made up of 36 young and enthusiastic singers that focuses on a cappella music. In the four and a half years since
our first rehearsal in 2010, we have had the privilege of sharing the stage
with world-renowned conductors, including the Grammy® Award-winning composer and conductor Eric Whitacre.


What is
Europa Cantat?

Europa Cantat is one of the biggest international choral
festivals in the world. The festival is organized once every three years in a
different country. This year it will be held in Pécs, Hungary between July 24 and August 2, 2015.
We are very excited about Rezonans being the
first choir from Turkey attending this musical event, which brings together more than
3.000 singers from across the world. 
How can you help?
By clicking on the "Contribute Now" button you help us cover
our participation expenses. Any donation you make will support us in our effort
to share our music with music lovers in Europe.

story:
¡Hola!

Me llamo Anamari, vivo en Santurtzi, Bizkaia (España). 

Amo a Dios y amo la música, la música es parte fundamental de la adoración a Dios en la Iglesia y Dios ha querido en su misericordia que yo pueda servirle con la Alabanza y la Adoración. En todos estos años, con una simple guitarra, Dios me ha dado muchas canciones que han sido de gran bendición en su Iglesia. 

Empecé a componer con solo 15 años y hasta el día de hoy Dios sigue siendo fiel y sigue dándome canciones, que nacen estando en su presencia y en comunión con su Espíritu Santo.

¿Por qué quiero grabar un disco de alabanza?

¡Ha llegado el momento de compartir ese don con todos vosotros! Mi humilde anhelo siempre ha sido haceros participes de este llamado y que su bendición se extienda y pueda sobrepasar el ámbito de nuestra iglesia local y nuestra pequeña zona de influencia.

Que este proyecto sea una herramienta al servicio del pueblo de Dios en España, para que otros puedan adorarle y ser bendecidos por Él como nosotros.

Es una respuesta a tantos hermanos y amigos que siempre han insistido y me han animado:

      —Ana, ¡tienes que grabar un disco con tus canciones!

¿Por qué ahora?

En febrero de 2015 conocimos a Ana Mary Baizán y David Neutel, líderes de alabanza en una de las iglesias más grandes de Lisboa. David es productor musical con mucha experiencia y, después de visitar su estudio en marzo, vimos claro que es con el con quien debíamos realizarlo.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Necesitamos 4000$ para cubrir una gran parte de estos gastos:

  • El trabajo del productor musical.
  • Los músicos de estudio.
  • El diseño gráfico, impresión y duplicación del disco físico.
  • Los viajes a Lisboa para la grabación de las voces.

Esta web está pensada para que puedas ayudarme en la financiación del proyecto y con tu aportación podrás recibir lo que llaman una "recompensa" que puede ser:

  • Descarga de una de las canciones.
  • Descarga completa del disco.
  • Un disco físico.
  • Una visita a tu iglesia ¡con concierto de alabanza incluido!

A la derecha de esta página puedes ver más información acerca de esto. También se puede contribuir libremente sin recompensa pero siempre con mi más sincera gratitud.

El presupuesto y las aportaciones son en Dólares ($) porque así permiten el pago mediante tarjeta de crédito y PayPal. Haciéndolo en Euros (€) solo es posible mediante PayPal. De todas formas esto no es problema, ya que el sistema hace la conversión y el cargo en vuestra cuenta será  realizado en euros. En Abril colaboré con un proyecto de Josh Brister con 20$ y cargaron en mi cuenta 19,10€

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Sé que algunos de vosotros no podéis colaborar económicamente, pero eso no significa que no puedas ayudar:

  • Ora por mi, intercede para que el Espíritu Santo ponga su mano en cada nota, en cada acorde, en cada músico...
  • Difunde este proyecto con tus amigos de Facebook, Twitter y contactos de correo.
  • Puedes usar las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.

story:
I’m sitting here in my room…

Bored out of my mind, and just thinking. I know that it was important for me to come back to Michigan. Why was it important? 

  I’ll answer that question now. First let me start by saying it was never my intention to move back to Michigan ever again in my life. When I left Houston, Tx, I was in a bad place mentally. After first going through heart ache and still living with the person who tore my heart and soul to pieces. I was already pretty unstable mentally. I was ready to give up on life. I didn’t know how much more I could handle, after everything I had already been through in my life. Six months of heart break, cutting and uncontrolled drinking and pot smoking went by …

  July 27, 2010 I was 2 hours away from going home on my first day at a new job. My cell phone started going crazy with text messages and my facebook was also lit up with messages and comments to contact almost every person I am related to back in Michigan. As I stated it was my first day back to work after being without a job for almost 3 months. So, I was trying to get my life back together. Back to the text messages and facebook messages I was receiving to contact my family in Michigan.  No one wanted to tell me through a text message or a facebook message what was going on. I called my Aunt Patti to find out everything, thats when my world completely crumbled. She told me they weren’t sure, but that my cousin had seen on the news that a 50 year old woman was found murdered in my moms home. My mom was 50, the only woman that lived in that home. So i did what most people would do, and i started searching the internet for stories about what had happened. I knew it was her, but still had some hope that it wasn’t. When I found a posting on a local Flint, Mich. news website, it included a photo of my moms house. Not a picture of her, not her name… but that is when I knew. My mom was gone. I lost it. I cried… and cried and cried. I got into my car and drove to the first person I knew I could count on to be there for me. My ex Jennifer. I cried as I drove to her job. Screaming and yelling at other drivers, speeding like a bat out of hell. When I arrived at her job, i waited in the car for her to come out. When she came out… I ran into her arms and collapsed. 

I never thought I would lose my mother that way. I never though a lot of things. I never knew that my mom had an addiction to crack cocaine. I was so caught up in my heart being broken that I lost all connection with my family. I was so caught up in the love I though I had that I forgot about what should have been more important to me. 

My mother and I always had a very rocky relationship, but I loved her more then anything. She is my mother, how could I not love her. She gave up a lot for me. Regardless of all the pain I had locked up inside from her going to prison, I still loved her very much. Regardless of the ridiculous arguments we had, and the months we would go without speaking to each other, she was still my biggest fan. No matter what wrong I had done in my life she was always there for me and I for her. 

I flew to Michigan the day after finding out my mom was murdered. It was all so surreal. I felt like I was in my own episode of the first 48 or some other reality murder investigation show. As soon as I got off the plane, I saw my dad and wanted to cry. But I held it together. I promised myself that I wouldn’t lose it, I would keep my shit together and stay strong. I promised myself I wouldn’t let anyone see me cry or seem weak. And that is exactly what I did. 

When I went to my moms house to meet detectives and clean it out, I didn’t want to go in. I didn’t want to see my mothers murder scene. Everyone that came with me: my dad, his wife, Aunt Sandy, Aunt Katie, Aunt Toni and Uncle Ted, they all told me I had to go in. I had to tell them what I wanted to take and what I didn’t. They got me to go into the house, I wish I never had done that. The images still stick in my mind. To see my mothers home in shambles, dirty and disorganized. It was so crazy to me. She was such a clean person, OCD practically. She was always cleaning, everything was always spotless. To see her mattress on the front lawn, soaked in her blood,  her blood splattered on the walls in the bedroom from the two shots fired into her head. To find crack pipe upon crack pipe in drawer upon drawer and shuffling through a mess I never thought my mom would make, was like being in a movie. This is stuff you see in movies right? 

I planned her memorial service and had her buried with my grandmother. I knew that is what she would have wanted. Through it all I didn’t break, I kept my composure. I didn’t cry, I didn’t show weakness and I held it together. I couldn’t let my family see me break. After two weeks of being in Michigan with my family I was ready to go home, to get back to my life and try to recover from everything had happened. Once I got home, I went back to drinking and smoking pot just to keep from feeling the pain I had inside. I just wanted to be numb. I would spend days in my room… sleepless and crying. I would go out nights and drink and smoke and drink and smoke. Anything to feel numb… I didn’t want to feel anything at all. I just wanted to die. One night I found a bottle of Vicodin of my Ex-Girlfriends in the apartment we both still lived in. I decided this was it. This was the time for me to end it all. No more pain, no more drinking and smoking pot to feel numb. No more. I was done living. I was done. I grabbed the first alcoholic beverage I could find, I don’t remember now what it was. And one pill at a time I took with a shot of liquor. Locked in my bathroom I took pill after pill. Waiting for it all to end. I sat on the bathroom floor, thinking about all the good I had in my life before. I had found love and lost love although dysfunctional I had a good family. I was ready to say good-bye. I grabbed the pen and paper i had on the counter and as I sat on the floor in a numb haze, I wrote. 

  I am not sorry. I wanted it this way. I can’t deal with life anymore. Don’t cry for me, I am not worth anyone’s tears. 

    Love, 

    Nebula

I remember laying on the floor the room spinning and everything looking blurry, fading in and out of consciousness. I laid there and waited for my end as My ipod played music in the background. I felt that the end was coming closer and closer. Then this song came on by Framing Hanley called Hear me Now. I listened to the words… and something in me made me get up off the floor. I sat in front of the toilet as I heard the words “Now my body’s on the floor and I am calling, Well I’m Calling out to you, Can you hear me now?” 

  I shoved my finger down my throat, and forced the poison out of me. I forced myself to keep on living. 

  Not long after I attempted to take my life, I decided I needed to go home. I needed to be with my family, and to be with people that Love me. I had nothing left in Houston. I had nothing. I needed to get myself back… re-identify myself. I needed to get “Nebula” back. So, I packed up my car with what ever I could fit, sold the belongings that didn’t and as my apartment slowly became empty I cried. I knew this was the end of what I thought was the life I wanted for myself. This was good-bye to what I had come to love and a real final good-bye to the breaker of my heart. 

 Now… Here I am in Michigan. Miserably cold and constantly bored. But I have grown. Thankful for everyday I have on this earth and thankful for that song. Thankful to a song that kept me wanting to live. I have completely re-identified, happier now then I have ever been. Granted, I miss my mother more then anything. And I know she watches me, making sure I’m not fucking up. Making sure I’m not numbing myself anymore. I have so much to be thankful for and so much to live for. I am blessed for everyday I have and I work hard to fulfill my every dream, no matter what it takes.

story: I'm trying to raise the money to start a tour of the Uk, which can hopefully happen worldwide, get equipment to record better quality music and to write with Jesse Lawson!
story_txt: I'm trying to raise the money to start a tour of the Uk, which can hopefully happen worldwide, get equipment to record better quality music and to write with Jesse Lawson!

story:
Count Indigo returns to make his first record in a decade.

Queens Ransom will be  a four track E.P. of sunburned Yachtpop, marking the Loungecore legend's long awaited return to the studio.

Queens Ransom is seeking your support against the backdrop of the Count's kidnapping of Elizabeth II on the eve of her becoming the longest reigning monarch in these islands on 9th September 2015. Which quite coincidentally, is our final release date for Queens Ransom to the public.

How much will you pay to get her back? 
Or will you give, to keep her away permanently? While Queens Ransom takes the legacy of The Pistols in '77  to a contemporary dancefloor conclusion. 

I'm best known for leading the renaissance of easy listening through my club Indigo at Madame JoJo's where I put on shows  by world famous figures such as Burt Bacharach, Tony Bennett and Herb Alpert. As well as discovering great entertainers like The Mike Flowers Pops and Armstrong & Miller.
My first single My Unknown Love is a minor classic of an amnesiac love affair and my album Homme Fatale featured the hypnotic, dystopian single Trinity.

Since then I've had very little to say musically and therefore kept schtum for ten years until this idea to detonate a Royal Slow Disco Lovebomb grew and grew til I had to realise it.
We need to raise £12,500 to produce an immaculate, soft slowdisco ode to kidnapping of the head of The House of Windsor. 
£7800 musicians, studios & mixing.
£520 mastering & cutting.
£2000 design, pressing, manufacture & printing.
£2180 marketing.

Players will include:

Kenny Clayton 
Pianist & arranger former M.D. to Shirley Bassey & Petula Clark. 

Dale Davis 
Bassist former M.D. to Amy Winehouse.

Francesco Lo Castro  
Composer & guitarist with Patrizio Buanne.

Sarah Tobias 
Saxophonist & flautist with Dennis Bovell.

Alex Gray 
Programmer & arranger, songwriter with LadyHawke.

Bertrand Burgalat 
Producer, film composer & founder of Tricatel Records.

Patricia Hammond 
Mezzo- Soprano soloist Orchestra of the Age of Enlightenment

If we don't make the full target, the record will still be produced as I will enter a co -production with a medium sized label to access marketing and distribution services. Much of the production budget is targeted at producing a contemporary sound to keep H.M. cosy in the safe house whilst retaining some familiar Twentieth Century warmth. With this in mind I'm teaming up with the superb and detailed mastering of Gearbox Records in north London.
If you're not able to make a financial contribution please share the www.countindigo.net link and help spread the word. 
I'll be keeping you in very regular touch with how the kidnap is going and what you can do to save H.M. and get the project afloat.
With your help, one recording can revitalise 2015's turgid notions of Britishness into something far more dangerous, danceable and fun!
Be lovely, H.M.is depending on it.
Cordial regards,
The Count.

story:
Who are we and what are we doing here?

We are Wood and Volk and there are four of us, all originating from the city of Samara in Russia: 
  • Sergey Saprykin (keyboards)
  • Aleksandr Bolshakov (electric guitar)
  • Nikita Tronin (drums)
  • Denis Romanov (vocals and guitar) 
The beginning of Wood and Volk dates back to '11 when Sergey and Denis started their first collaborative experiments. In January '13 Alexander joined them, the songs began to form and elaborate, 6 of which were included into the first EP "Behold" self-released in Winter '14. Later in spring, Nikita joined in as a drummer. We had the best time playing like this for half a year, rehearsing, performing, writing new stuff. In September '14, Denis left for Toronto and the band carried on in two different places.

Now, we feel it's important to bring to life the things we'd been working on together for the past 1.5 years and separately after that, so that they don't get dusty in the closet and outdate not knowing the light of day. We need to share our music with you. Otherwise, what's the point of it? 

Tentatively saying, there are going to be about 14 songs, coherent thematically and musically, like a concept album but not quite. Sometimes genre-tagging really lays restraint to music but just for convenience we'll call our stuff "alternative folk". It's not folk proper but has an electric, loud and expressive side to it; the songs are often based on contrast and also aren't too polished leaving space for spontaneity and improvisation. To get a glimpse, you can listen to "Behold" on our https://woodandvolk.bandcamp.com/  website, though the overall mood and arrangement on the LP will differ largely.

We know, it is going to be our first major recording experience, somewhat stressful, but we need to go through it. Your support will encourage and make us do our best. For each of us is a student, this will be the only possible way to release our music.



What's it about?

The sum we are seeking is 800 CAD. It might seem low but this is due to the fact that we are going to record in Samara where fees aren't as high as in Europe or Canada. This is the very minimum needed to rent a rehearsal space (10$/2 hours), rent a studio and hire an engineer to record, mix and master (10$/1 hour), and rent extra equipment, including some musical instruments which we do not own (e.g. xylophone and other percussion instruments). 

800 CAD is going to be enough for the process but this is not sufficient for printing the album, that is why we are not planning on any print out. Yet, we will hand make and print ourselves about 2 dozens of copies as perks for our supporters. Our main objective is to keep in touch and establish a contact with our listeners, so all our perks will be personal and interactive, like posters, videopostcards from recording sessions, or even a performance ( the perks are placed on the right-hand side of the project page). By the way, please, at any time feel free to write us a few lines regarding the music or whatever else; we'd be happy to communicate!


Possible Pitfalls on the Way

In case we don't reach $800 but the sum is somewhere close, we'll use the money and record nevertheless, although with even less expenses. If the sum is far from being enough, we'll try to make amends by recording a shorter version of the album or an EP. Unfortunately, we have only one month on our hands, this long Denis is going to be in Samara. But we are feeling confident and full of hope.

Final Note

Every little bit, every response is motivational and encouraging. Every post or telling to your friends and relatives (it's very easy by pressing the buttons to your left on screen) is as valuable as monetary contribution. With your help, we'll be able to enrich (hopefully not litter) the universe with a thing that's not yet existent - the first Wood and Volk LP.

Thank you everyone!

And for the dessert, a few items from the forethought tracklist:
  • Earth
  • N.D.
  • White Church Hill
  • Which of Us
  • Time Being Age Limit
  • Full Moon Tide
Links to listen to our music and follow us:
https://woodandvolk.bandcamp.com/ - Our bandcamp page with our 2014 "Behold" EP 
http://vk.com/wdnvlk - Our Vkontakte (Russian social network) page
https://www.facebook.com/woodandvolk - Facebook
https://soundcloud.com/woodandvolk - Soundcloud
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWiSEHZEP4fiAM... - YouTube (sorry about the messed up name of the channel)

story:
"You want to be America's next sex symbol

Put your body on the table we'll all dig in

You'll be the world's biggest star through a high speed cable

Sign the dotted line and let the fun begin!"

And so the song begins....... telling a story of coming to California to become famous, only to find yourself at a casting call like no other!


WHO ARE WE?

We are FERAL VINCA, an LA based Alternative Rock band that has created a buzz with our wild and energetic stage shows. Our audience is filled with hot, fun, free spirited people who like to jump on stage with us and become part of the show!


WHAT IS THE VIDEO ALL ABOUT?

Our newly rerecorded single, "Sex Symbol" tells a true story about an aspiring actress who moves to Los Angeles to become a STAR! Falling behind on her bills, she soon finds herself doing WHATEVER it takes and becomes a star in a much different light than what she had imagined.

Feral Vinca has teamed up with Grammy Nominated music video director, K.C. Amos. The music video for "Sex Symbol" will feature several adult film stars and will be shot in 4K.  Our high quality video will be erotic, yet YouTube friendly.


WHERE WILL YOUR MONEY GO?

Your contribution will go towards the Director's fee, camera and equipment rentals, location, crew members, craft services, make up artists, wardrobe, talent fees, editing, and reproduction.


We have had this concept for a long time, and have tried to fund it on our own, but the reality is, in order to produce this properly, the budget is beyond our reach. With your help, we will be able to produce a high quality and wildly entertaining music video! Thank you so much!

Love, Sloane
FERAL VINCA

story:
Short Summary

Hi, everybody. I am Carol Mossa, a 60-year-old author and adventurer from East Greenwich, Rhode Island. My forthcoming book, Linger Longer: Lessons from a Contemplative Life, (Brown Books Publishing Group), is the result of a 30-day, solo, cross-country trip that I took last October. Armed with my camera, a few changes of clothes, and a dream to see the United States through a contemplative lens, I traveled 9500 miles, slept in nineteen different Airbnb properties, and found vast storehouses of courage and creativity that changed the way I occupy the world daily. My journey captured the hearts and minds of people nationwide as I photographed, blogged, and videotaped my way across the country and back (social media is a wonderful thing). Women asked me publicly and privately, "How did you become so fearless?" All I can say is, "I became fearless by practicing fear less." This summer I am hitting the open road again, and I am offering women artists, writers, poets, photographers, musicians---seekers---a chance to cast aside fear, excuses, and trepidation. Ladies, hitch your stars to MY WAGON. I purchased a new 2014 Ford Transit Connect wagon which seats seven passengers including myself. I will leave the East Coast on, or about, June 26 and return on, or about, September 30. My itinerary is loosely planned, but I anticipate traveling at least 13,000 miles, coast-to-coast, door-to-door. Join me. Let me show you how to travel with less baggage, expectations, and preconceived notions. Come explore. Bring your paints, your camera, your pens and paper, your desire to experience spontaneity, and to linger longer over things that matter today and every day. Bring your heart. I promise to take good care of it. 

http://www.providencejournal.com/article/201410...

http://therevelationproject.me/2015/03/27/revis…

http://www.blogtalkradio.com/the-voice-of-leade...

What I Need & What You Get

Last September Earth's School Of Love and I launched a campaign here that netted a community of over 60 donors and a few thousand dollars. Expenses for that 30-day crossing came in just one hundred dollars over budget! I traveled on a shoestring, staying in Airbnb homes, ranches, and farms. (Once, I massaged an owner's horses in exchange for lodging.) I made sandwiches and salads and ate at roadside picnic areas. This year, I am seeking donors willing to sponsor a more ambitious 13,000 mile crossing at $1.00 per mile. The perks I am offering are generous, relevant and highly prized. From journals, to my original greeting cards, to autographed copies of my new book, Linger Longer: Lessons from a Contemplative Life, to days and nights on the road with me, Earth's School Of Love's summer tour is bound to be impactful, insightful, and full of women brimming with the pent-up desire to practice fearlessness. I am delighted to be an agent for that change!

The Impact

The woman I have become, the creative risks and challenges I have taken as a result of that first crossing, all lead me to believe that there are other women out there, just like me, hungry for exploration, full of creativity and desire, all just itching for a chance to be in the world at large, in a safe, nurturing, awe-inspiring environment. The women that return from this outing will be more in touch with their authentic selves and therefore, more intuitive citizens and occupants of this planet. This is a sober, non-smoking venture. 

Risks & Challenges

Need more information before you can support this venture? Talk to me. My phone number is 401-741-1974. My email is carmossa@aol.com. I am happy and eager to engage in meaningful conversations. Herbert Spencer wrote, "There is a principle which is a bar against all information, which is proof against all arguments and which cannot fail to keep a man in everlasting ignorance---that principle is contempt prior to investigation." Investigate. Please.

Other Ways You Can Help

Earth's School Of Love has nearly 12,000 followers on fb.com/EarthsSchoolOfLove. Twice each day, upon rising, and before retiring at night, I post at least four original inspirational images and verses. These daily messages of hope, love, and abundance resonate with people globally. If I never sold another greeting card or book, I would continue to generate these works of art, these blasts of hope, love, and abundance that help heal the planet: one thought at a time. Donate, if you can, if you believe. At the very least, I hope you will share my work. Thank you all!

story:
In a short time, Black Suit Devil has become a well known figure in Toronto's music scene. Andy has been in various projects since the age of thirteen, ranging from metal to blues. Last year living in the beaches he was inspired to write for a solo acoustic project that had long been in the workings. Writing songs down by the water, playing by candlelight, he penned more than a few songs for his upcoming album. Drawing on blues, soul, indie and southern rock influences, all the songs are inspired by events and political/social issues important to him. The soulful melodies and thought provoking lyrics are powerful and emotional.

The funding requested would pay for the recording, advertising and production of this highly anticipated album and make it possible for Andy to share his music with the world. 

There will be many guest artists on the album, some well known in the Toronto music scene.

You can hear Black Suit Devil perform some of these songs in more YouTube videos or, like the Facebook page for upcoming live shows in your area plus more updates. 

If the goal is not reached, 100% of funding will still go towards the recording and production of the album.

Thank you so much for helping to make my dream a reality.

Peace and Love,

Black Suit Devil

story:
Can Music Help Change The World?

Back in the 60's and into the 70's "Love" rose to the surface for a short period and music was a central part of that sense of unity. My intent is to create meaningful music that can help to inspire a new sense of unity!

The Nature of My Music

My music is spiritually but not religiously based. I was raised as a Christian and respect that and all religions but have chosen a different path to God. I believe spirituality is an organic personal experience while religion was created as  organized groups. I believe God has room for all of us in His house!


What I Am Asking of You

I am in need of your financial assistance to promote my new self produced CD, Love of My Life and the Izzy James Project at large. I am "all in" in terms of my commitment to this project which is part of a much larger project to transform our world!

How Will The Money Be Used

The money you provide will be used for making music videos, formulating, preparing and promoting The We Are One Band for live performances and hiring a PR or marketing firm to get media exposure. 

What I am Offering You in Return

The perks are plentiful and range from signed cd's to being in my next music video and live performances by me or me and The We Are One Band at your location.

Contribute Non-Financial Support

If you are not in a position to offer financial support and want to contribute We Need You!! Be an ambassador for the Izzy James Project by sharing my music with music directors of your spiritual organization or church, post on FB, Youtube, blogs you frequent any place where people can see or hear this music!

The goal is exposure and anything that helps achieve that is vital to this project.

Help me do my part to change the Tone of the world!

Love & Light,

Izzy

story:
Hey beautiful people!

My name is Noah (aka NoMBe). I'm a musician originally from Germany now residing in beautiful California to pursue art in the form of music.

Today, I'm on IndieGoGo to raise funds for the completion and promotion of my upcoming EP entitled Mood Indigo along with a music video for it's main single "California Girls".

Some background info on California Girls: Like most recordings - it started in my bedroom around 2 AM one night, with a simple guitar lick, just an idea at this point. I worked with minimal equipment, but somehow managed to mix the song to a point at which it was digestible enough for the online community. Fast forward 4 months, I released it on Soundcloud and could've never anticipated the tremendous success it's had so far: reaching #1 on Hype Machine AND 22Tracks for three whole days, beating off huge artists like Kendrick Lamar & Bruno Mars! Not just that, but it generated over 200,000 plays in less than 3 weeks and even gets international radio play now!!! 

https://soundcloud.com/nombe

I've spent my whole life preparing for this career path and worked very hard to get to this point. A point at which I have ideas I'm excited to share with you and a whole team that believes in my work that is ready to push!

Making quality music and visuals can get quite expensive. There are fee's for production, mixing, mastering, distribution, PR and merchandise on the music side and rental fees, insurance, permits, crew & accommodation for the music video.

Your contribution will enable us all to advance to the next level in our respective careers. Getting this project on the way is a huge step and we've already laid a lot of the ground work, but now we need YOUR help to take it to the next level! Any contribution makes a big difference and gets us so much closer to achieving our goal!

Please check the rewards I came up with and lastly, I know money's tight not just for me (just you reading this means a lot!!!) so if you can't make a financial contribution please do spread the word, share the music and just enjoy the art. After all that's what it's for...

Thank you for taking your time & support !!!

With much love,

Noah

story:
Who are we?

  Subliminal code is a Venezuela Harsh Ebm band currently are the only band of the genre active within the country in recent years our country's economy us restricts more and more the possibility of acquisition of new equipment, working with renowned artist ,and even the possibility of being able to touch out of our country. 

is the magnitude of the problem economic our country , charged 80% of the population pay minimum wage ( 5600bsf = € 18 ) per month, and is the restriction of purchase dollars  in a single € 270  per year (93 €EVERY 4 MONTHS)

so this campaign is important for us to work on what will be our new full album which we hope his departure at the end of 2016  , without lowering the quality and our first music video . and for that, we need your help!


WHAT WE NEED

Video Music :

Subliminal Code will be traveling to "CARACAS" for 3 days to record this videoclip with cam engineer, recording artist, and equip . Your donation will contribute towards the following costs.

  • 3 days of tracking = approx € 300
  • Pre-Production = approx €600
  • Production and promotion = approx € 1000

New Album (2016) :

  • Studio Time : approx € 300
  • Mixing  : approx € 1000 
  • Mastering  : approx € 700 
  • CD Artwork:  approx €350
  • CD Photoshoot:  approx €150
  • Future Promotion:  approx €350
  • Guitar Recording and rent amp head:  approx €150
  • Remix : approx €100 per Remix
  • **Indiegogo take 5% if pledge is reached and 9% if not    

what you can do

As a way of saying "thank you," we will be offering exclusive early downloads of the album as well as hard copies. Donors may also receive shirts, and more! Check out the perks in the column on the right side. -->

If we don't make our goal, your dollars will still go to finishing the video Musical and, mastering, and promotion; the budget will just be adjusted down. If we bust over, we just have more time perfecting the mix!

Any extra capital raised beyond this goal would go towards powerful media publicity efforts including more cool video clips.

all of the released material is exclusive only to this campaign... help us and have any of these exclusive rewards

The Soldier Of Hell Reborn is The EP Soldier Of Hell , Re-recorded, Re-composite,  Re-mixed, Re-mastered, alternate artwork plus a massive high-quality bonus Exclusive Remix  ... and adapted to our New sound

This version for Indiegogo Campaign will have Exclusive Bonus Tracks and Remix

Other Ways You Can Help

We know times can be tough and money can be tight, so even if you can't chip in $5, please share this campaign on all social media outlets and help us spread the word!

Please  use the Indiegogo share tools! They make it easy for you to help tell the world!

If you are unable to Pre-order at this time, no worry! you can still help in several  important ways:

direct people to my IndieGogo page.

share the campaign video on your FB page.

email your friends and family around the world (this system works the best).

tell music magazines/websites/blogs/other relevant pro's about my project.

tell your friends directly (old school style.... offline). 

Any noise you can make to let others know is a beautiful sound! Thank you! There are wonderful and easily accessed tools on IndieGogo that will help you share this campaign . 

For now, you are welcome to:

Read the important info below. 

And, if you wish to Pre-order the album then check on the right side for the amount you wish to choose and the corresponding list of perks.

I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart.
